So, if they hold aloof from you, refrain from fighting against you and come out for peace, then Allâh does not allow you to fight against them.

91.MunirMezyed2023: You will find others who seek security from you (by making a false profession of faith), and from their own people (by worshiping whatever they worship). Whenever the temptation of Apostasy arises, they plunge into it. If they do not keep aloof from you, nor do they come out for peace, nor do they hold their hands, then seize them and slay them wherever you encounter them (in the battlefield). Against these people, We have given you full authority over them.

92.MunirMezyed2023: It is not possible that a monotheistic believer to kill another except by mistake. And whoever kills a monotheistic believer by accident must free a monotheistic slave and pay restitution (blood-money) to the family of the victim unless they remit it as alms. However, if the victim, he himself is a believer, and belongs to a people who are at war with you, then the murderer must free a monotheistic slave. If the victim belongs to people with whom you have a peace treaty, then the murderer must pay the restitution (blood-money) to the family of the victim and free a monotheistic slave. If then the murderer is unable to find a slave to free, then he will atone by fasting two consecutive months in order to seek repentance from Allâh. Allâh is Ever All-Knowing- All-Wise.

93.MunirMezyed2023: And whoever kills a monotheistic believer intentionally, his requital shall be Hellfire to abide therein. Lo! the wrath and the curse of Allâh are upon him. And a vehement chastisement is prepared for him.

94.MunirMezyed2023: O' you who live by Faith! when you go forth to fight in the cause of Allâh, investigate properly before you start fighting, and do not say to any one who offers peace: “You are not a believer”- seeking the spoils of this worldly life. But with Allâh there are infinite spoils. You too were such before, then Allâh bestowed His favors upon you. So investigate properly!   Most assuredly Allâh is Ever Well-Aware of whatever you do.

95.MunirMezyed2023: Those Monotheistic Believers who stay home- except those with valid excuses- are by no means equal to those who strive and fight in the cause of Allâh with their wealth and their lives. Allâh has preferred in grades those who strive and fight in the cause of Allâh with their wealth and their lives above those who sit (at home). To each, Allâh has promised good reward. But Allâh has preferred those who strive and fight in His cause above those who stay home by much greater reward.

96.MunirMezyed2023: Degrees of rank bestowed by Him, as well as forgiveness and mercy. For Allâh is Ever Oft-Forgiving- Most Merciful.

97.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed, when the Angels take the souls of those who have wronged themselves, rebuking them: “What were you after?”. They reply: "We were weak and oppressed on earth". The Angels ask: “Was not the earth of Allâh vast enough for you to emigrate therein?". These are ones whose eternal home is Hellfire - What a dreadful journey's end!

98.MunirMezyed2023: Except those who are really weak and oppressed among men, women and children, who lack strength and courage to change their lives, or to find a way to emigrate.

99.MunirMezyed2023: For these, there is a hope that Allâh will pardon them. Allâh is Ever Oft Pardoning, Oft-Forgiving.

100.MunirMezyed2023: Whoever emigrates for the cause of Allâh will find many dwelling places and abundant resources on the earth. Whoever leaves his home as an emigrant to Allâh and His Messenger, then death overtakes him, (can rest assured that) his reward has already been secured with Allâh.  And Allâh is Ever Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

101.MunirMezyed2023: When you travel through the land, you would not be at fault if you shorten the Prayer; if you fear that those who persistently refuse to yield to the Truth may attack you. Indeed, they are your open enemy.

102.MunirMezyed2023: When you, (O’ Muhammad), are among them, and you call them for Prayer, ask only a party of them to stand with you to Prayer and let them carry their arms. Then when they have performed their prostration, let them take their positions in the rear and then ask another party who has not yet prayed to come forward and pray with you, letting them be vigilant and armed. Those who persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth would wish to see you neglecting your arms and belongings so that they may launch a surprise attack against you. You would not be at fault if you lay aside your arms due to injuries caused by heavy rain or due to illness. But you should always take your precautions. Most assuredly Allâh has prepared for those who are spiritually dead and blind a disgraceful punishment.

103.MunirMezyed2023: Therefore when you complete your Prayer, celebrate the praise of Allâh and declare His glory while standing or sitting or lying down on your sides. When you are safe, then establish the regular Prayer. Indeed, Prayer is enjoined on those who live by Faith at specific times.

104.MunirMezyed2023: And do not slacken in pursuing the enemy- If it happens that you suffer, (be sure that) they suffer even as you suffer, and you expect to receive from Allâh what they can never hope. And Allâh is Ever All-Knowing, All-Wise.

105.MunirMezyed2023: Verily We have revealed to you the Book with the truth so that you may judge between people in accordance with what Allâh has shown you. So refute strongly the (argument of) the traitors.

106.MunirMezyed2023: And seek the Forgiveness of Allâh! Most certainly Allâh is Ever Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

107.MunirMezyed2023: Do not be an advocate on behalf of those who act unfaithfully towards their own selves. Verily Allâh does not demonstrate His own love for the one who is treacherous and sinful.

108.MunirMezyed2023: They may hide their evil deeds from the people, but they cannot hide them from Allâh. He is with them by His Knowledge when they harbor at night ideas, which He disapproves. And Allâh ever encompasses what they do.

109.MunirMezyed2023: Ah! You are of those who may argue on their behalf in this worldly life. But who will venture to argue with Allâh on their behalf on the Day of Resurrection, or who will then be their advocate?.

110.MunirMezyed2023: And whoever commits evil, or wrongs himself, then implores Allâh for forgiveness, will find Allâh Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

111.MunirMezyed2023: And whoever commits an evil deed- it is only to his own loss. And Allâh is Ever All-Knowing, All-Wise.

112.MunirMezyed2023: And whoever commits an evil or sinful deed and then casts it upon the innocent person, he has thereby burdened himself with calumny and a flagrant sin.

113.MunirMezyed2023: And were it not for the grace of Allâh upon you, as well as His Mercy, a party of them would have certainly devised a plot to bring you down to ruin. However, they cannot bring aught down to ruin but their own selves nor can they harm you. And Allâh has revealed to you this Glorious Qur’ān, given you the spirit of wisdom, and taught you that which you had no knowledge (of it before). Ever great is the grace of Allâh to you.

114.MunirMezyed2023: There is no good in most of their secret talks except (in his) who enjoins voluntary almsgiving, kindness or reconciliation between people. Whoever does this, seeking the good pleasure of Allâh, We shall give him a mighty reward.

115.MunirMezyed2023: And whoever opposes the Messenger after the Knowledge of Truth has been distinctly conveyed to him, and willfully follows a path other than that of those who Live by Faith, We will let him pursue the path he has chosen for himself, and cast him into the Gehenna - what a dreadful shelter!

116.MunirMezyed2023: Surely Allâh does not forgives setting up partners in worship with Him, but forgives all besides that to whom He wills. Verily whoever sets up a partner with Allâh has gone far away from the path of truth.

117.MunirMezyed2023: The Polytheists implore and pray to nothing but female deities besides Allâh. Actually, they implore and pray to none but rebellious devil,

118.MunirMezyed2023: Whom Allâh has cursed for having said: ‘Most surely I will take a certain fixed portion of Your servants.

119.MunirMezyed2023: I will certainly deceive them into going away from the path of truth, and stir up vain desires in them. I will certainly order them to slit the ears of cattle and to change the true nature that was created by Allâh. And whoever takes Satan for a patron has certainly incurred a great loss upon himself.

120.MunirMezyed2023: Satan gives them (false) promises and stirs up vain desires in them. However, the promises of Satan are nothing but manifest delusions.

121.MunirMezyed2023: For these people, their abode will be Gehenna. They will not be able to find a way to escape from it.

122.MunirMezyed2023: Those who live by Faith and strive to do righteous acts, We will admit them into gardens with rivers flowing beneath to abide therein. Such is the truthful promise of Allâh. Who is more truthful in word than Allâh?.

123.MunirMezyed2023: Entering Al-Jannah will not be in accordance with your own whims or the whims of the people of the Book. Whoever does an evil work will be requited for it and will not find for himself besides Allâh a guardian or a benefactor.

124.MunirMezyed2023: Any monotheistic believer, male or female,  does righteous acts will enter Al-Jannah, and will not be wronged, not even as much as a hair on a date-seed.

125.MunirMezyed2023: Who is better in Faith than the one who submits (himself entirely to) Allâh, while pursuing righteousness and perfection, and following the creed of Abraham, the (Genuine) Monotheistic Faith? Allâh took Abraham as a close friend.

126.MunirMezyed2023: Unto Allâh belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is on the earth. And Allâh is Ever Encompassing all things.

127.MunirMezyed2023: They seek your legal advice about the rights of women. Say: “Allâh has already instructed you about their rights, and that which is recited to you in the Book concerning the rights of the orphan girls whom you give not what is prescribed for them and yet whom you desire to marry, as also concerning the weak among children, and that you ought to deal justly with orphans. Consequently, whatever good thing you do, (be sure) Allâh is Ever All-Aware of it.”

128.MunirMezyed2023: When a wife fears cruelty or desertion on the part of her husband, then the couple would not be at fault if they put forward the terms for peace between them. Reconciliation is better although greed is part of human nature! If you seek to do good and act piously, (then you can rest assured that) Allâh is indeed Ever Well-Acquainted with what you do.

129.MunirMezyed2023: You will never ever be able to deal fairly with more than one wife, no matter how hard you strive. Now, therefore, do not be completely inclined to one while leaving the other one hanging in midair. However, If you make amends and act piously, (you can rest assured that) Allâh is indeed  Ever Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

130.MunirMezyed2023: But If they decided to separate, Allâh would enrich both of them from His bounties. And Allâh is Ever All-Sufficient, All-Wise.

131.MunirMezyed2023: Unto Allâh belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is on the earth. Indeed, We had commended the People of the Book before you to act piously towards Allâh. So we commend you the same thing. However, if you refuse to Yield to the Truth (then you’ll need to know that) whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is on the earth does belong to Allâh, and that Allâh is Self-sufficient, Worthy of all praise.

132.MunirMezyed2023: Unto Allâh belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is on the earth. And Allâh is All-Sufficient as a Trustee.

133.MunirMezyed2023: If He wills He can (easily) terminate you, O’ people, and bring others instead of you. Lo! Allâh is Ever All-Potent over that.

134.MunirMezyed2023: And whoever desires the reward of this worldly life, (let him be sure that) Allâh possesses the reward of this worldly life, as well as  the reward of Hereafter. And Allâh is Ever All-Hearer, All-Seer.

135.MunirMezyed2023: O' you who live by Faith, be strict in maintaining justice. And be witnesses for Allâh even though it might be against your own selves, or your parents, or close relatives, whether the one under suspicion is rich or poor. Allâh must be given priority over them. Now, therefore, do not let your own whims lead you to act inequitably. And If you hide the truth or evade it, then (you’ll need to know that) Allâh is Ever Well-Acquainted with whatsoever you do.

136.MunirMezyed2023: O' you who live by Faith! place your faith in Allâh and His Messenger, as well as in the Qur'an which He has revealed to His Messenger, and also in the Scripture which He revealed before. So whoever is tempted to reject  Allâh, His Angels, His Books, His Messengers and the Last Day, has surely gone far away from the path of truth.

137.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed, those who adhere to Faith, then renounce their faith and then again adhere to Faith, then renounce their faith,- only increasing in Apostasy - Allâh will  neither forgive them nor show them where to go.

138.MunirMezyed2023: Let those who indulge in hypocrisy know that they will be subjected to a painful punishment (in the Hereafter).

139.MunirMezyed2023: They take those who are spiritually dead and blind for friends instead of those who Live by Faith. Is it glory they seek among them? Most certainly All Glory belongs unto Allâh.

140.MunirMezyed2023: It has already been revealed to you in the Qur’ān that whenever you hear people denying and ridiculing the Verses of Allâh, do not sit with them unless they start to talk of other things, or else you yourselves will become like them. Lo! Allâh will gather those who indulge in hypocrisy and those who are spiritually dead and blind all together into Gehenna.

141.MunirMezyed2023: Those who indulge in hypocrisy watch to see what he will happen to you: if you gain a victory from Allâh, they say: "Were we not with you?" But if those who are spiritually dead and blind have the opportunity  for success, they will say: “Had we not prevailed over you, and protected you from the Monotheistic Believers?" So Allâh will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection. And Allâh will never let those who are spiritually dead and blind be prevailed over those who live by Faith.

142.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed, Those who indulge in hypocrisy think that they can beguile Allâh. But it is He Who will render them for their attempt. When they stand up for Prayer, they stand up lazily. Lo! They do it only to be seen by men.  And they do not celebrate the praise of Allâh but a little,

143.MunirMezyed2023: Swaying in between (right and wrong), belonging neither to these nor to those. And and whom Allah allows to go astray, you will not find a way for him.

144.MunirMezyed2023: O' you who live by Faith! do not take those who are spiritually dead and blind as allies or friends instead of those who live by Faith. Do you want to give Allâh a manifest proof against you?.

145.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed, those who indulge in hypocrisy will be in the lowest depths of the Fire, and you will find no helper for them;

146.MunirMezyed2023: Except for those who repent, make amends, hold fast to Allâh, and perform their duties towards Allâh faithfully, then they will be with those who live by Faith. And Allâh will grant those who live by Faith a great reward.

147.MunirMezyed2023: Why would Allâh chastise you if you are grateful and devout? And Allâh is Ever All-Appreciative, All-Knowing.

148.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh does not demonstrate His own love for public utterance of anything evil- except by one who has been wronged. And Allâh is Ever All-Hearer- All-Knowing.

149.MunirMezyed2023: If you you do good openly or in secret, or pardon others for their faults, (then you can rest assured that) Allâh is Ever Oft-Pardoning- All-Powerful.

150.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed, those who have no Faith in Allâh and His Messengers, and desire to make distinction between Allâh and His Messengers, and say: "We believe in some and reject others”, seeking to pursue a path in between -

151.MunirMezyed2023: Those in truth are the ones who have no tendency to live by Faith. And We have prepared for them an extremely disgraceful punishment.

152.MunirMezyed2023: Those who place their faith in Allâh and His Messengers, and make no distinction between any of them, Allâh will surely give them their rewards in full. For Allâh is Ever Oft-Forgiving- Most Merciful.

153.MunirMezyed2023: The People of the Book ask you to bring down a book upon them from the heavens. Indeed, they asked Moses for even greater than that. They said: ‘Show us Allâh in person’. So a thunderbolt seized them  for their iniquitous deeds. Then they took the Calf for worship after having received the Full knowledge of Truth. Yet, We pardoned all this. And We gave Moses a Decisive Argument.

154.MunirMezyed2023: We raised the Mount (Sinai) high above them (to warn them against) their covenant. We said to them: ‘Enter the gate humbly’. We also warned them: ‘Do not violate the Sabbath’. And We took from them a solemn covenant.

155.MunirMezyed2023: (Allâh has deprived them of His blessing) because of their breaking of their covenant, for their persistent denial of the Revelations of Allâh, for unjustly killing the prophets and for saying: ‘Our hearts are  enveloped‘. In fact, Allâh has set a seal on their hearts for their persistent and purposeful denial of the Truth, and for their little Faith.

156.MunirMezyed2023: (Likewise Allâh has deprived them of His blessing) for their persistent and purposeful denial of the Truth, and for the hideous calumny which they utter against Mary,

157.MunirMezyed2023: And for their saying that they killed the Messiah, Jesus son of Mary, the Apostle of Allâh. And yet they did not kill him and neither did they crucify him, but so it was made to appear to them. Verily, those who differ therein are utterly confused. They have no definite knowledge of it except pursuit of a conjecture.They certainly did not kill him.

158.MunirMezyed2023: In fact, Allâh has raised him to Himself. And Allâh is Ever All-Powerful- All-Wise.

159.MunirMezyed2023: (After the return of Jesus), there is not one of the People of the Book but will believe in Jesus before his death. And on Day of Resurrection, he will bear witness against them.

160.MunirMezyed2023: And because of the iniquity of those who are Jews, We have forbidden them certain good things that were lawful for them, and because of their barring many people from the path of Allâh,

161.MunirMezyed2023: And because of their taking usury which was prohibited for them, and their devouring the property of people wrongfully. So We have prepared for the impious among them a painful punishment.

162.MunirMezyed2023: There are among them some who are firmly and deeply planted in the spiritual knowledge and enlightenment, and the devout who believe in what has been revealed to you and that which was revealed before you: And (especially) those who establish the regular Prayer and pay Zakāt and believe in Allâh and  the Last Day,  they are the ones to whom We shall give a mighty reward.

163.MunirMezyed2023: Verily We have revealed to you just as We revealed to Noah and the Prophets (who came) after him. And We (also) revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, the Descendants, Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron and Solomon. And unto David We gave the Psalms.

164.MunirMezyed2023: We inspired other Messengers whom We have mentioned to you before, as well as others Messengers whom We have not mentioned to you.  Allâh spoke directly, without mediation, to Moses.

165.MunirMezyed2023: (All these) Messengers were sent to give glad tidings and to deliver a severe warning so that people will not have any argument of excuse before Allâh after the Messengers had been sent to them. And Allâh is Ever All-Powerful, All-Wise.

166.MunirMezyed2023: Lo! Allâh testifies that whatever He has revealed to you, He has revealed it with His Knowledge, and the Angels also testify to it. Sufficient is Allâh as a Witness.

167.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed, as for those who have no tendency to live by Faith, and hinder the people from the path of Allâh, they have gone far away from the path of Truth.

168.MunirMezyed2023: Surely those who persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth, and consciously abandon the Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims- it is not for Allâh to forgive them, neither to guide them to any path,

169.MunirMezyed2023: Except for the path that leads to Gehenna wherein they will live forever . And that is ever easy for Allâh.

170.MunirMezyed2023: O’ mankind, the Messenger has indeed come to you with Knowledge of the Truth from your Lord. So it is for your own benefit to believe in him. But If you persistently refuse to yield to the Truth, (then you’ll need to know that) whatsoever is in the heavens or on the earth belongs unto Allâh. And He is Ever All-Knowing- All-Wise.

171.MunirMezyed2023: O’ People of the Book! do not exceed the limits in your Faith or utter aught concerning Allâh except the truth. The Messiah, Jesus son of Mary, was not more than a Messenger of Allâh and His Word, which He sent to Mary, and a spirit proceeding from Him. Now, therefore, affirm your faith in Allâh and His Messengers.And do not say: "Three". It is better for you to refrain (from believing in the Trinity). Indeed, Allâh is but One True God. Exalted is He above having a son. Unto Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And Allâh is All-Sufficient as a Trustee.

172.MunirMezyed2023: The Messiah (himself) would never disdain to be a servant of Allâh, nor would the Angels who are near to Him. And whoever disdains the worship of Allâh and displays an arrogant attitude, Allâh will gather them all together to Himself,

173.MunirMezyed2023: Then, as for those who Live by Faith and strive to do righteous acts, He will pay them their rewards in full and give them more out of His bounty. As for those who disdain and display an arrogant attitude, He will chastise them with a painful punishment. So they will not find for themselves, other than Allâh, either a guardian or helper.

174.MunirMezyed2023: O’ mankind! Indeed, there has come to you a decisive argument from your Lord. And We have sent down to you a brilliant light- (this Qur’ān).

175.MunirMezyed2023: Then as for those who have Absolute Faith in Allâh and hold fast to Him, He will admit them into a mercy and grace from Him and lead them into Himself on a right path.

176.MunirMezyed2023: They seek your legal advice. Say: “Allâh has already instructed you about the dead one who has neither parents nor children. If a man dies, leaving a sister, but no child, she will have half the inheritance. If she dies first, then he will inherit her if she left no children. If there are two sisters, they will have two-thirds of the inheritance. If the siblings are men and women, the male will get twice the  of the female".  Allâh makes things clear to you so that you will not be deceived into going away from the truth.  And Allâh has the full knowledge of everything.

1.MunirMezyed2023: O' you who Live by Faith! Fulfill your covenants. Livestock animals are made lawful to you as food, except for that which is recited to you (in this  Qur’ān). Hunting is not lawful for you during Pilgrimage or Umrah. Indeed, Allâh ordains whatever He chooses.

2.MunirMezyed2023: O' you who Live by Faith! Do not infringe the sanctity of the symbols,  nor the Sacred Months, nor the offerings, nor the garlanded, nor the people going to the Sacred House seeking the grace and pleasure of their Lord. When you are free from the duties of Pilgrimage, then you can go for hunting. Do not let your hatred of a folk- because they hindered you from entering into the Sacred Mosque - lead you to commit aggression. Now, therefore, cooperate with each other on righteousness and piety and do not collaborate with each other on iniquity and transgression. Most certainly Allâh is extremely severe in punishment.

3.MunirMezyed2023: Forbidden to you (for food) is carrion, blood, the flesh of swine, the meat of animal of that which has been offered a sacrifice to other than Allâh (or on which the name of Allâh has not been mentioned while slaughtering), or that which is strangled to death, or that which is beaten to death, or that which has a fatal fall, or that which is gored by horns, or that from which the wild animal has eaten, except for what you are able to slaughter it before dying, or that which is sacrificed on stone altars. It is forbidden also to use arrows seeking luck or decision as this is grave disobedience. This day, those who persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth have given up all hope of your Faith. Now, therefore, do not stand in awe of them, but show honor and reverence only for Me. This day, I have perfected your religion for you, completed My Favor upon you; and I have chosen for you Islam as a religion. Consequently, whoever is forced by severe hunger with no intention of sinning (can rest assured that) Allâh is certainly Oft-Forgiving- Most Merciful.

4.MunirMezyed2023: They ask you, (O’ Muhammad), what is made lawful for them as food. Say: "It is made lawful for you to eat pure and wholesome (food), and that which you have trained the birds and beasts of prey to catch. You train them according to what Allâh has taught you, so eat from that which they catch for you, pronounce the name of Allâh over it and act piously toward Allâh. Indeed, Allâh is extremely Swift in taking account."

5.MunirMezyed2023: This day all wholesome and good things are made lawful for you. The food of those who have obtained the Scripture is made lawful for you, and yours is made lawful for them. It is made lawful for you (to wed) the chaste women from the Monotheistic Believers and chaste women from those who have obtained the Scripture which was revealed before your time. Thus, (You can wed them) when you give them their due dowers in case you desire chastity, not seeking to commit lewdness or secret intrigues. Whosoever renounces his Faith, his deeds are worthless. And in the Hereafter, he will be among those who are doomed to perdition.

6.MunirMezyed2023: O' you who Live by Faith! When you intend to perform Prayer, wash your faces, your forearms to the elbows, lightly rub your heads, and do wash your feet to the ankles. If it happens that you are in a state of ceremonial impurity, then you must wash your whole body. But if you are ill, or on a journey, or one of you coming from the privy, or you have been in contact with women, and you find no water for ablution, then pick up some wholesome dust and wipe your faces and your hands with it. Allâh does not intend to let you experience hardship, but He intends to purify you and complete His Favor upon you so that you may express your gratitude (to Him for His endless blessings).

7.MunirMezyed2023: Remember the favor of Allâh upon you and the covenant with which He bound you when you said: "We hear and comply (with everything Allâh has commanded)." Subsequently, act piously towards Allâh. Indeed, Allâh has full knowledge of what is stored up in the hearts.

8.MunirMezyed2023: O' you who Live by Faith! Be persistently standing firm for Allâh, witnesses in justice and do not let the hatred of a people prevent you from being fair. Now, therefore, act fairly and proportionately, that is nearer to unfeigned piety. Subsequently, act piously toward Allâh. Most certainly Allâh is Completely Aware of whatever you do.

9.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh has promised those who Live by Faith and strive to do righteous acts (in this worldly life), that they will have Forgiveness and a mighty reward.

10.MunirMezyed2023: But as for those who persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth and deny what We have revealed of the knowledge of the Truth, they will be the Denizens of the Gehenna.

11.MunirMezyed2023: O' you who Live by Faith! Remember the favor of Allâh upon you when some people determined to stretch out their hands against you, He restrained their hands from you. Subsequently, let those who Live by Faith depend on Allâh with full trust.

12.MunirMezyed2023: Verily Allâh took the covenant from the Children of Israel.  And We raised up among them twelve leaders. Allâh said: ‘I am with you if you establish the regular Prayer, pay Zakāt and believe in My Messengers while honoring and assisting them, and giving Allâh a good loan. I will definitely deliver you from all the consequences of your iniquitous deeds and admit you into Gardens underneath which rivers flow.  So whoever of you renounces his Faith after this, surely he has been deceived into going away from path of truth.’

13.MunirMezyed2023: As a result of their breach of their covenant, We cursed them and caused their hearts to grow hard. They alter the words from their genuine context and fail to look after a portion of that whereof they were admonished. You will always continue to witness a deceptive action from their part except that of a few. Now, therefore, forgive and show clemency toward them. Surely Allâh demonstrates His own love for those who pursue righteousness and perfection in Faith.

14.MunirMezyed2023: Likewise, We also took a covenant from those who call themselves Christians, but they too have failed to look after a portion of that whereof they were admonished. For that reason, We stirred among them enmity and hatred, which will continue to exist up until the Day of Resurrection. Lo! Allâh will soon inform them of what they used to do.

15.MunirMezyed2023: O’ People of the Book! Indeed Our Messenger has come to you to clarify for you much of what you used to conceal from the Scripture and to pass over much which is no longer substantial. Verily, there has come to you from Allâh Light  and an irrefutable  Book:

16.MunirMezyed2023: Wherewith Allâh inspires all those who pursue His good pleasure to paths of peace. He brings them out of darkness into light by His decree, and inspires them to a straight path (to Salvation).

17.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, those who say: ‘Allâh is the Messiah, son of Mary,’ have abandoned their unfeigned Faith (in favour of their whims). Say: ‘Who possesses the power to prevent Allâh if He intends to cause the Messiah, son of Mary, to perish, as well as his mother and all those who are on the earth together?’ Unto Allâh belongs the (absolute) sovereignty of the heavens, the earth and all that is between them. He creates whatever He wills. And Allâh is Most Capable of doing whatsoever He desires.

18.MunirMezyed2023: Both the Jews and the Christians say: ‘We are the children of Allâh and His loved ones.’ Say: ‘Why, then, does He chastise you for your sinful and immoral acts?’ Nay, you are no more than human beings from among those whom He has created. He forgives whom He wills, and chastises whom He wills. Unto Allâh belongs the (absolute) sovereignty of the heavens, the earth and of all that is between them. And to Him is the journey’s end.

19.MunirMezyed2023: O’ People of the Book! Indeed Our Messenger has come to you to clarify for you (some religious matters) after a cessation of the Apostles lest you say: ‘There has not come to us any Herald of glad tidings or Messenger. Now there has come to you a Messenger who bears glad tidings and delivers a severe warning. Allâh is Most Capable of doing whatever He desires.

20.MunirMezyed2023: And (mention) when Moses said unto his people: "O’ my people, remember the favor of Allâh upon you when He raised Prophets among you, made you kings and gave you what He had not given anyone among the peoples.

21.MunirMezyed2023: O’ my people, enter the Holy Land which Allâh has appointed to you. Do not turn in flight lest you turn back as losers.”

22.MunirMezyed2023: They said: ‘O’ Moses, it is indeed inhabited by people of great might and power. And we will not be able to make entry unless they depart from it. If it happens that they depart from it, then we will definitely make entry.’

23.MunirMezyed2023: Then two men of those who show honor and reverence for Allâh, and on whom Allâh bestowed His favor, said: ‘Enter in upon them by the gate, for when you have entered it, you will definitely be victorious. So depend on Allâh with full trust if you live a life of Genuine Faith.

24.MunirMezyed2023: They said: ‘O’ Moses, we shall never enter it as long as they are there. Now, therefore, go, you and your Lord, and fight. Surely We are going to stay right here.’

25.MunirMezyed2023: Moses said: ‘O’ my Lord, I have no authority over anyone except myself and my brother. Now, therefore, separate us from those who indulge in personal disobedience extensively without repentance.’

26.MunirMezyed2023: The Lord said: ‘Verily, the land will certainly be forbidden for them for forty years, (during which) they will wander through the land. Now, therefore, do not grieve over those who indulge in personal disobedience extensively without repentance.’

27.MunirMezyed2023: And relate to them the tale of the two sons of Adam with truth, how each of them made an offering to Him, and it accepted from one, but not from the other. (And Cain) said: ‘Be sure I am going to kill you.’ (Abel) replied: ‘Allâh (Almighty) accepts only from those who are Pious.

28.MunirMezyed2023: Even if it happens that you stretch out your hand against me so as to kill me, be sure I will not stretch out mine against you so as to kill you. Indeed, I show honor and reverence for the Lord of all the beings.

29.MunirMezyed2023: Verily I intend to let you bear the sin (of killing me) along with your other iniquitous deeds, then you will be among the Denizens of Hell. That is the requital of those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims.

30.MunirMezyed2023: However, his ego induced him to kill his own brother, so he killed him, becoming among those who are doomed to perdition.

31.MunirMezyed2023: Then Allâh sent a raven scratching into the earth in order to show him how to bury the naked corpse of his brother. He says: ‘Woe betide me! How was it that I was unable to be like this raven and bury the corpse of my brother?’ So he became of those who feel bitter regret.

32.MunirMezyed2023: That is why We prescribed for the Children of Israel that whoever kills a human being unjustly -- except as punishment for murder or for spreading corruption in the land --  it will be as if he killed all mankind. In the meantime, whoever saves a life, it will be as if he saved the whole of mankind. Verily Our Messengers came to them with the Decisive Signs, even then after that many of them became prodigals on the earth.

33.MunirMezyed2023: The rightful chastisement for those who wage war against (the religion of) Allâh and (against) His Messenger, and endeavor to spread corruption on the earth, is that they should be murdered, or crucified, or their hands and feet should be cut off on opposite sides, or be expelled from the land. This will be their ignominy in this worldly life, and in the Hereafter, they will subjected to an extremely dreadful doom,

34.MunirMezyed2023: Except for those who express sincere regret before they fall into your power. In that case, you must know that Allâh is Oft-Forgiving- Most Merciful.

35.MunirMezyed2023: O’ you who Live by Faith! Act piously towards Allâh, seek to come closer to Him and strive hard in His cause so that you my ultimately achieve a blissful life / or gain eternal salvation.

36.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, those who persistently refuses to Yield to the Truth- if they had all that is on the earth and twice as much again and offered it to ransom their own selves from the (divine) penalty of the Day of Resurrection, it would not be accepted from them. Theirs will be a mighty punishment.

37.MunirMezyed2023: They will struggle hard to come out from the Inferno, but they will never be able to. And they will be subjected to an everlasting punishment.

38.MunirMezyed2023: The thief, male or female, who persists in stealing, cut off (from the wrist joint) the (right) hand as a retribution for what they have gained, an exemplary punishment from Allâh. He is All-Vigorous- All-Wise.

39.MunirMezyed2023: But whosoever expresses sincere regret after his iniquitous deeds and strives to make amends, then (he can rest assured that) Allâh will surely turn to him in forgiveness. Most certainly Allâh is Oft-Forgiving- Most Merciful.

40.MunirMezyed2023: Are you unaware that unto Allâh belongs the (absolute) sovereignty of the heavens and the earth? He forgives and shows Mercy on whom He wills, and chastises whom He wills. And Allâh is Most Capable of doing whatsoever He wills.

41.MunirMezyed2023: O’ Messenger, do not let those who hasten towards spiritual darkness distress you- those who say: ‘We adhere to Faith’ with their tongues, but their hearts are not convinced because of the veracity of their faith. And of the Jews who listen to mendacity, paying close attention to other folk who are too arrogant to come to you, distorting the words out of  their genuine context, and saying: ‘If you are given this, then you must take it, but if you are not given this, then you must beware!’ Whosoever Allâh lets him fall into temptation, you will never have (the power to save) him from (the punishment) of Allâh. Those are the ones whose hearts Allâh does not intend to purify. For them is ignominy in this worldly life, as well as an extremely dreadful doom in the Hereafter.

42.MunirMezyed2023: They show a keen interest in listening to mendacity and devouring whatsoever is forbidden. So, if it happens that they come to you, then you can judge between them or you can turn away from them. However, if you decided to turn away from them, then they could never harm you at all. Subsequently, if you (decided to) judge, then judge with justice between them. Indeed, Allâh demonstrates His own love for those who treat people fairly and consistently.

43.MunirMezyed2023: How could it be possible to ask you to judge between them while they have the Torah in which is the judgment of Allâh? Yet they turn back after that. They are not truly living a life of Genuine Faith.

44.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, it is We Who revealed the Torah wherein there was the Full Knowledge of Truth and light by which the Prophets who wholly submitted themselves to Allâh used to make judgments for Jews. So too did the Pious Preachers and Rabbis as they were required to preserve the Scripture of Allâh. And they were witnesses thereto. Now, therefore, do not let the fear of people overtake you, but beware of My wrath. And do not voluntarily and consciously abandon what I have revealed in favour of small gain. Whoever does not judges by what Allâh has revealed, they are (indeed) the ones who have no tendency to live by Faith.

45.MunirMezyed2023: We ordained therein for them: Life for life, eye for eye, nose for nose, ear for ear, tooth for tooth, and for wounds retribution. But whoever remits the retribution as alms, it will be considered as an atonement for him. Whoever does not judges by what Allâh has revealed, they are (indeed) the ones who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims.

46.MunirMezyed2023: We also caused Jesus, son of Mary, to follow in the footsteps of those earlier Prophets, authenticating (the divine law) of the Torah which was revealed before him. And we gave him the Gospel containing the Full Knowledge of Truth and light, authenticating also (the divine law) of the Torah which was given before it as the True Source of Enlightenment, and Admonition for the Pious.

47.MunirMezyed2023: Let, then, the people of the Gospel, judge according to what Allâh has revealed therein. Whoever does not judges by what Allâh has revealed, they are (indeed) the ones who indulge in personal disobedience extensively without repentance.

48.MunirMezyed2023: We have also revealed to you this Glorious Qur’ān with the Full Knowledge of Truth, authenticating the Scripture that came before It and preserving the same safe from corruption. Now, therefore, judge between them by what Allâh has revealed. And do not voluntarily and consciously abandon the Full Knowledge of Truth that has been given unto you in favour of their own whims. To each of you We have prescribed a code of law and a particular method. Had Allâh willed, He could have made you one community. But (His Divine wisdom is) to try you in what He has given you respectively. Now, therefore, compete eagerly with each other in doing virtuous deeds since you are all bound to return to Allâh. Verily, He will inform you of that in which you used to differ.

49.MunirMezyed2023: Now, therefore, judge between them according to what Allâh has revealed (to you). And do not yield to their own whims.  But beware of them, lest they tempt you to swerve you from some of that which Allâh has revealed to you. If they are tempted to turn away, (then be sure that) Allâh intends to chastise them for some of their iniquitous deeds. Indeed, most of the people are indulging in personal disobedience extensively without repentance.

50.MunirMezyed2023: What! Do they endeavor to maintain the judgment of the time of ignorance? Who could be a better judge than Allâh for people who believe with absolute faith (in Him)?

51.MunirMezyed2023: O' you who Live by Faith! Do not take the Jews, or the Christians as trusted allies. They are but allies of one another. Nevertheless, whoever among you takes them as trusted allies has become one of them.  Surely Allâh holds back the Light of His inspiration from those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims.

52.MunirMezyed2023: Yet you can see those in whose hearts there is an infirmity hastening toward them, saying: ‘We fear lest a turn of fortune would impinge us.’ But perhaps Allâh will bring conquest or a command from Him so they will express sincere regret about that which they stored up secretly in their hearts.

53.MunirMezyed2023: Only then, those who Live by Faith will ask one another, ‘Are these the ones who swore by Allâh with their strongest oaths that they were with you?" Lo! Their works have been nullified, and they have become among those who are doomed to eternal perdition.

54.MunirMezyed2023: O’ you who Live by Faith! Whoever of you renounces his Faith, then Allâh will bring a people whom He loves and they love Him, humble towards those who live a life of Genuine Faith and stern towards those who are Spiritually dead and blind, striving hard in the cause of Allâh, not fearing the fury and vitriol of the those who cast blame. This is the bounty of Allâh which He bestows on whom He wills. And Allâh is All-Encompassing - All-Knowing.

55.MunirMezyed2023: Your only patron is Allâh, His Messenger, and the fellow believers who establish the regular Prayer, pay Zakāt  and bow down to worship.

56.MunirMezyed2023: Whoever chooses Allâh, His Messenger, and the Monotheistic Believers to be his guardians, (can rest assured that) the party of Allâh will certainly be the triumphant.

57.MunirMezyed2023: O’ you who Live by Faith! Do not take as patrons those who make your religion a subject of ridicule and a game from among those who were given the Scripture before you and those who persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth. And act piously towards Allâh if you truly live a life of Genuine Faith.

58.MunirMezyed2023: And when you proclaim your call to prayer, they take it as subject of ridicule and as a game. That is because they are a people who lack the ability to perceive and understand.

59.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "O’ People of the Scripture! Do you resent us for any other reason than because we believe in Allâh with Absolute Faith and in what has been revealed to us and what was revealed before and that most of you are indulge in personal disobedience extensively without repentance?

60.MunirMezyed2023: Say: ‘Shall I inform you of (what is) worse than that as requital from  Allâh? It is those who incurred the curse of Allâh and His wrath, some of whom He transformed into apes and pigs, and those who worship the devil (or the fabled gods). Theses are in worse plight and further astray from the established course. “

61.MunirMezyed2023: When they come to you, they say: ‘We adhere to Faith." Yet they entered into your company with void hearts and went forth from you with the same. But Allâh is Fully Aware of what they have stored up secretly in their hearts.

62.MunirMezyed2023: You can see many of them hastening to sin and transgression, and eating of things forbidden. Evil indeed is that which they have been doing.

63.MunirMezyed2023: Why do not the Pious Preachers and Rabbis forbid them from uttering evil words and from eating things forbidden? Evil indeed is that which they have been practicing.

64.MunirMezyed2023: And the of Jews say: ‘The hand of Allâh is tied up.’ Be tied up their own hands! They are deprived of His Mercy for what they said. Nay, but both His Hands are widely outspread. He expend as He wills. And what has been revealed to you from your Lord of the Qur’ān will surely increase many of them in insolence and spiritual darkness. We have cast among them enmity and hatred until the Day of Resurrection. So often as they will kindle a fire for war, Allâh will extinguish it. And they seek to spread corruption on the earth. And Allâh does not demonstrates His own love for the evildoers who spread corruption.

65.MunirMezyed2023: If only the People of the Book had remained true to their Faith and acted piously, We would certainly have delivered them from all the consequences of their iniquitous deeds and admitted them into the Gardens of Delight.

66.MunirMezyed2023: If only they had truly observed the Torah, the Gospel, and what has been revealed to them from their Lord, they would certainly have eaten of good things both from above them and from under their feet. Among them, there is a party on the right course- but how evil is that which many of them do!

67.MunirMezyed2023: O’ Messenger! Convey all of that which has been revealed to you from your Lord. And if it happens that you do not, then you have not conveyed His Message. And Allâh will establish and guard you against the (wicked) people. Most surely Allâh holds back the Light of His inspiration from those who are spiritually blind and dead.

68.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "O’ People of the Book! You follow nothing unless you truly observe the Torah, the Gospel and what has been revealed to you from your Lord.’  And what has been revealed to you from your Lord of the Qur’ān will surely increase many of them in insolence and spiritual darkness. Now, therefore, don’t grieve yourself for those who are spiritually blind and dead.

69.MunirMezyed2023: Most surely those who Live by Faith, and those who are Jews, Sabians and Christians, whoever of them believes in Allâh and the Last Day and strives to do righteous deed, there will come no fear on them, neither will they ever grieve.

70.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, We took the covenant of the Children of Israel, and sent Our Messengers to them. Whenever a Messenger came to them with what they themselves did not desire, some (of them) they called impostors, and some they sought to kill.

71.MunirMezyed2023: They presumed that there would be no affliction, so they became blind and deaf. Then Allâh turned to them in forgiveness. Afterwards many of them again became blind and deaf. And Allâh is the All-Seer of whatsoever they do.

72.MunirMezyed2023: They have certainly renounced their Monotheistic Faith who say: “Allâh is the Messiah, son of Mary, whereas Christ himself said: "O’ children of Israel, worship Allâh, my Lord and your Lord." Indeed, he who associates others with Allâh (must know that) Allâh will exclude him from Al-Jannah. His home will be Gehenna. As for those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims, there shall be no helpers to save them (from the punishment of  Allâh).

73.MunirMezyed2023: They have certainly renounced their Monotheistic Faith who say: “Allâh is  the third of three.” There is no other god, beside the One True God. If they do not refrain from what they say, an extremely painful doom will surely be inflicted on those among them who persistently refuse to acknowledge the (Absolute Oneness of Allâh).

74.MunirMezyed2023: So will they not turn towards Allâh in repentance and seek His forgiveness? Lo! Allâh is Oft-Forgiving- Most Merciful.

75.MunirMezyed2023: Christ, son of Mary, is not more than a Messenger like the other Messengers who have preceded him. His mother was a veracious woman of integrity. They both eat food. Look how We show them clearly (and impartially) the Signs. And look how they deviate from the path of truth!

76.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "Do you worship besides Allâh, that which cannot hurt or profit you? And Allâh is the One who is the All-Hearer- the All-Knowing."

77.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "O’ People of the Book! Do not exceed the limits in your religion beyond the Truth and do not yield to the whims of a people who have fallen away from the Faith, and who have deceived others into going away from the path of truth; and they themselves could not find the way to the truth.

78.MunirMezyed2023: Those who persistently refused to Yield to the Truth among the Children of Israel were cursed by the tongue of David, and  Jesus, son of Mary. (This befell them) because they refused to yield to the Truth and used to transgress.

79.MunirMezyed2023: They did not forbid one another from the iniquitous deeds, they were committing. Verily evil was what they used to do.

80.MunirMezyed2023: You can see many of them taking those who persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth as their guardians. Evil indeed is that which their own selves have sent before them. For that reason the wrath of Allâh abides in them. And in the torment  shall they live forever.

81.MunirMezyed2023: However, if they had believed in Allâh and the Prophet, as well as in what has been revealed to him, they would never have taken them for trusted allies. But most of them are indulging in personal disobedience extensively without repentance.

82.MunirMezyed2023: You will certainly find the most intense of the people in animosity towards those who Live by Faith are the Jews and those who associate others with Allâh.  And you will find the nearest of them in affection to those who Live by Faith are the ones who say: ‘We are indeed Christians.’ That is because there are priests and monks among them; and because they do not display an arrogant attitude (towards the authority of Allâh).

83.MunirMezyed2023: When they hear what has been revealed to this Messenger, you could see their eyes overflowing with tears because of the Truth which they have recognized. They say: ‘Our Lord, we adhere to the true Monotheistic Faith, so write us down among the witnesses.

84.MunirMezyed2023: And why should we not believe in Allâh and in the Truth which has been revealed to us? We earnestly hope that our Lord would enroll us among the righteous people.’

85.MunirMezyed2023: So Allâh will reward them for what they said with Gardens beneath which rivers flow. They will live therein forever. Such is the reward of those who pursue righteousness and perfection in Faith.

86.MunirMezyed2023: But those persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth and who voluntarily and consciously deny what We have revealed of the knowledge of the truth, they are the Denizens of the Hell.

87.MunirMezyed2023: O’ you who Live by Faith! Do not forbid the pure and wholesome things which Allâh has made lawful for you and transgress. Indeed, Allâh does not demonstrates His own love for the transgressors.

88.MunirMezyed2023: Now eat of the things which Allâh has provided for you, lawful and wholesome. And act piously toward Allâh in whom you trust.

89.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh will not call you to account for that which is unintentional in your oaths, but He will call you to account for breaking the oaths which you take in earnest. The atonement thereof, then, is the feeding of ten poor persons with such average food as you feed your own families with, or the clothing of them or the freeing of a slave. But whosoever does not finds the means will have to Fast for three days. This is the atonement of your oaths when you have sworn. Keep your oaths! This is how Allâh shows you clearly his Messages so that you may be grateful.

90.MunirMezyed2023: O’ you who Live by Faith! The intoxicants, the game of chance, (sacrifices at) altars and divining arrows are only the abomination of Satan. So shun each one of them so that you may ultimately achieve a blissful life / or gain eternal salvation.

91.MunirMezyed2023: The devil (Satan) intends only to create enmity and hatred among you by means of intoxicants and game of chance, and to keep you back from celebrating the praise of Allâh and declaring His glory, and from Prayer. So, will you not then refrain?

92.MunirMezyed2023: Yield (to the authority of Allâh) and (to what He has raveled) to His  Messenger. And be cautious and alert. But if it happens that you turn away, then you must know that the duty of Our Messenger is to convey clearly and openly the Message.

93.MunirMezyed2023: Those who Live by Faith and strive to do righteous deed would not be at fault in what they ate (in the past) if they act piously, live by Faith and strive to do righteous acts.  Once more again, if they act piously and live by Faith and then they act piously and pursue righteousness and perfection in Faith, then Allâh will demonstrate His own love for those who pursue righteousness and perfection in Faith.

94.MunirMezyed2023: O' you Live by Faith, Allâh will certainly try you in respect of some game which your hands and lances can reach so that Allâh may identify the one who shows honor and reverence for Him in secret. Whosoever, therefore, transgresses after this, will have an extremely painful doom.

95.MunirMezyed2023: O' you live by Faith!  Do not kill game while you are in state of holiness and purity. Whosoever among you kills it intentionally, its indemnification is a quadruped like to that which he has killed, as determined by two just men from among you, as an offering to be brought to Ka’bah, or as an atonement, he must feed a number of needy people, or the equivalent of that in Fasting, so that he may taste the consequence of his deed. And Allâh has pardoned what is past. But whoever reverts to it, Allâh will take retribution from him.

96.MunirMezyed2023: It is made lawful for you to hunt and to eat (fish) of the sea as a provision for you and for the travelers. But it is forbidden to you to hunt as long as you are in the state of holiness and purity. Now, therefore, act piously towards Allâh to whom you are (destined) to be gathered.

97.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh has appointed the Ka'bah, the Sacred House, to be an establishment for mankind, as also the sacred month, and the offering, and its garlands, so that you may know that Allâh knows all that is in the heavens and on the earth, and that Allâh is the All-Knowing of all things.

98.MunirMezyed2023: Know that Allâh is extremely severe in punishment and that Allâh is also Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

99.MunirMezyed2023: The sole duty of the Messenger is to convey the Message. And Allâh has full knowledge of whatever you disclose and whatever you conceal.

100.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "Not equal are the malicious and the wholesome, even though the abundance of malicious things may please you." Now, therefore, act piously towards Allâh, O, you men who possess high intelligence and great illumination so that you may ultimately achieve a blissful life / or gain eternal salvation.

101.MunirMezyed2023: O' you Live by Faith! Do not ask about things which if they are made known to you, would cause you trouble, though if you ask about them while the Qur’ān is being revealed, then they will be made known to you. Allâh has left them out on purpose. Allâh is Oft-Forgiving- Most Forbearing.

102.MunirMezyed2023: A people before you asked about such things, some more later on they renounced their faith.

103.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh has not instituted (superstition like)  Bahīra  or Sā’iba or Wasīla  or Hām. But those who persistently refused to Yield to the Truth attribute falsehood to Allâh. And most of them do lack the ability to perceive and understand.

104.MunirMezyed2023: When it is said unto them: "Come to that which Allâh has revealed and to the Messenger," They say: ”Sufficient for us is that wherein We found our fathers." What! Even though their fathers were void of knowledge, living in spiritual darkness.

105.MunirMezyed2023: O' you Live by Faith, keep yourselves safe. He who is deceived into going away from the Truth cannot harm you when you yourselves are on the right path. Verily you are all (destined) to return to Him, then He will inform you of whatever you used do.

106.MunirMezyed2023: O’ you who Live by Faith! When death draws nigh to one of you,  call upon two just persons from among you to witness as you make a bequest, otherwise, two others from among others than you if it happens that you are travelling through the land and the calamity of death befalls you. If you have doubt (about their testimony), detain them after their Prayer and let them swear by Allâh (saying): “We will not exchange our oath for any price, even if it should be a relative, and we would not hide the testimony of Allâh, for then we would surely be of the sinful."

107.MunirMezyed2023: But if afterwards it gets known that these two were guilty of the sin of perjury, let two others stand forth in their places, from among those who are the most deserving, nearest in kinship, and they both swear an oath by Allâh (saying): "We affirm that our testimony is more rightful than the testimony of the other two, and that we have not trespassed the truth, for then indeed we would be among those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims.

108.MunirMezyed2023: So it is more likely that they will bear true witness or fear that other oaths will be taken after theirs. Then act piously towards Allâh and listen attentively (to that which you are admonished). Surely Allâh holds back the Light of His inspiration from a people who indulge in personal disobedience extensively without repentance.

109.MunirMezyed2023: They day when Allâh gathers the Messengers together and says unto them: "What response did you receive?" They will answer: "We have no knowledge. Most certainly you are the One Who has the Perfect knowledge of   (the world) of unseen.”

110.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh will say: "O’ Jesus son of Mary! Remember My Favor upon you and upon your mother:  when I strengthened you with the Spirit of Holiness so that you would be able to speak unto the people in the cradle and when of middle age: when I taught you the spirit of wisdom, the Scripture -the Torah and the Gospel:  when you fashioned a creation out of clay in the likeness of a bird, by My will, then you breathed into it a new spirit , and it became a bird by My will: when you were able to heal the night-blind and the leprous by My will:  when you raised the dead by My will:  when I restrained the Children of Israel from putting you to death: when you came to them with the full knowledge of the Truth. But those who  persistently refused to Yield to the Truth from among them said: “This is nothing but an appreciable sorcery (and devilry).”

111.MunirMezyed2023: And (mention) when I inspired the Disciples to affirm their Faith  in Me and in My Messenger, they said: 'We affirm our Faith (in the Absolute Oneness of Allâh), and bear witness that we have wholly submitted ourselves (to the authority of Allâh).”

112.MunirMezyed2023: And (mention) when the Disciples said: "O’ Jesus, son of Mary, is your Lord capable of sending down to us a Table Spread with food from heaven? He said: “Act piously towards Allâh if you are (truly) living a life of Genuine Faith.

113.MunirMezyed2023: They said: "We desire to eat from it in order that our hearts may attain an absolute faith and we may know that what you have told us is the truth, and that we may be thereby among the witnesses."

114.MunirMezyed2023: Jesus, son of Mary, said: "O’ Allâh, our Lord! Send down for us a Table Spread with food from the heavens, that it may be to us a festival, to the first of us and to the last of us, and a Sign  from you. And provide sustenance for us. You are the Best of Sustainers.”

115.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh said: "I am going to send it down  to you but whosoever of you falls into spiritual darkness afterwards- I will definitely chastise him with a chastisement by which I have not chastised anyone among the beings."

116.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh will ask: "O’ Jesus, son of Mary, did you tell the people to worship you and your mother as two gods besides Allâh? He will answer: "All Glory And Perfection Be To You! I could never say that which I had no right. If I had said it, you would have definitely known it. You know what is in my inner self , whereas I do not know what is in Yours. It is You who has the full knowledge  of all hidden things.

117.MunirMezyed2023: I said nothing to them except that which you commanded me to say: ‘Worship (& venerate) Allâh, my Lord and your Lord’ and I was a witness of them so long as I was among them, but since you caused me to die, You have been the Watcher over them, and you are a Witness to all things.

118.MunirMezyed2023: If You intend to chastise them, then they are certainly Your servants. And if You intend to deliver them from all the consequences of their iniquitous deeds, then You are certainly the One who is All-Mighty, All-Wise."

119.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh will say: "This is the day when only the truthful will profit by their truthfulness.” For them are Gardens beneath which rivers flow; therein shall they abide. Allâh is well pleased with them, and they are well pleased with Him. Most surely that is the most ultimate success and the supreme one.

120.MunirMezyed2023: Unto Allâh belongs the (absolute) sovereignty of the heavens, the earth and whatsoever is therein. And He is Most Capable of doing whatsoever He pleases!

1.MunirMezyed2023: All praise is due to Allâh who created the heavens and the earth and brought into being darkness and light. Yet those who persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth have set up equals to their Lord (in worship).

2.MunirMezyed2023: He is the One Who created you from clay and then decreed a term. There is another term fixed with Him. Yet you, (who persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth), are still casting doubt on (the Resurrection Day).

3.MunirMezyed2023: He is Allâh, the Almighty God, both in the heavens and on the earth. He has full knowledge of whatsoever you conceal and whatsoever you openly profess. And He already knows perfectly well what you earn.

4.MunirMezyed2023: Never came there to them a Sign of the Signs of their Lord, but they take no heed.

5.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, they refused to acknowledge the Truth when it has been revealed to them, but soon they will face the dire consequences of what they used to scoff.

6.MunirMezyed2023: Have they (Quraysh Tribe of Mecca) not seen how many generations We utterly destroyed before them? We had made them more established in the earth than you. We leashed against them the heavy clouds pouring down abundant rain, and made the rivers flow under them. Then We destroyed them for their iniquitous deeds and raised up after them another generation.

7.MunirMezyed2023: Even if  We had sent down to you a writing upon parchment and they had felt it with their hands, those who persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth would have said: “This is no more than an appreciable sorcery (& devilry).”

8.MunirMezyed2023: They say: “Why has not an Angel been sent down to him?"  If We had sent down an Angel, then the matter would have been decided, and then no respite would have been granted to them.

9.MunirMezyed2023: Had We made him an Angel, We should have made him a man, too. We would have covered them with that in which they cover themselves.

10.MunirMezyed2023: Surely Other Messengers had already been mocked at before you, but those who mocked at them were encompassed by what they used to scoff .

11.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "Travel through the land and see how dreadful was the fate of those who were spiritually dead and blind.”

12.MunirMezyed2023: Say: “Unto whom belongs all that is in the heavens and on the earth?" Say: “Unto Allâh.” He has taken upon Himself to show Mercy. He will certainly assemble you for the Day of Resurrection which is absolutely inevitable. As for those who are caught in self-destruction, they have no tendency to live by Faith.

13.MunirMezyed2023: Unto Him belongs whatever exists in the night and in the day, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.

14.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "Is it other than Allâh I should choose to be as a guardian, the Creator of the heavens and the earth, Who feeds (all) and Himself never needs to be fed?" Say: “Moreover, I have surely been commanded to be the first to submit (to Him) and not be one of the polytheists.”

15.MunirMezyed2023: Say I truly fear the torment of a great day if it happens that I disobey my Lord.”

16.MunirMezyed2023: He from who (the chastisement) is averted on that day, Allâh Almighty has shown Mercy toward him. And that is the most ultimate success and the supreme one.

17.MunirMezyed2023: If Allâh touches you with affliction, none can remove it except Him. And if He touches you with good fortune, (none can preclude it). And Allâh is Most Capable of doing whatsoever He desires.

18.MunirMezyed2023: He is the Omnipotent over His servants, and He is the All-Wise, the All-Aware.

19.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "What thing is the greatest in testimony?" Say: “Allâh is a Witness between you and me. And this Qur’ān has been revealed to me so that with it I may warn you and whomsoever It reaches.”  What! Do you really bear witness that there are other gods besides Allâh? Say: “I bear not witness thereto.” Say: “He is the One True God. And indeed I am innocent of that which you associate with Him.”

20.MunirMezyed2023: Those to whom We have given the Scripture recognize him as they recognize their own sons. But as for those who are caught in self-destruction, they have no tendency to live by Faith.

21.MunirMezyed2023: Who then does greater evil than one who attributes falsehood to  Allâh and refuses to gives credence to what He revealed? Indeed, those who voluntarily and consciously abandon the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims will never achieve their aims.

22.MunirMezyed2023: And, (mention), on the day We shall gather them all together, then ask those who associated other gods (with Allâh): “Where, now, are those associates of yours whom you assumed (to be gods).”

23.MunirMezyed2023: Then they will have no excuse except that they will say: "By Allâh, our Lord, we were not Polytheists.”

24.MunirMezyed2023: Behold! How they lie against their own selves, and how that which they used to fabricate has failed them!

25.MunirMezyed2023: Among them are (spiritually blind) who listen to you, but We have placed coverings on their hearts, lest they understand It, and deafness in their ears (lest they hear It). Even if they were to see every sign (of Allâh’s power and glory), they would not live by Faith. So much so that when they come to you, they persist in arguing with you. And those who persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth say: “This is no more than myths of the ancients.”

26.MunirMezyed2023: They ventured to prevent others (from following the Prophet), and they themselves kept away from him. Verily, they sabotage none but their own selves, yet they lack the ability to perceive it.

27.MunirMezyed2023: If you could see them when they are made to stand by the Inferno, they would say: “Oh, would that we were but sent back (to the worldly life)! Then we would not repudiate what our Lord revealed. In fact, we would be among those who live by Faith.”

28.MunirMezyed2023: No indeed! It has become obvious to them that which they used to conceal before. If they were sent back to (the worldly life), they would definitely return to that which they are forbidden. They are indeed the inventors of lying.

29.MunirMezyed2023: They say: "There is no (other life) except this, our worldly life, and we are not going to be raised again."

30.MunirMezyed2023: If you could only see when they are made to stand before their Lord, He will say (unto them): “Is this (-resurrection and reckoning-) not the truth?" They will say: “Yea, by our Lord.” He will say: “Then taste the chastisement for your persistent refusal to acknowledge the Truth.”

31.MunirMezyed2023: Lo! Lost indeed are those who deny the meeting with Allâh, so much so that when the Hour comes upon them unexpectedly, they will say: "Alas for us! We failed to look after it properly!" They will bear the burdens (of their  iniquitous deeds) on their backs. Surely evil is that which they bear!

32.MunirMezyed2023: This worldly life is not more than a play and pastime. Surely the abode of the Hereafter is far better for those who act piously. Don't you have conscious thoughts at least in this sense?

33.MunirMezyed2023: We know indeed that what they say certainly grieves you. Surely it is not you that they deny. It is What Allâh has revealed that those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims aim to refute.

34.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, the Messengers (of Allâh) before you were denied, but they  patiently endured the denial and the persecution until Our help came to them.  There is none who has the power to alter the Word of Allâh- ( there is no authority to change what has been established and authorized by Allâh). There have already come to you some of the tidings of the past Messengers.

35.MunirMezyed2023: And If their recalcitrance towards you, (O' Muhammad and towards that with which you have been sent), is harsh on you, then you may, if you can, seek a passage into the earth or a ladder to heaven in order to bring them a (miraculous) sign. Had Allâh imposed His will, He could have brought them all together to Yield to the Truth, so do not be of those who don’t posses enough knowledge of the Truth

36.MunirMezyed2023: Only those who listen (attentively) will respond (wisely to the Truth). As for the dead, Allâh will raise them to life (on the Last Day), and then to Him they will be returned.

37.MunirMezyed2023: They say: “Why has not a (miraculous) sign been sent down to him from his Lord?" Say: "Allâh is certainly Most Capable of sending down a (miraculous) sign. But most of them don’t posses enough knowledge of the Truth.

38.MunirMezyed2023: There is no crawling creature on the earth, nor a bird that flies with its two wings, but they are communities like to you. We have neglected nothing in the Book. And to their Lord they shall be gathered.

39.MunirMezyed2023: Those who refuse to give credence to Our Signs are deaf and dumb, living in (utter) darkness. Lo! Allah holds back the Light of His inspiration from  whomsoever He wills, and inspires whomsoever He wills to the right path (to Salvation).

40.MunirMezyed2023: Say: “(Envisage a day) when you are completely surprised by the chastisement of Allâh or by the Hour, will you then call upon any other than Allâh (for help)? (Answer me) if you were truthful?”

41.MunirMezyed2023: Nay! It is Him alone you will call upon, and He may, if He wills, remove (the stress) which caused you to call upon Him. And you will forget then whatever partners you used to associate with Him."

42.MunirMezyed2023: Verily We sent Ours Messengers to people before you, then We afflicted them with adversity and hardship so that they might humble themselves.

43.MunirMezyed2023: Why, then, when Our retribution came upon them, did they not humble themselves? Lo! Their hearts were hardened, and Satan beautified their evil deeds for them.

44.MunirMezyed2023: When they forgot that with which they had been admonished, We opened to them the gates of all things, until, in the midst of their enjoyment in that which they were given, We (surprisingly) seized them and lo! they fell into despair!

45.MunirMezyed2023: So the last remnant of the people who voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims was   cut off.  All the praise is due to Allâh, the Lord of all the beings.

46.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "What do you think if Allâh intends to take away your hearing and your sight, and to set a seal on your hearts, what god other than Allâh is there could restore them to you?” See how We expound (our) Signs (of power & glory) in various ways, yet they turn away.”

47.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "What do you think if the chastisement of Allâh comes upon you,  whether unexpectedly or openly, will any be destroyed except the ones who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims. ”

48.MunirMezyed2023: We sent not the Messengers but as ones who bear glad tidings and deliver a severe warning. So whosoever lives by Faith and makes amends, they will have no fear upon them, nor will they ever grieve.

49.MunirMezyed2023: But those who refuse to give credence to  What We revealed will be afflicted with punishment for their persistent disobedience (and ingratitude).

50.MunirMezyed2023: Say, “I do not say to you that I possess the treasures house of  Allâh, nor do I know the (secrets of the world of) unseen, nor do I claim to be an angel. I only follow what is revealed to me (From Allâh)." And say: "Can the (spiritually) blind be held equal to the enlightened one? Will you not, then, reflect?"

51.MunirMezyed2023: So warn by means of this Qur’ān those who are held in awe by the possibility of being gathered before their Lord- there is no protector for them, nor any intercessor other than Him- so that they may act piously.

52.MunirMezyed2023: Lest you become of those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims, do not drive away those who call upon their Lord at morning and evening, seeking (only) His pleasure. Nothing of their account falls upon you, and nothing of your account falls upon them, that should make you to drive them away.

53.MunirMezyed2023: This is how We tried some of them by others, that they may say: "Is it these whom Allâh has favored from among us?" Does not Allâh know best the ones who are grateful?

54.MunirMezyed2023: And when those who have Faith in what We revealed come to you, say: ”Peace be upon you!” Your Lord has taken it upon Himself to show Mercy,  if anyone of you commits an iniquitous deed out of ignorance, then repents and makes amends, (he can rest assured that) Allâh is Oft-Forgiving- Most Merciful.”

55.MunirMezyed2023: This is how We distinctly explain what We reveal: that the path of those who are Ungodly Sinners may become apparent.

56.MunirMezyed2023: Say: ‘Truly I have been forbidden to worship those (fabled gods) whom you (idolize) and you call upon, other than Allâh.” And say: “I am not going to yield to your whims lest I fall away from the Faith and lose this awesome opportunity for receiving salvation.”

57.MunirMezyed2023: Say: “I stand upon a cognizable sign from my Lord, and you have already denied Him. Not within my power is that which you desire to be hastened. Judgment belongs unto Allâh alone. He relates the Truth, and He is (indeed) the Perfect Judge.”

58.MunirMezyed2023: Say: “If that which you desire to be hastened were in my power, surely the matter would have been decided between you and me. Allâh knows well those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims.”

59.MunirMezyed2023: With Him are the keys of (the world of) unseen. No one knows them but He. He has the full knowledge of whatsoever is on the land or in the sea. Not a (single) leaf falls, but He knows it; and neither is there a single grain in the deep darkness of the earth, nor anything, wet or dry, but it is recorded in a Comprehensive Book.

60.MunirMezyed2023: It is He who takes your soul by night. And He has full knowledge of what you do in the daytime. Then He raises you up again therein, that the appointed term may be fulfilled, then unto Him shall you return, then He will inform you of what you used to do.

61.MunirMezyed2023: He is the Omnipotent over His servants. And He sends recording-Angels watching over you. When death approaches one of you, Our Messengers (-the Angels of death-) take his soul, and they never fail in their duty.

62.MunirMezyed2023: Then they are returned to Allâh, their True Lord. Judgment belongs to Him. He is Swift in taking account.

63.MunirMezyed2023: Say: “Who delivers you from the risks of land and sea? You call upon Him humbly and in secret (saying), “If it happens that He delivers us from this, we will definitely be of those who give thanks.”

64.MunirMezyed2023: Say: “It is Allâh Alone who delivers you from it and from every distress. And yet you still associate others with Him."

65.MunirMezyed2023: Say: “It is He Who has the power to unleash upon you a chastisement from above you or from beneath your feet, or confound you by splitting you into sects, and make some of you taste the violence of one another. See how We distinctly explain Our Revelations in various ways so that they may understand (& distinguish truth and falsehood, and that they may prefer truth).

66.MunirMezyed2023: But your people, (O’ Muhammad), refused to give credence to the Qur’ān, even though it is the Ultimate Truth (from your Lord).  Say: "I am not one designated as a guardian over you to take full responsibility for your affairs."

67.MunirMezyed2023: For every Prophecy has a term appointed for its fulfillment. And soon you will come to know (the dire consequences of your iniquitous deeds).

68.MunirMezyed2023: When you see those who engage in vain discourse about Our (Holy) Verses, then walk away from them till they turn to another subject. If it happens that Satan caused you to forget, then after recollection, do not sit in the company of those people who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims.

69.MunirMezyed2023: Those who act piously are not held accountable for the (evil deeds of the scoffers) at all. But it is incumbent on the Pious ones to admonish them so that they may show honor and reverence for Allâh.

70.MunirMezyed2023: Leave alone those who take their religion for play and pastime, and those whom the worldly life has deluded. But remind them with the Qur’ān, lest a Human person be given up to destruction for what it has earned, for there will neither be any protecting friend nor intercessor, other than Allâh, and even though it may offer any ransom, it will not be taken from it. Such are they who are given to destruction for what they have earned. For them will be a drink of scalding water and an extremely painful punishment for their persistent refusal to acknowledge the truth.
