59.MunirMezyed2023: But there succeeded after them a posterity who failed to care of  prayer properly, and pursued wordily lusts: so they are doomed to face perdition,

60.MunirMezyed2023: Except he who repents, lives by Faith and strives to do righteous acts, such will enter Al- Jannah, and they won’t be wronged in aught.

61.MunirMezyed2023: (They will be admitted) into Gardens of Eden, which the True Merciful (God) has promised to His servants in the unseen: for His promise is ever sure of fulfillment.

62.MunirMezyed2023: They won’t hear therein any evil vain talk but only Peace. They will have their sustenance therein, morning and evening.

63.MunirMezyed2023: That is Al-Jannah which We shall let the Pious among Our servants inherit.

64.MunirMezyed2023: (Gabriel explained to Mohammad): "We -(the Angels)- don’t descend except by the Command of your Lord. Unto Him belongs whatever is before us, and whatever is behind us, and whatever is between them. And your Lord is never forgetful.

65.MunirMezyed2023: (He is) the Lord of the heavens, the earth and all that is between them, so worship Him alone, and be constant and patient in His worship.  Do you know anyone who is eligible for the same Name as He?"

66.MunirMezyed2023: The (impious) man says: ‘What! When I am dead, shall I then be brought forth alive?’

67.MunirMezyed2023: Does man not remember that We created him aforetime, when he was nothing?

68.MunirMezyed2023: By your Lord, We shall most certainly gather them along with the devils, and then shall We bring them around Gehenna on their knees.

69.MunirMezyed2023: Then We shall pluck out from every sect the ones who were most insubordinate toward the True Merciful (God).

70.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, We already know those who are most worthy of being burnt therein.

71.MunirMezyed2023: There is none of you but will pass over it. That is an inevitable decree of your Lord,

72.MunirMezyed2023: Then We shall deliver those who act piously toward the Lord, leaving those who willfully persist in yielding to their whims there on their knees.

73.MunirMezyed2023: And when Our Verses are recited to them as conclusive evidence, those who persistently refuse to yield to the Truth say to those who live by Faith: ‘Which of the two groups is more eminent in status and more magnificent in respect of companions?’

74.MunirMezyed2023: Yet, so many generations have We destroyed before them, who had better abundance of valuable possessions and manifestation!

75.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "Whoever is living a life of self-deception, the True Merciful (God) will definitely extend (the rope of deception) to him, until they face what they were threatened with, either the (divine) retribution or the Hour. Then they will come to know who is worst in position, and who is weaker in forces.”

76.MunirMezyed2023: Those who have inclination to pursue salvation, Allâh increases in their inclination. The righteous acts of everlasting merit are far better with your Lord in reward and better in outcome.

77.MunirMezyed2023: Then, have you seen the one who persistently refuse to yield to what We have revealed of the Knowledge of the Truth and says: ‘I will definitely be given wealth and children (in the Hereafter)?"

78.MunirMezyed2023: Has he obtained (the knowledge of the) unseen? Or has he made a covenant with the True Merciful (God)?

79.MunirMezyed2023: Nay! We shall assuredly write down what he says, and prolong for him the chastisement extensively.

80.MunirMezyed2023: And We will inherit of him what he says; and he will come to us alone.

81.MunirMezyed2023: They have taken (for worship) gods, besides Allâh in order that they may be a source of power and glory for them.

82.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed no! They (fabled gods) will deny their worship of them and turn against them as opponents (on the Day of Judgment).

83.MunirMezyed2023: Have you not seen how We unleash the devils against those who have no tendency to live by Faith to incite them to do evil?

84.MunirMezyed2023: Now, therefore, don’t be in haste against them. We only count out to them specified number (of days).

85.MunirMezyed2023: On the day We gather the Pious before the True Merciful (God) as honorable delegates,

86.MunirMezyed2023: And drive the Ungodly Sinners to Gehenna like thirsty beasts.

87.MunirMezyed2023: No one will have the right of intercession except those who have made a covenant with the True Merciful (God).

88.MunirMezyed2023: They say: "The True Merciful (God) has taken to Himself a child.”

89.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed you have (in such an assertiveness) brought forth something an outrageous-

90.MunirMezyed2023: By which the Heavens are about to disintegrate, the Earth is about to cleave asunder, and the mountains are about to crumble down in ruins–

91.MunirMezyed2023: That they ascribe a son to the True Merciful (God)!

92.MunirMezyed2023: It is not appropriate for (the Majestic Glory of) the True Merciful (God) that he should take to Himself a son.

93.MunirMezyed2023: There is none in the Heavens and on the Earth but comes to the True Merciful (God) as (an obedient and submissive) servant.

94.MunirMezyed2023: He has indeed enumerated and computed them.

95.MunirMezyed2023: Every one of them will come to Him on the Day of Resurrection, alone.

96.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed, those who Live by Faith and strive to do righteous acts (in this worldly life), the True Merciful (God) will demonstrate His own love for them.

97.MunirMezyed2023: Thus, We have made It (-this Qur'ān) easy in your tongue so that you may give glad tidings to the Pious and warn thereby the most antagonistic people.

98.MunirMezyed2023: We have utterly destroyed so many generations before them! Can you feel (the existence) of a single one of them, or hear any sound of them?

1.MunirMezyed2023: Tā ‘hā!

2.MunirMezyed2023: We have not sent down the Qur'ān to you in order to make you feel distressed.

3.MunirMezyed2023: But only as an admonition to him who desires to be saved from (the punishment of Allâh) .

4.MunirMezyed2023: (It is) Revelation Knowledge from the One Who has created the earth and the high heavens,

5.MunirMezyed2023: The  True Merciful (God) Who has established Himself on the (Mighty) Throne.

6.MunirMezyed2023: Unto Him belongs whatever is in the Heavens, whatever is on the Earth, whatever is between them and whatever is beneath the soil.

7.MunirMezyed2023: Whether you speak loudly (or quietly), He certainly knows the secret and what is even more hidden.

8.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh! There is no god but Him. His are the Most Honorable (& Glorious) Names.

9.MunirMezyed2023: Has there come to you the story of Moses?

10.MunirMezyed2023: Behold, he saw a fire. So he said unto to his family: "Wait here! Verily I perceive a fire. Perhaps I can bring you a burning torch or find guidance at the fire."

11.MunirMezyed2023: And when he reached it, he was called by name: "O’ Moses!

12.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed! I am your Lord! Now, therefore, take off your sandals, for you are in the sacred valley of Tuwā!

13.MunirMezyed2023: I have chosen you. Now, therefore, listen carefully to what is going to be revealed

14.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed! I am Allâh (Almighty) ! There is no other god beside Me. Now, therefore worship  Me and establish prayer for My remembrance!

15.MunirMezyed2023: The Hour is definitely coming. I make it hidden in order to remunerate every person for what he strives to achieve.

16.MunirMezyed2023: Do not let the one who has no Faith in It and follows his own whims bar you from It lest you then perish!

17.MunirMezyed2023: What is that in your right hand, O’ Moses?"

18.MunirMezyed2023: He said: "This is my staff whereon I lean, wherewith I beat down leaves to feed my sheep, and wherein I find other uses.”

19.MunirMezyed2023: (Allâh) said: “Cast it down, O’ Moses!"

20.MunirMezyed2023: So he cast it down. It was (a living) serpent, slithering.

21.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh said: "Take hold of it and don’t be afraid! We will restore it to its former state.

22.MunirMezyed2023: (20:22 Now, thrust your (right) hand under your armpit. It will come forth glittering white without any blemishes, as another Sign,

23.MunirMezyed2023: So We will show you some of Our greatest Signs.

24.MunirMezyed2023: Now, go to Pharaoh, for he has truly transgressed all bounds."

25.MunirMezyed2023: (Moses) said: "O’ my Lord! Expand my chest for me,

26.MunirMezyed2023: And make my mission easy,

27.MunirMezyed2023: And untangle the knot from my tongue

28.MunirMezyed2023: So that they may understand what I say.

29.MunirMezyed2023: And appoint for me a minister from my family:

30.MunirMezyed2023: Aaron, my brother.

31.MunirMezyed2023: Grant me strength through him,

32.MunirMezyed2023: And let him share my mission

33.MunirMezyed2023: So that we may celebrate your praise and declare Your absolute majesty and glory a lot,

34.MunirMezyed2023: Recall and show respect for You a lot.

35.MunirMezyed2023: Most assuredly You are of us Ever a Well-Seer."

36.MunirMezyed2023: (The Lord) said: "Your appeal has already been granted, O’ Moses.

37.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, We bestowed, at another time before, Our favor upon you,

38.MunirMezyed2023: When We inspired in your mother what it should be inspired:

39.MunirMezyed2023: ‘Place him- (he child) into a chest, then cast it into the river, then the river will cast it up on the bank. He will be taken by Pharaoh, an enemy of Mine and his.’ I cast down upon you love from Me so that you would be brought up before My watchful eyes.

40.MunirMezyed2023: When your sister went (to the household of Pharaoh) and said: 'Shall I introduce you to someone who can nurse him?' This is how We reunited you with your mother so that she could rejoice and forget her sorrows. Again, you unintentionally killed a man, and We saved you from the great distress, and We tested you by subjecting you to ordeals from which We delivered you. Then you stayed for years among the people of Midian, (Shu'ayb and his family). Then you came here as ordained, O’ Moses.

41.MunirMezyed2023: And I have chosen you for Myself.

42.MunirMezyed2023: Now, go, you and your brother, with My Signs (of power & glory), and don’t slacken in celebrating the praise of your Lord and declaring His glory!

43.MunirMezyed2023: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh, for he has truly transgressed all bounds of equity.

44.MunirMezyed2023: But speak to him with kind words, perhaps he may accept admonition or show reverence.”

45.MunirMezyed2023: Both said: “Our Lord, We truly fear that he will hasten to inflict punishment on us, or that he may show arrogant superiority."

46.MunirMezyed2023: (Allâh) said: “Don’t be afraid! Surely I am with you. I hear and see everything.”

47.MunirMezyed2023: Go, then, you two to him and say: “Truly we are two Messengers of your Lord, so let the Children of Israel go with us and stop torturing them. Verily, we have come to you with a Sign from your Lord. Peace will Be Upon the one who follows the right path to the truth!

48.MunirMezyed2023: Verily It has been revealed to us that punishment will overtake whoever denies the truth and falls away from (the Faith).

49.MunirMezyed2023: Pharaoh said: ‘Who is this Lord of you two, O’ Moses?’

50.MunirMezyed2023: (Moses) said: "Our Lord is the One Who created everything and endowed each thing with its special feature, and then guided it."

51.MunirMezyed2023: (Pharaoh) said: "What then is the condition of the past generations?"

52.MunirMezyed2023: Moses said: ‘My Lord holds the knowledge of them in a record. My Lord neither errs nor forgets.’

53.MunirMezyed2023: He is the One Who has made the earth a cradle for you, threaded for you therein roads and sent down water from the sky. Then thereby We have brought forth pairs of various plants.

54.MunirMezyed2023: Eat thereof and feed your cattle! Surely, in that there are Signs (of Allâh's power & glory) for people endued with high intelligence and great illumination.

55.MunirMezyed2023: From it, We created you, and into it, We shall return you, and out of it, We will raise you once again.

56.MunirMezyed2023: We verily showed him- (Pharaoh)- all Our Signs, but he persistently denied them and refused to acknowledge (Allâh).

57.MunirMezyed2023: (Pharaoh) said: "Have you come to drive us out from our land with your sorcery, O’ Moses?

58.MunirMezyed2023: "Then, We will definitely produce before you sorcery like it. Now, therefore, make an appointment between us, which we shall not fail to keep - neither we nor you - in a place convenient (to both of us)."

59.MunirMezyed2023: (Moses) said: “The appointed meeting will be on the festival day. And let the people be gathered in the forenoon."

60.MunirMezyed2023: Pharaoh then left and put together his plot, then came.

61.MunirMezyed2023: Moses said unto the magicians summoned by Pharaoh: "Woe betide you! Beware of attributing falsehood to Allâh, lest He will wipe you out by some punishment. Whosoever attributes falsehood to (Allâh) will certainly fail miserably."

62.MunirMezyed2023: And They began to debate their affair among themselves and preferred to keep their talk secret.

63.MunirMezyed2023: They said: "Well, these two are (expert) sorcerers, who intend to drive you out from your land with their sorcery and eradicate your exemplary way of life.

64.MunirMezyed2023: Now, therefore, orchestrate your plan and then come in ordered ranks. Whosoever overcomes this day will definitely be the successful."

65.MunirMezyed2023: They said: "O’ Moses! Either you throw or we will be the first to throw."

66.MunirMezyed2023: He said: "Nay! You, do cast first! Then behold their ropes and their sticks, by their sorcery, appeared to him as though they were slithering.

67.MunirMezyed2023: So Moses conceived a fear within him.

68.MunirMezyed2023: We said: “Don’t be afraid! Surely, it is you who are the preponderant.

69.MunirMezyed2023: Now, cast down that which is in your right hand! It will swallow up all that they have contrived. Lo! What they have contrived is only a guile of a sorcerer. The sorcerer will never achieve success in whatever he may aim to do."

70.MunirMezyed2023: So the sorcerers fell down prostrate, saying: "We do affirm our Faith in the Lord of Aaron and Moses."

71.MunirMezyed2023: (Pharaoh) said: "Did you profess your Faith in him before I give you permission? Indeed! I see that he - (Moses) - is your chief who taught you how to perform sorcery. I will certainly have your hands and feet cut off alternately. And I will certainly crucify you on the trunks of palm trees. Then you will certainly come to know which of us is more stringent in chastisement and (whose chastisement is) more enduring!"

72.MunirMezyed2023: They said: “We won’t prefer you over the irrefutable Signs that have come to us, nor above Him Who originated us. So decree whatever you intend to decree.  You can only decree for this worldly life.

73.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed, We affirm our faith in our Lord so that He may forgive us our iniquitous deeds and the sorcery which you compelled us to practice. And Allâh is the Best and Most Abiding.”

74.MunirMezyed2023: Whosoever comes before his Lord as an Ungodly Sinner, then surely, for him is Gehenna, therein he can neither die nor live.

75.MunirMezyed2023: But whosoever comes before Him as a Monotheist, having done righteous deeds, for such shall be the highest degrees:

76.MunirMezyed2023: Gardens of Eden, beneath which rivers flow, therein they will abide. Such is the reward of him who has ultimately achieved positive spiritual growth.

77.MunirMezyed2023: And verily We revealed to Moses: "Set forth with My servants by night and strike for them a dry path through the sea.  Do not fear that you will be overtaken, neither be afraid (of drowning)."

78.MunirMezyed2023: Pharaoh chased them with his armed hosts, then there engulfed them of the sea that which engulfed them.

79.MunirMezyed2023: Pharaoh deceived his people into going away from the Path of Truth.

80.MunirMezyed2023: O’ Children of Israel! We verily saved you from your enemy. And We made a covenant with you through Moses on the right side of Mount (Sinai), and sent to you the manna and the quails.

81.MunirMezyed2023: (We said): "Eat of the pure and wholesome things We have provided for you and don’t exceed therein lest (my) wrath will justly fall upon you: and he on whom My wrath falls, he is certainly hurled to ruin.

82.MunirMezyed2023: Yet I am indeed All-Forgiving to him who repents, lives by Faith and strives to do righteous deeds, then continues to follow the right path.

83.MunirMezyed2023: (Allâh) said: “Moses, What made you leave your people behind in such haste?"

84.MunirMezyed2023: He replied: "They are close on my tracks. And I have shown haste to come to You so that You may be well-pleased."

85.MunirMezyed2023: (Allâh) said: “Indeed! We have tempted your people during your absence:  the Samaritan has led them astray."

86.MunirMezyed2023: So Moses returned to his people, angry and sorrowful. He said: "My people! Did your Lord not make you a good promise? Did then the time appointed seem too long to you? Or did you desire that a condemnation from your Lord should fall upon you, and so you broke your promise to me?”

87.MunirMezyed2023: They said: "We didn’t break  our promise to you of our own free will.  We were laden with burdens of the ornaments of the people (of Egypt), then cast them (into the fire), for thus as the Samaritan suggested."

88.MunirMezyed2023: Then he produced for them a Calf, a (mere) body, which had bellowing sound. And they said: "This is your god and the god of Moses, but Moses has forgotten."

89.MunirMezyed2023: Did they not see that it could not return to them a word (for answer), and had no power to hurt or benefit them?

90.MunirMezyed2023: And Aaron indeed had already told them before: "O’ my people! You have been tempted by this thing, and indeed, your Lord is (Allâh), the True Merciful (God), so follow me and obey my command."

91.MunirMezyed2023: They said: "We shall by no means stop worshiping it until Moses returns to us."

92.MunirMezyed2023: (Moses) said: "O’ Aaron! When you saw them falling away from the Faith, What prevented you

93.MunirMezyed2023: From following after me? Did you then disobey my command?"

94.MunirMezyed2023: Aaron said: "O’ son of my mother! Don’t seize me  by my beard, nor by my head! I was afraid lest you should say: 'You have caused a division among the Children of Israel and paid no attention to my word!’

95.MunirMezyed2023: (Moses) said: "What is wrong with you, Samaritan? “What is that which motivate you to do this?’

96.MunirMezyed2023: The Samaritan said: “I saw what they did not see: (I saw Gabriel riding a horse), so I took a handful from the footprints of the Messenger, and cast it (into the molten ornaments). This is what my Inner Self induced me to do."

97.MunirMezyed2023: (Moses) said: "Then go away! Indeed, it is (decreed) for you in this present life to say, “Don’t Touch Me!” Most Certainly, there is also for you a promise (of punishment) that you won’t be able to evade.  Now look at your god of whom you become a devoted worshiper. We will definitely burn it and scatter its ashes over the sea."

98.MunirMezyed2023: (O’ my people!) Your God is only Allâh. There is no other god beside Him. He encompasses all things in His Knowledge."

99.MunirMezyed2023: So We relate to you some of the exemplary events which happened in the past. Surely, We have given you from Our Own Selves a Scripture.

100.MunirMezyed2023: But whoever makes an affirmative decision to pay no attention It - (the Qur’ān)- will definitely bear a heavy load (of iniquitous deeds) on the Day of Resurrection,

101.MunirMezyed2023: Carrying it forever. How dreadful is that load for them on the Day of Resurrection!

102.MunirMezyed2023: And (mention) the day when the Trumpet is blown. On that day We shall gather the Ungodly Sinners together, blear-eyed (with terror),

103.MunirMezyed2023: Whispering to one another: “You have tarried (in the world) only for ten days."

104.MunirMezyed2023: We have full knowledge of what they will say when the highly perceptive person among them will say: “You have tarried but a day.”

105.MunirMezyed2023: They ask you about the mountains (on the Day of Resurrection). Say: "My Lord will blow them up into scattered dust.”

106.MunirMezyed2023: Then He will leave the earth smooth without marked lumps.

107.MunirMezyed2023: You will see therein neither roundabout route nor ruggedness.

108.MunirMezyed2023: On that day they will strictly follow the Summoner- there will be no deviation therein. And all voices will be humbled for the True Merciful (God). You will hear nothing but a faint murmur.

109.MunirMezyed2023: On that day, no intercession will avail except him that has received the permission of the True Merciful (God) and whose word He approves.

110.MunirMezyed2023: He has full knowledge of whatever is before them and whatever is behind them, whereas they cannot encompass His knowledge.

111.MunirMezyed2023: (All) faces will be humbled before (Allâh), the Ever-Living, All-Sustaining. And he who bears iniquity will be disappointed.

112.MunirMezyed2023: But he who does of righteous acts - while he is a Monotheist-   should not fear any injustice or any curtailment (of his rights).

113.MunirMezyed2023: As such We sent It down as an Arabic Qur’ān, and distinctly set forth therein of warnings in diverse contexts so that they may act piously, or that it may motivate them (to accept Allâh into their life).

114.MunirMezyed2023: Most High then is Allâh, the Sovereign, the Ultimate Truth. Don’t show haste with (recitation of) the Qur’ān before its revelation has been completed to you. And say: “My Lord, increase me in knowledge (of knowing You).”

115.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, We had made a covenant with Adam before, but he forgot. We found on his part no firm determination (to disobey).

116.MunirMezyed2023: And (mention) when We said unto the Angels: "Prostrate yourselves before Adam." They all prostrated themselves except Iblīs. He refused (to yield to the command  Allâh).

117.MunirMezyed2023: Then We said: "O’ Adam! Indeed, Satan is an enemy of yours and your wife. Now, therefore, don’t let him expel you both from Al-Jannah, lest you suffer through considerable hardship.

118.MunirMezyed2023: For you, it is most assuredly a fact that you will neither go hungry therein nor go naked,

119.MunirMezyed2023: Nor feel thirsty, nor suffer from the sun's heat.”

120.MunirMezyed2023: But the devil whispered lies in his ear, saying: "O’ Adam, shall I lead you into the tree of eternity, and into a kingdom that will never decay?”

121.MunirMezyed2023: So both of them ate of it, and their private parts were exposed to them. Thus, they began to cover themselves with the leaves of the Garden. (In truth) Adam did disobey his Lord and so fell into temptation and put forth his hand unto iniquity.

122.MunirMezyed2023: Thereafter, his Lord chose him, turned unto him in forgiveness and enlightened his path to the truth.

123.MunirMezyed2023: (Allâh) said: "Get down (from Paradise), all of you, as enemies of one another. Yet if there should come to you the Word of Knowledge from Me, then whoever yield to My Word- (the Qur’ān)- will neither deviate from the path of truth nor suffer through considerable hardship.

124.MunirMezyed2023: But whosoever makes an affirmative decision to pay no attention to My Scripture,- (the Qur’ān)- his will surely be a straitened life. And We will raise him up blind on the Day of Resurrection."

125.MunirMezyed2023: He will say: "O’ my Lord! Why have you raised me up blind, when I was endowed with sight?"

126.MunirMezyed2023: (Allâh) will say: “Even so it is. Our Enlightenment Quotes were revealed to you but you neglected them, and so, today you will be neglected.”

127.MunirMezyed2023: This is how We chastise him who transgresses beyond bounds and persistently refuse to acknowledge the Enlightenment Quotes of his Lord. But the chastisement of the Hereafter is more intensive and more enduring.

128.MunirMezyed2023: Then, has it not become obvious to them that so many generations, in whose dwellings they walk around, We destroyed before them?  Surely, in that there are Signs for people endued with high intelligence and great illumination.

129.MunirMezyed2023: And if not for a Word that had already gone forth from your Lord, then infliction of punishment would have been an immediate obligation, and if not for a term already fixed.

130.MunirMezyed2023: Now, therefore be patient with whatever they say. Celebrate the praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting, and declare His absolute majesty and glory during the hours of the night and parts of the day so that you may find true fulfillment and spiritual satisfaction.

131.MunirMezyed2023: And don’t Stretch your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to some groups among them, from the splendor of this worldly life, so that We may thereby tempt them. The provision of your Lord is far better and more enduring.

132.MunirMezyed2023: And give an authoritative order to your family to establish prayer and to be patiently diligent in observing it. We don’t ask you for provision: It is We Who provide sustenance for you. But the fruitful end will be for the Pious.

133.MunirMezyed2023: They- (Pagan Arabs)- say: "Why does he not bring us a Sign from his Lord?" Has not there come to them an irrefutable Sign in the previous Scriptures?

134.MunirMezyed2023: Had We destroyed them with a retribution before this, they would definitely have said: "Our Lord! If only You had sent us a Messenger, we should certainly have yield to Your Enlightenment Quotes before we were humiliated and demeaned."

135.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "Every one (of us) is in a state of expectation (of the outcome), so keep on expecting! Soon you will come to know the ones who have been on the right path, and (the ones) who have tendency to pursue salvation.

1.MunirMezyed2023: (The time) of the reckoning for the people is drawing closer: Yet they are heedlessly falling away (from the Faith).

2.MunirMezyed2023: Whenever a new Revelation Knowledge comes to them from their Lord (to admonish them), they listen to it yet playing.

3.MunirMezyed2023: Their hearts are preoccupied (with lusts). Those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims prefer to confer among themselves in secret. (They ask): ‘Is this (Muhammad) no more than a human being like you? Will you then yield to (his) sorcery while you are aware of (it)?’

4.MunirMezyed2023: He said: ‘My Lord has full knowledge of every word spoken in the heavens or on the earth. He is the All-Hearing- the All-Knowing.

5.MunirMezyed2023: Nay, but they say: ‘(The Verses of the Qur’ān are no more than) muddled dreams! Nay, but He has forged it! Nay, but he is a poet! Now, therefore let him bring us a Sign (of wonder attributed to divine power) such as the former (Messengers) were sent (with)’.

6.MunirMezyed2023: Not a single town that We utterly destroyed adhered to Monotheism before them, Will these people then adhere to Monotheistic Faith?

7.MunirMezyed2023: And We didn’t sent (Messengers) before you other than men whom We inspired. Now, therefore, ( go and) ask those who have spiritual knowledge of the previously revealed scriptures if you don’t know.

8.MunirMezyed2023: And We didn’t give them (supernatural) bodies that didn’t need food, nor were they immortal!

9.MunirMezyed2023: Then we fulfilled Our Promise to them: We saved them and all whom We willed. And We destroyed the prodigals.

10.MunirMezyed2023: (O' mankind), We send down to you a (Perfect) Book in which is your remembrance. Don't you have conscious thoughts at least in this sense?

11.MunirMezyed2023: (Just imagine) so many towns We destroyed (their inhabitants) when they had voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims. Then We raised up after them another people.

12.MunirMezyed2023: So when they felt Our Mighty Power approaching, they started to run away from their town.

13.MunirMezyed2023: (But they were told): ‘Don’t run away, but return to your comforts and your homes so that you will be questioned’.

14.MunirMezyed2023: And they said: ‘Ah! Woe betide us! We were of those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims.

15.MunirMezyed2023: That cry of theirs didn’t cease until We made them like a reaped crop, silent and still.

16.MunirMezyed2023: And We didn’t create the heavens, the earth and all that is between them in vain.

17.MunirMezyed2023: If We had intended to find a pastime, We would surely have taken it from what is with US, if We were to do so!

18.MunirMezyed2023: And We expound the truth and hurl it at falsehood so that the truth refutes and quells it, and lo! it vanishes completely. Woe betide you for all the falsehood you attribute (to Allâh).

19.MunirMezyed2023: Unto Him belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and on the earth. And those who are with Him - (the Angels)- are not too proud to worship ( & venerate) Him, neither do they become weary in doing so.

20.MunirMezyed2023: They celebrate His praise and declare His absolute majesty and glory night and day without showing any sign of fatigue, or losing enthusiasm.

21.MunirMezyed2023: What! Have they taken gods from the earth (in belief that) they are capable of giving life to the dead?

22.MunirMezyed2023: If there had been (in the heavens or on the earth) any gods beside Allâh, then both would surely have fallen into ruin. So Exalted is Allâh, the Lord of the (Glorious) Throne. (Supreme is He) above all that which they attribute (to Him)!

23.MunirMezyed2023: He cannot be questioned about what He does, but they will all be questioned (about their actions).

24.MunirMezyed2023: Or have they taken other gods, other than Him? Say: ‘Bring to us any irrefutable argument (to support such a claim). This Qur’ān is the Reminder of those with me, and the Reminder of those before me." But most of them don’t posses enough knowledge of the Truth, thus, they turn away in a repulsive manner.

25.MunirMezyed2023: We sent no Messenger before you but We inspired him: “There is no other god beside Me. Now, therefore, worship Me” (in the way I want you to worship Me).

26.MunirMezyed2023: Yet some say: ‘The True Merciful (God) has taken to Himself a son’. All Glory Be To Him! Nay, those are but honored and devoted servants.

27.MunirMezyed2023: And they speak only when He allows them to do so and they act according to His Command.

28.MunirMezyed2023: He has full knowledge of whatever is before them and whatever is behind them. They cannot intercede except for one whom He approves, and they themselves tremble in awe of His (Greatness).

29.MunirMezyed2023: And should any of them say: ‘I am a god beside Him’,  such a one We will requite with Gehenna. This is how We requite those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims.

30.MunirMezyed2023: Don’t those who persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth see that the heavens and the earth were at first one piece then We parted them as separate entities? And We have made every living thing from water.  Will they not then adhere to Faith?

31.MunirMezyed2023: And We have set up firm hills on the earth lest it should quake with them. And We have made therein wide ways so that they might follow the right direction.

32.MunirMezyed2023: And We have established the heavens as a canopy, safe and well protected. Yet they pay no attention to its signs.

33.MunirMezyed2023: And He is the One Who created the night and day, the sun and the moon- each floating in its own orbit.

34.MunirMezyed2023: And We never granted immortality to any human being before you. So if you die, will they live forever?

35.MunirMezyed2023: Every human person is bound to taste death, and We put you to test through hardship and prosperity (in order to identify you).  Then unto Us you shall be brought back.

36.MunirMezyed2023: And When those who persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth see you, they only poke fun at you, (saying): ‘Is this the one who talks (awfully) about your gods?’ Yet, at the mention of the True Merciful (God), they are tempted to reject.

37.MunirMezyed2023: And man by his nature is impatient. I will soon show you My Signs (of power & glory). Now, therefore, don’t ask Me to hasten them.

38.MunirMezyed2023: And they say: ‘When will this promise (be fulfilled) if you are truthful?’

39.MunirMezyed2023: If those who persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth but knew the time when they will be incapable of averting the Fire from their faces or from their backs, and they shall not be helped!

40.MunirMezyed2023: Nay! It will come upon them unexpectedly, and then it will leave them totally flabbergasted. Verily, they won’t have the power to avert it, neither will they be given any respite.

41.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, (many) Messengers were mocked before you, but the mockers were encompassed by what they used to mock.

42.MunirMezyed2023: Say: ‘Who can protect you from (the punishment of) the True Merciful (God) during the night or during the day?’ Nay, but they turn away from celebrating the praise of their Lord and declaring His glory.

43.MunirMezyed2023: Or do they really have gods apart from Us to protect them? They- (fabled gods)- are incapable of helping themselves; neither can they obtain any sort of protection from Us.

44.MunirMezyed2023: The fact is that We give the enjoyment of this life to these men and their forefathers, so they have lived for a long time in comfort and safety. Do they not see how We progressively reduce the land (which in their control) from its outlying parts? Are they the ones who will prevail?

45.MunirMezyed2023: Say: ’I warn you only by the (power of) the Revelation Knowledge. Only the deaf don’t hear the call when they are warned.

46.MunirMezyed2023: If it happens that a whiff of the chastisement of your Lord touched them, they will surely say: ‘Ah! Woe betide us! We were of those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims.

47.MunirMezyed2023: And We shall set up the scales of (the absolute) justice on the Day of Resurrection so that no one will be wronged in any way: even though it be a deed so much as the weight of a grain of mustard seed, We will bring it forth (to be weighed). And sufficient are We to take account.

48.MunirMezyed2023: And verily We gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion (of right and wrong) - a light and an enlightenment for the Pious,

49.MunirMezyed2023: Who stand in awe of their Lord and feel a great deal of apprehension about the Hour.

50.MunirMezyed2023: And this Qur'ān is a Blessed Reminder which We have sent down. Are they, then, tempted to deny it?

51.MunirMezyed2023: And verily We had endowed Abraham with high self-awareness. And We knew him fully well.

52.MunirMezyed2023: He said to his father and his people: ‘What are these sculptures to which you are so diligently devoted?’

53.MunirMezyed2023: They said: ‘We found our fathers worshiping them’.

54.MunirMezyed2023: He said: ‘Then indeed you and your fathers have been in manifest deception’.

55.MunirMezyed2023: They said: ‘Have you brought the truth, or are you one of those who do not behave seriously?’

56.MunirMezyed2023: He said: "Nay, but your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, who originated them. And I am one of those who bear witness to this:

57.MunirMezyed2023: And, by Allâh, I will certainly plot a plan for your idols after you have gone away and turned your backs.

58.MunirMezyed2023: So he broke all of them into pieces, except the biggest one of them, so that they might return to it.

59.MunirMezyed2023: They said: ’Who has done this to our gods? Surely he is (one) of the impious’.

60.MunirMezyed2023: Some of them said: ‘We heard a youth called Abraham speaking against them’.

61.MunirMezyed2023: They yelled: ‘Then bring him before the eyes of the people so that they may testify ‘.

62.MunirMezyed2023: They asked him: ‘Was it you who did this to our gods, O’ Abraham?’

63.MunirMezyed2023: He said: ‘Nay, but it was done by this, the biggest one of them! Ask them if they can speak’.

64.MunirMezyed2023: Then they turned to themselves and said: ‘Truly it is you who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims.

65.MunirMezyed2023: Then they were made to  bow their heads and cast down their eyes, (saying:): ‘Very well indeed you know that these images don’t speak’.

66.MunirMezyed2023: Abraham said: ‘Do you worship that, besides Allâh, which can neither profit you nor hurt you?’

67.MunirMezyed2023: Fie upon you and upon that which you worship besides Allâh! Don't you have conscious thoughts at least in this sense?’

68.MunirMezyed2023: They yelled: ‘Burn him and avenge your gods If you would do aught’.

69.MunirMezyed2023: We said: ‘O’ fire! Be coolness and safety for Abraham!’

70.MunirMezyed2023: They meant evil against him. But We made them the worse losers.

71.MunirMezyed2023: And We saved him and Lot, (leading them) to the land which We have blessed for all beings.

72.MunirMezyed2023: And We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob as an extra gift. And We made them all righteous.

73.MunirMezyed2023: And We made them (spiritual) leaders showing the people the right path to salvation by Our Command. And We revealed to them to strive to do righteous acts, to establish the regular Prayer and pay Zakāt. And they were devoted worshipers of Us (alone).

74.MunirMezyed2023: And to Lot, We gave him the authority of moral judgments and (spiritual) knowledge. And We delivered him from the town (whose inhabitants) were given to debauchery. Verily they were a people given to evil, indulging in personal disobedience extensively without repentance.

75.MunirMezyed2023: And We admitted him into Our Mercy, most certainly he was of the righteous.

76.MunirMezyed2023: And (mention) Noah, when he cried (to Us) aforetime, We answered him and delivered him and his family from the great distress.

77.MunirMezyed2023: And We helped him against a people who persistently refuse to acknowledge Our Signs. Verily, they were a people given to evil, so We drowned them, all together.

78.MunirMezyed2023: And (mention) David and Solomon, when they judged concerning the field in which the sheep of certain people had strayed and browsed therein by night; and We were witnesses to their judgment.

79.MunirMezyed2023: And We made Solomon understand the case more clearly. And to each of them, We gave the authority of moral judgments and (spiritual) knowledge. And We subjected the mountains and the birds to celebrate Our praise and declare Our glory along with David. It was We who did all this.

80.MunirMezyed2023: And We taught him the art of making coats of mail to fortify you from the violence of war. Will you, then, show gratitude?

81.MunirMezyed2023: And We had subdued to Solomon the strongly blowing wind which ran at his command to carry him to the land which We had blessed (with many good things). And We have full knowledge of everything.

82.MunirMezyed2023: And of the jinn and devils, We assigned to him some who dived (into the sea to extract precious stones) for him and obediently performed other tasks besides that. And We were watchful over them.

83.MunirMezyed2023: And (mention) Job when he called upon his Lord: "Most certainly, affliction of evil has touched me and You are the Most Merciful of the merciful.”

84.MunirMezyed2023: So We answered his prayer and removed his affliction. And we   restored his family for him and the like thereof along with them, as a Mercy from Our Own Selves and a reminder to those who worship ( Allah in the way He wants us to worship Him).

85.MunirMezyed2023: And (mention) Ishmael, Idrīs (Enoch) and Dhū’l-Kifl- all were of those who cling to patience (in adversity).

86.MunirMezyed2023: And We admitted them into Our Mercy, for they were truly righteous.

87.MunirMezyed2023: And (mention) Dhū’l-Nūn (Jonah) when he went off in rage, thinking that We had no power over him. But he called out in the darkness: “There is no other God beside You. Glory Be To You! I was indeed of those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims”.

88.MunirMezyed2023: So We responded to him and delivered him from the anguish. And this is how We deliver those who live a life of Genuine Faith.

89.MunirMezyed2023: And (mention) Zachariah, when he called upon his Lord: "O’ my Lord, don’t leave me alone (without an heir), and indeed You are the Best of the inheritors".

90.MunirMezyed2023: So We responded to him and bestowed upon him John, and restored the fertility of his wife for him. Indeed, they used to hasten towards all that is good, to call upon Us with hope and reverence, and to humble themselves before Us.

91.MunirMezyed2023: And (remember) her who guarded her virginity. We breathed into her out of Our Spirit and made her and her son a Sign (of Our power and glory) for all the beings.

92.MunirMezyed2023: Truly this, your Ummah, is one Ummah, and I am your Lord. Now, therefore, worship Me (in the way I want you to worship Me).

93.MunirMezyed2023: However, they disagreed and split up into different sects: but to Us they will all return.

94.MunirMezyed2023: Then Whoever strives to do acts of righteousness while he is a Monotheist- (having a deep, pure, focused Faith in Allâh)- there will be no denial for his effort: and We will indeed record it in his favour.

95.MunirMezyed2023: It is utterly impossible for (the inhabitants of) a town which We have destroyed to ever rise again (or return to this worldly life).

96.MunirMezyed2023: Even when Gog and Magog are let loose and they hasten forth from every height.

97.MunirMezyed2023: And the true promise - (Judgment Day)- is coming closer. Then all of a sudden the eyes of those who live in spiritual darkness are fixedly staring in horror, (yelling): "Ah! Woe betide us! We were certainly wholly inattentive to this. In fact, we have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of our own whims.

98.MunirMezyed2023: Surely, you and whatever you worship other than Allâh are but firewood for Gehenna. Therein shall they enter.

99.MunirMezyed2023: If those (idols) had truly been gods, then they would not have been compelled to enter into It (Gehenna). And they will all live therein forever.

100.MunirMezyed2023: For them therein shall be whining and therein shall they hear nothing.

101.MunirMezyed2023: Verily those for whom the promise of best reward has preceded from Us, they will be kept far away from It- (Gehenna).

102.MunirMezyed2023: And they won’t hear Its sizzling thereof, and will abide in that which their souls desire.

103.MunirMezyed2023: The greatest terror won’t grieve them, and the Angels will receive them (saying): "This is your day which you were promised."

104.MunirMezyed2023: On that day, We shall roll up the sky like the rolling up of the written scrolls. Just as We were able to create people the first time,  We will bring them back to life. (It is) a promise (binding) upon Us. For We always keep Our promises.

105.MunirMezyed2023: And verity We have written in the Psalms after the Reminder: My righteous worshipers will inherit the earth.

106.MunirMezyed2023: Most certainly there is in this- (Qur’ān)- a proclamation for a people who worship (Allah in the way He wants them to worship Him).

107.MunirMezyed2023: And We have sent you for no other reason but to be a source of  Mercy for the all beings.

108.MunirMezyed2023: Say: ‘It is revealed to me that your God is only one True God - (Allâh). Will you then hasten to embrace Islam?

109.MunirMezyed2023: But if it happens that they fall away (from the Faith), then say unto them: “I have faithfully conveyed to you (the messages of my Lord). Both you and I equally know of what I have warned you against, and I don’t know whether that which you are promised is near or far.

110.MunirMezyed2023: And He has full knowledge of whatever you say openly and whatever you hide (in your hearts).

111.MunirMezyed2023: I don’t know if this may be a trial for you or an enjoyment for a while.

112.MunirMezyed2023: He said: "O’ my Lord, Judge (between us) with truth. Lo! Our Lord is the True Merciful (God) Whose help is ever to be sought against all that you falsely ascribe (to Him)."

1.MunirMezyed2023: O’ mankind, act piously toward your Lord! Indeed, the convulsion of the Hour is a tremendous thing.

2.MunirMezyed2023: On the day you witness it, every nursing mother will utterly forsake her infant, and every pregnant woman will cast off her burden. You will see people swaying as though they were drunk, while, in fact, they are not drunk. But the chastisement of Allâh is extremely severe.

3.MunirMezyed2023: And of the people is he who disputes concerning Allâh without knowledge, and follows every insubordinate devil.

4.MunirMezyed2023: It has been decreed that such devil- (Satan) - will make everyone who follows him to fall into deception and lead him to the punishment of the Burning Fire.

5.MunirMezyed2023: O’ mankind! If you are in doubt about the Resurrection, then (you’ll need to know that) We have created you from dust, then from a semen-drop, then a clinging substance, then an embryonic lump, formed and unformed, in order to show You (Our Signs of  power &  glory). We cause what We intend to remain in the wombs for an appointed term, then We bring you out as infants. Then We cause you to grow and become more mature. Among you, there is he who dies (young). And among you, there is he who is brought back to the worst part of life so that he may know nothing after once having knowledge. You see the earth barren, but when We send down thereon water, it stirs and swells, bringing forth every delightful pair of vegetation.

6.MunirMezyed2023: This is so, because Allâh is the (Ultimate) Truth: And He is the One Who gives life to the dead, and the One who is  Most Capable of doing whatever He desires.

7.MunirMezyed2023: And Verily, the Hour is coming.- there is no doubt about it- and Allâh will definitely resurrect those who are in the graves.

8.MunirMezyed2023: And of the people is he who disputes concerning Allâh without knowledge, or spiritual illumination, or an enlightening book,

9.MunirMezyed2023: Twisting his neck (in pride) in order to prevent people from the path of knowing Allâh. For him in this worldly life is ignominy, and on the Day of Resurrection,We will make him taste the torment of the inferno.

10.MunirMezyed2023: That is because of what your hands have sent forth. And most certainly, Allâh never does the least wrong to His servants.

11.MunirMezyed2023: And of the people is he who worships Allâh upon the very edge. If it happens that good thing befalls him, he is satisfied therewith. But if an ordeal befalls him, he turns completely over. So He loses both this worldly life and the Hereafter. That is indeed the irreparable loss.

12.MunirMezyed2023: Instead of Allâh, he calls upon that which can neither harm nor benefit him. That is the extreme deviation from the plain path of truth.

13.MunirMezyed2023: He calls upon the one whose harm is nearer than his profit-  how wretched the guardian and how wretched the associate!

14.MunirMezyed2023: Most assuredly Allâh will admit those who live by Faith and strive to do righteous acts (in the worldly life) into Gardens underneath which rivers flow. And most certainly, Allâh does whatever he is pleased to do.

15.MunirMezyed2023: And whoever thinks that Allâh won’t grant him- (Muhammad)- victory in this worldly life and in the Hereafter, then let him stretch a rope up to the ceiling, and let him sever it. Then let him see whether his scheme will remove that which enrages him.

16.MunirMezyed2023: And so We revealed the Qur'ān as irrefutable Signs. And Allâh certainly enlightens the path of those whom He wills.

17.MunirMezyed2023: Truly those who live by Faith, and those who are Jews, Sabians, Christians, Magians and the Polytheists- Allâh will indeed judge between them on the Day of Resurrection. And most certainly, Allâh is Witness over all things which they do.

18.MunirMezyed2023: Do you not see that whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth, as well as  the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, and all living creatures, as well as many humans make obeisance to Allâh? Yet there are many people on whom the punishment is rightly justified. And he whom Allâh humiliates, there is none to give him honour. And most certainly, Allâh does whatever he is pleased to do.

19.MunirMezyed2023: These are two opponents who have disputed over their Lord: But those who persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth, garments of Fire will be cut out for them, and Scalding Water will be poured over their heads,

20.MunirMezyed2023: Melting whatever is in their bellies, and (their) skins as well.

21.MunirMezyed2023: And there will be whips of iron for them.

22.MunirMezyed2023: Whenever, in their anguish, they strive to get out of it, they are driven back into it (and be told): "Taste the torment of the burning Fire!”

23.MunirMezyed2023: And most certainly, Allâh will admit those who live by Faith and strive to do righteous acts (in this worldly life) into Gardens underneath which rivers flow wherein they will be adorned with armbands of gold and pearls, and their garments therein will be of fine silk.

24.MunirMezyed2023: And they have been inspired to pursue the goodly words, and they have been inspired to walk in the Path of the All-Laudable

25.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed, (a painful doom awaits) those who persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth, and bar others from (following) the path of (knowing) Allâh and from (entering) the Sacred Mosque which We have made equally for all men, those who dwell therein and those who come from abroad. And whoever is inclined to commit impious and iniquitous deeds there, We will make him taste a painful punishment.

26.MunirMezyed2023: And (recall) when We showed Abraham the site of the (Sacred) House (and asked him) not to associate anything (in worship) with Me, and to purify My House for those who circumambulate it, those who stand in prayer and those who bow down and prostrate themselves in worship.

27.MunirMezyed2023: And proclaim to the mankind (the duty of) Hajj- (pilgrimage). They will come to you on foot and on every lean camel. They will come from every deep ravine

28.MunirMezyed2023: In order to witness all the benefits (provided) for them, and to celebrate the name of Allâh and declare His glory during the appointed days for what He has provided for them of (sacrificial) animals. So eat thereof and feed the wretched poor.

29.MunirMezyed2023: Then let them complete the rites prescribed for them, fulfil the vows which they may have made and circumambulate the Ancient House.

30.MunirMezyed2023: That (is the command). And whosoever venerates the sacred ordinances of Allâh, it will be better for him in the sight of his Lord. The cattle are made lawful unto you (for food) except for that which He has already mentioned to you. Now, therefore, shun the filth of the idols, and shun all words of falsehood.

31.MunirMezyed2023: Having a deep, pure, focused Faith in Allâh, don’t associate with Him anything. Whosoever associates any partners with Allâh - it is as though he had fallen from the sky, then the birds snatch him away, or the wind blows him off to a far distant place.

32.MunirMezyed2023: That (is the command). Whoever venerates the symbols of Allâh- it surely demonstrates the unfeigned piety of the hearts.

33.MunirMezyed2023: Therein are benefits for you for an appointed term; and afterward their lawful place of sacrifice is by the Ancient House.

34.MunirMezyed2023: For every Ummah, We have appointed a holy rite, that they may  mention the name of Allâh over what We have provided for them of cattle (while offering them). Your God is the One and Only God, therefore you must hasten to submit to Him alone. And give good tidings to those who humble themselves.

35.MunirMezyed2023: Who, when Allâh is mentioned, their hearts tremble with awe, and who endure patiently whatever may befall them, and who establish the regular Prayer and expend of what We have provided them.

36.MunirMezyed2023: And the bulky sacrificial camels and cattle We have appointed for you as one of the symbols of Allâh. There is much good things in them for you. So mention the name of Allâh upon them when they are lined up in standing position for sacrifice. Then when they fall down lifeless on their sides, eat thereof, and feed the needy and the beggar. This is how We made them subservient unto you so that you may show gratitude.

37.MunirMezyed2023: It is neither their flesh nor their blood that reaches Allâh, but what reaches Him is the unfeigned piety towards Him. This is how We made them subservient unto you so that you may glorify Allâh for giving you the awesome opportunity for receiving salvation. So announce the glad tidings to those who pursue righteousness and perfection in Faith.

38.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, Allâh defends strongly those who live by Faith. Lo! He doesn’t demonstrates  His own love for one who is perfidious and impious.

39.MunirMezyed2023: Permission is given to those who intend to fight because they were wronged. And Allâh alone is powerful enough to grant them victory.

40.MunirMezyed2023: (They are) those who have been expelled from their homes for no reason except that they say: ‘Our Lord is Allâh’. Had Allâh not driven back the people, some by the means of others, there had been destroyed Monasteries, Churches, Synagogues and Mosques wherein the Name of Allâh is much mentioned. And Allâh will surely grant victory to those who fight for His cause. And most certainly, Allâh is All- Powerful, Almighty.

41.MunirMezyed2023: Those who, if We give them authority in the land, will establish the regular Prayer, pay Zakāt, enjoin good and forbid evil. The consequence of all things belongs unto Allâh.

42.MunirMezyed2023: And if they deny you, so did the people of Noah before them, and also the tribes of ‘A'd and Thamūd,

43.MunirMezyed2023: And the people of Abraham, the people of Lot,

44.MunirMezyed2023: And the inhabitants of Midian. And Moses was denied, (too). But I gave respite to those who are spiritually dead and blind, then I seized them. And how dreadful was My condemnation and chastisement!

45.MunirMezyed2023: ( Imagine) so many towns we destroyed their inhabitants because they voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims. Now their dwellings lie in ruins- their wells abandoned and their lofty mansions deserted!

46.MunirMezyed2023: Have they not travelled through the land (to see the ruined cities) so  that they may have hearts wherewith to understand, or ears wherewith to hear? Indeed, it is not the eyes that are blind, but it is the hearts which are in the breasts that are blind.

47.MunirMezyed2023: Yet they (fervently) ask you to hasten the (divine) retribution! Allâh will not fail in His promise. And verily, a day with your Lord is as a thousand years of your reckoning.

48.MunirMezyed2023: And how many a town to which I gave respite while it was iniquitous, then I seized it. And with Me lies the journey’s end.

49.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "O mankind! I am sent to you only to deliver a severe warning’.

50.MunirMezyed2023: Then (as for) those who live by Faith and strive to do righteous acts, they shall have forgiveness and abundant provision.

51.MunirMezyed2023: And (as for) those who strive to confute Our Enlightenment Quotes, they will be the Denizens of Hell.

52.MunirMezyed2023: And We didn’t send before you any Messenger or Prophet, except that when he recited (the scripture), Satan threw into it (some falsehood). But Allâh eliminates what Satan throws in. Then, Allâh entrenches His Revelations. And Allâh is All- Knowing, All-Wise.

53.MunirMezyed2023: (Allâh) makes whatever Satan throws in a trial for those in whose hearts there is doubt, and for whose hearts are so hardened. And verily, those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims are in open schism.

54.MunirMezyed2023: (Allâh has also permitted this) so that those who have spiritual gift of knowledge may know that this Qur’ān is the absolute truth from your Lord and so their faith (in Allâh may be invigorated by It) and their hearts may be humbled to Him. And verily, It is Allâh who shows those who  live by Faith the right path.

55.MunirMezyed2023: Yet those who voluntarily and consciously refuse to Yield to the Truth will never cease to be in doubt concerning (the divine origin of) Qur’ān till the Hour (of death or resurrection) comes quickly and unexpectedly upon them, or the (divine) retribution of a barren day visits them.

56.MunirMezyed2023: The Absolute Sovereignty on the Day of Reckoning belongs unto Allâh (alone). He will judge between them. Those who live by Faith and strive to do righteous deeds will be in the Gardens of Bliss.

57.MunirMezyed2023: But those who persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth and deny Our Revelations will be subjected to humiliating punishment.

58.MunirMezyed2023: As for those who emigrated in the cause of Allâh and were slain or died, Allâh will definitely provide them with good provisions. Indeed, Allâh is the Best of the providers.

59.MunirMezyed2023: He will definitely admit them into a place with which they will be pleased. And indeed, Allâh is All-Knowing, Most Forbearing.

60.MunirMezyed2023: So shall it be. Whoever has retaliated with the like of that which he was afflicted and then has again been oppressed, Allâh will definitely support him. Indeed, Allâh is Oft-Pardoning, Oft-Forgiving.

61.MunirMezyed2023: That is because Allâh causes the night to pass into the day, and  the day to pass into the night. Indeed, Allâh is All-Hearer, All-Seer.

62.MunirMezyed2023: That is because Allâh is the (Ultimate) Truth, and what they call upon other than Him is the falsehood, and Allâh is the Most High, the Most Great.

63.MunirMezyed2023: Do you not see that Allâh sends down water from the sky, then the earth becomes green? Indeed, Allâh is the Most Kind and Courteous, Well-Acquainted with all things.

64.MunirMezyed2023: Unto Him belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is on the earth. And verily, Allâh is the self-sufficient, Worthy of all praise.

65.MunirMezyed2023: Do you not see that Allâh has made subservient to you all that is on the earth, and ships that sail on the sea by His command? He withholds the sky from falling upon the earth except by His permission. Indeed, Allâh is Full of Compassion and Most Merciful to the people.

66.MunirMezyed2023: And He is the One who gives you life. Then, He causes you to die and will again give you life. Indeed, man is so ungrateful.

67.MunirMezyed2023: For every Ummah We appointed sacred rites which they perform,  so let them not dispute with you in this matter. But invite them to your Lord. Indeed, for you're truly on the right path. .

68.MunirMezyed2023: If they dispute with you, then say: ‘Allâh has full knowledge of whatever you do.

69.MunirMezyed2023: And Allâh will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection regarding that wherein you used to differ ’.

70.MunirMezyed2023: Do you not know that Allâh has full knowledge of whatsoever is in the heaven and on the earth? Certainly this is in a book. That is indeed easy for Allâh.

71.MunirMezyed2023: Yet they worship besides Allâh others for which He has sent down no authority, and of which they have no knowledge. And there won’t be for those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims any helper.

72.MunirMezyed2023: And when Our Verses are recited to them as conclusive evidence, you can easily recognize (the signs of) repudiation on the faces of those who persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth. They are nearly ready to make an assault on those who recite to them Our Verses. Say: ‘Shall I inform you of something worse than that? (It is) the Fire which Allâh has promised for those who persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth. And it is an evil journey’s end!’

73.MunirMezyed2023: O’ mankind, a parable is set forth, so listen to it (cautiously):  Surely those whom you invoke besides Allâh cannot create a fly, even if they gathered together for that purpose. If the fly snatched away a thing from them, they would have no power to retrieve it from the fly. How helpless are (both) the seeker and the sought!

74.MunirMezyed2023: They don’t venerate Allâh in accordance with what is appropriate for Him, Indeed, Allâh is All-Strong, All- Mighty.

75.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh chooses Messengers from both Angels and people. Indeed, Allâh is All-Hearer, All-Seer.

76.MunirMezyed2023: He has full knowledge of what is before them, and what is behind them. To Allâh all matters are returned.

77.MunirMezyed2023: O’ you who live by Faith, bow down and prostrate yourselves, worship your Lord and strive to do good so that you may ultimately achieve a blissful life /or gain eternal salvation.

78.MunirMezyed2023: And strive hard for the cause of Allâh in accordance with what is required. He has chosen you and has not imposed on you an "undue" hardship in religion  It is the faith of your father Abraham. It is ( Allâh) Who named you Muslims both before and in this (Qur’ān), so that the Messenger (Muhammad) may be a witness over you, and you be witnesses over mankind! So establish the regular Prayer, pay the Zakāt and hold fast to Allâh. He is your Guardian- what an excellent Guardian and what an excellent Helper!

1.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, those who live by Faith will ultimately achieve salvation.

2.MunirMezyed2023: They are the ones who humble themselves in their prayers,

3.MunirMezyed2023: Who walk away from the evil vain talk,

4.MunirMezyed2023: Who pay zakāt,

5.MunirMezyed2023: Who guard their chastity

6.MunirMezyed2023: Except from their wives or those whom their right hands possess, for indeed, they won’t be held responsible for a fault or wrong-

7.MunirMezyed2023: But whoever seeks beyond that, then those are the transgressors -

8.MunirMezyed2023: And they who are extraordinarily perceptive for their trusts and  covenant,

9.MunirMezyed2023: And they who observe their prayers.

10.MunirMezyed2023: Those are the inheritors

11.MunirMezyed2023: Who will inherit the Paradise wherein they will live forever.

12.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, We created man from an essence of clay.

13.MunirMezyed2023: Then We placed him as a sperm-drop in a firm lodging.

14.MunirMezyed2023: Then We made the sperm-drop into a clinging substance; and We made the clinging substance into an embryonic lump. And We made from the embryonic lump, bones, then We covered the bones with flesh,  then We developed him into another creation. So Blessed is Allâh, the Best of creators.

15.MunirMezyed2023: After that you will definitely die.

16.MunirMezyed2023: Then on the Day of Resurrection, you will definitely be raised up.

17.MunirMezyed2023: And verily, We have created above you seven layered heavens. We have full knowledge of Our creation.

18.MunirMezyed2023: We send down water from the sky in due measure and lodged it in the earth. Indeed, We are Most Capable of taking it away.

19.MunirMezyed2023: Then We bring forth for you thereby gardens of palms and vines yielding abundant fruit for you to eat.

20.MunirMezyed2023: Also, a tree growing on the Mount of Sinai, which produces oil, and a relish for those who eat.

21.MunirMezyed2023: And most certainly there is a lesson for you in the cattle. We give you drink of that which is in their bellies, and there are numerous benefits in them for you and of them you eat.

22.MunirMezyed2023: And on them, and on the ships, you are carried.

23.MunirMezyed2023: Verily We sent Noah (as Our Messenger) to his people, and he said: "O’ my people, do worship Allâh! You have no other god beside Him. Will you not then act piously ?”

24.MunirMezyed2023: But the chiefs of his people, who refuse to Yield to the Truth, said: "This (man) is no more than a mortal like yourselves who seeks to attain superiority over you. Had Allâh willed, He would have surely sent down Angels (instead of him). We never heard of such a thing among our forefathers.

25.MunirMezyed2023: He is only a mad man, so bear with him for a while ’.

26.MunirMezyed2023: (He) said: "O’ my Lord! Help me, for they belie me.”

27.MunirMezyed2023: So We inspired him: ‘Start building the Ark under Our Eyes and through Our Inspiration. And when Our Command comes and water gushes forth from the Tanūr,- (an oven cave in the house of Noah)- embark therein two of every kind, a pair (male & female), and your family, except the ones for whom the decree (of the punishment) has already gone forth. Don’t plead with Me for those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims. Most assuredly, they are going to be drowned’.

28.MunirMezyed2023: Then, when you are firmly seated along with those with you in the Ark, say: "All praise is due unto Allâh Who has saved us from the iniquitous people’.

29.MunirMezyed2023: And say: ‘My Lord! Cause me to land at a blessed landing place. You are the Best of all who bring to land’.

30.MunirMezyed2023: Obviously, in that there are Signs (of Allâh’s power & glory), and most certainly We put (people) to the test.

31.MunirMezyed2023: Then, after them, We brought into being another generation,

32.MunirMezyed2023: We sent to them a Messenger from their own race - saying: "Do worship Allâh! You have no other god beside Him. Will you not then act piously?”

33.MunirMezyed2023: But the chiefs of his people who refuse to Yield to the Truth and deny the Meeting (with their Lord) in the Hereafter, and on whom We had bestowed great comfort and extravagant living in this worldly life, said: “He is no more than a mortal like yourselves. He eats of what you eat and drinks of what you drink.

34.MunirMezyed2023: And If it happens that you yield (to the whims of) a mortal like yourselves, then you will definitely be in the grip of perdition.

35.MunirMezyed2023: What! Does he promise you that when you are dead and become dust and bones, you will be brought back to life again?

36.MunirMezyed2023: (It is) far impossible, far impossible, that which you are promised!

37.MunirMezyed2023: There is nothing but our worldly life! We live and die! We will never ever be resurrected!

38.MunirMezyed2023: He is not more than a man who attributes falsehood to Allâh. So, we are not going to yield to his belief’.

39.MunirMezyed2023: He said: "O’ my Lord! Help me, for they belie me’.

40.MunirMezyed2023: (Allâh) said: "After a little, they will definitely become regretful."

41.MunirMezyed2023: So the (dreadful) Cry overtook them for a just reason. And We made them look like rubbish of dead leaves. Deprived of the Mercy of Allâh are those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims.

42.MunirMezyed2023: Then, after them, We brought into being other generations.

43.MunirMezyed2023: No nation can outstrip its term, neither can they delay it.

44.MunirMezyed2023: Then sent We Our Messengers in succession. And whenever there came to a nation its Messenger, they denied him. So We made them follow one another (to destruction). And We made them narrations.  Deprived of the Mercy of Allâh are the ones who have no tendency to live by Faith.

45.MunirMezyed2023: Then, We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our Signs and with decisive argument

46.MunirMezyed2023: To Pharaoh and his Chiefs. But they behaved arrogantly since they were supercilious people.

47.MunirMezyed2023: They said: ‘Are we going to yield to the belief of two men like ourselves and their people are submissive to our will?’

48.MunirMezyed2023: So they accused them of lying and became of those who were destroyed.

49.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, We gave Moses the Scripture so that they might grasp the opportunity for receiving salvation.

50.MunirMezyed2023: And We made the son of Mary- (Jesus)- and his mother a Sign and gave them both shelter on high ground having meadows and springs.

51.MunirMezyed2023: O’ Messengers! Eat of the pure and wholesome things and strive to do righteousness acts. And most certainly I have full knowledge of whatever you do.

52.MunirMezyed2023: Truly this, your Ummah, is one Ummah, and I am your Lord. Now, therefore, act piously.

53.MunirMezyed2023: Yet they split in their Faith between them into sects, each group rejoicing in what it has.

54.MunirMezyed2023: So leave them alone in their confusion for a time.

55.MunirMezyed2023: Do  they  think  that  by  giving  them  wealth and children

56.MunirMezyed2023: We are hastening to them of good things? Nay, they lack the ability to perceive (the truth).

57.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, those who tremble in awe of their Lord:

58.MunirMezyed2023: Who have Absolute Faith in Revelations of their Lord,

59.MunirMezyed2023: Who ascribe no partners to their Lord,

60.MunirMezyed2023: And who give that which they give (of the voluntary alms) while their hearts tremble with awe of knowing that they will return to their Lord-

61.MunirMezyed2023: These are the ones who hasten to do righteous acts, and they are foremost in doing them.

62.MunirMezyed2023: Never have We tasked any one beyond his scope, and with Us is a Record that speaks the truth. And they won’t be wronged.

63.MunirMezyed2023: Nay! But their hearts are in deep ignorance of this (Qur’ān), and they have other (evil) deeds, besides denial of the truth, which they persistently continue to commit.

64.MunirMezyed2023: Until, when We seize with punishment those of them who live in great comfort and extravagant living, they will suddenly start crying to Allâh for help.

65.MunirMezyed2023: Don’t cry for help today. surely you shall receive no help from Us:

66.MunirMezyed2023: My Verses were recited to you, but you used to turn back on your heels ,

67.MunirMezyed2023: Displaying an arrogant attitude, talking nonsense about the (Qur'ân) by night.

68.MunirMezyed2023: Have they not pondered the 'Qur’ān, or has there come upon them that which had not come upon their forefathers?

69.MunirMezyed2023: Or did they fail to recognize their Messenger and so they denied him?

70.MunirMezyed2023: Or do they say: "He is possessed?’ Nay, but he brought them the Truth. But most of them do loathe the truth.

71.MunirMezyed2023: But if the Truth -(the Qur’ān)- had yielded to their whims, then the heavens, the earth and whosoever is therein would have surely been corrupted! Nay, We have given to them their admonition, but they didn't take serious thought of their admonition.

72.MunirMezyed2023: Or do you ask them for any recompense? Yet the recompense of your Lord is far better, and He is the Best of those who provide sustenance.

73.MunirMezyed2023: And Most assuredly you summon them unto a straight path.

74.MunirMezyed2023: Yet those who have no Faith in the Hereafter are deviating from the path of truth.

75.MunirMezyed2023: Even if We showed them Mercy and removed the distress which is on them,  they would still persist in their transgression, blindly wandering.

76.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, We overtook them with punishment, but they didn’t capitulate to their Lord, neither did they humbly implore Him.

77.MunirMezyed2023: As soon as We opened on them a gate of extreme chastisement, (suddenly) they were plunged into despair therein!

78.MunirMezyed2023: He is the One Who has created for you the sense of hearing and sight , as well as  hearts, yet you show little gratitude

79.MunirMezyed2023: He is the One Who multiplied you in the earth, and to Him you are (destined) to be gathered.

80.MunirMezyed2023: He is the One Who gives life and causes death, and unto Him  belongs the difference of night and day. Don't you have conscious thoughts at least in this sense?

81.MunirMezyed2023: Nay, but they say things similar to what the ancients said.

82.MunirMezyed2023: They said: "What! When we are dead and become dust and bones, are we going to be resurrected indeed?

83.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, we and our forefathers were already been promised this before. Lo! This is no more than myths of ancients."

84.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "Unto whom belongs the earth and whosoever is therein, if you really have the knowledge?”

85.MunirMezyed2023: They will say: “Unto Allâh!" Say: "Will you not then take heed?"

86.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "Who is the Lord of the seven heavens, and the Throne?"

87.MunirMezyed2023: They will say: "Allâh”. Say: “Will you not then act piously?”

88.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "In Whose Hand is the sovereignty of everything? He is the One Who protects when none can be protected against His Own will, if you do have spiritual knowledge!

89.MunirMezyed2023: They will say: "(All that belongs) unto Allâh”. Say: "Then how are you deceived (into falling away from the true Faith)?"

90.MunirMezyed2023: Nay, but We have brought them the Truth and they are most surely liars.

91.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh has not taken to Himself any son, nor has there ever been with Him any god. Were this otherwise each god would surely have taken away what he had created, and some of them would surely have overpowered others. All Glory Be To Allâh above all that of which they attribute to Him!

92.MunirMezyed2023: (He is) All-Knowing of the unseen and the seen! High Exalted is He above all that which they associate with Him!

93.MunirMezyed2023: Say: “My Lord,  If You would show me that which they are promised!

94.MunirMezyed2023: My Lord, (If You are going to punish them), then exclude me from  those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims.

95.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed, We are Most Capable of showing you what We have promised them.

96.MunirMezyed2023: So repel evil with that which is good. We have full knowledge of what they describe.

97.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "My Lord, I earnestly seek refuge in You from the evil incitements of the devils."

98.MunirMezyed2023: "And I earnestly seek refuge in You, My Lord, lest they may approach me."

99.MunirMezyed2023: As soon as death comes to one of them, he says: "My Lord, send me back again

100.MunirMezyed2023: In order that I may do righteousness in that which I left behind." Never! It is but a word that he speaks. And there is a barrier behind them until the day when they are resurrected.

101.MunirMezyed2023: So when the Trumpet is blown, there will be no more relationships between them that day, nor will they ask about one another.

102.MunirMezyed2023: So as for those whose scale (of good deeds) is heavy, they are the ones who ultimately have achieved salvation.

103.MunirMezyed2023: But, as for those whose scale (of good deeds) is light, they are ones who are doomed to perdition. And in Gehenna will they abide.

104.MunirMezyed2023: The Fire will scorch their faces and therein they will grin, with displaced lips.

105.MunirMezyed2023: (They will be told), "Were not My Verses recited to you? But you used to deny them."

106.MunirMezyed2023: They will say: "Our Lord, our misery overcame us, and we were a people living in deception.

107.MunirMezyed2023: Our Lord, bring us out of this: if ever we return (to Evil), then shall we be ungodly sinners indeed.

108.MunirMezyed2023: He will say: “Sink into it and don’t speak to Me.”

109.MunirMezyed2023: Verily! There was a party of My servants, who used to say: "Our Lord, we live by Faith, therefore forgive us and grant us Mercy. You are the Best of all who show mercy!"

110.MunirMezyed2023: You used to mock and laugh at them to the extent that you forgot to celebrate My praise and declare my glory.

111.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, I have rewarded them this day for what they patiently endured . And they are indeed the ones who have gained salvation.

112.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh will ask: "How long did you stay on earth in number of years?"

113.MunirMezyed2023: They will reply: "We stayed a day or part of a day: ask the ones who have kept account."

114.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh will say: "You tarried but a little, if you had only known!

115.MunirMezyed2023: "Did you think that We created you without a reason, and that you would not be returned unto Us?"

116.MunirMezyed2023: So Highly Exalted is Allâh, the Sovereign, the Truth. There is no other god beside Him, Lord of the Glorious Throne.

117.MunirMezyed2023: And whoever invokes another god along with Allâh has no proof thereof. His reckoning is only with his Lord. Indeed, those who voluntarily and consciously will never gain salvation.

118.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "My Lord, forgive and have Mercy, for You are the Best of all those who show mercy.”

1.MunirMezyed2023: (This is) a Sūrat which We have sent down and enjoined, and wherein We have revealed irrefutable Signs so that you may take heed.

2.MunirMezyed2023: The adulterer and the adulteress, whip each one of them a hundred stripes. Don’t let pity impede you from the matter of obedience to Allâh if you believe in Allâh and the Last Day. And then let a party of the monotheistic believers witness their punishment.

3.MunirMezyed2023: The adulterer won't be allowed to marry any except an adulteress or a polytheistic woman, and (as for) the adulteress, none will be allowed to marry her except an adulterer or a polytheistic. Such (marriage) is forbidden to the monotheistic believers.

4.MunirMezyed2023: Those who accuse chaste women (of adultery) and cannot bring four witnesses, whip them with eighty stripes. And never accept from them any testimony ever after- Those are the ones who indulge in personal disobedience extensively without repentance.

5.MunirMezyed2023: Except for those who afterward repent and make amends. Indeed, Allâh afterward is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

6.MunirMezyed2023: As for those who accuse their wives (of adultery) but have no witnesses except themselves, let the testimony of one of them be four testimonies, (swearing) by Allâh that he is of those who speak the truth.

7.MunirMezyed2023: The fifth (testimony should be) that the curse of Allâh will be upon him in case he is one of those who lie (against her).

8.MunirMezyed2023: However, in order for her to be prevented from punishment, she should testify by Allâh four times that he is telling lie (against her).

9.MunirMezyed2023: The fifth (testimony should be) that the wrath of Allâh will descend upon her in case he speaks the truth.

10.MunirMezyed2023: Had it not been for the Bounty of Allâh and His Mercy toward you, (you would have fallen away from the Faith). Indeed, Allâh is Oft-Returning unto Mercy, the All-Wise.

11.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed! Those who brought forth the calumny (against Ā’ishah bint Abī Bakr) are a gang among you. Don’t consider it as an evil thing for you, rather it is good (lesson) for you. Every one of them will have what he has earned of the iniquity. And (as for) him who took upon himself the greater part of it will be subjected to a tremendous punishment.
