12.MunirMezyed2023: Why didn’t the Monotheistic Believers, men and women, when you  heard the calumny, think well of their own people, and say: "This (accusation) is an apparent mendacity?”

13.MunirMezyed2023: Why didn’t they (who made false and damaging statements about Ā’ishah) produce four witnesses? Since they were not able to bring witnesses, then they are liars in the sight of Allâh.

14.MunirMezyed2023: Had it not been for the Bounty of Allâh and His Mercy towards you in this worldly life and the Hereafter, an extremely severe punishment would have touched you for that (defamatory statement) in which you were involved.

15.MunirMezyed2023: You received it with your tongues, and spoke with your mouths that whereof you had no knowledge, and assumed that it was a frivolous thing while it was extremely serious thing in the sight of Allâh.

16.MunirMezyed2023: Why did you not when you heard it, say "It is not good to talk about it? All Glory Be to Allâh, this is a great mendacity.”

17.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh advises you not to return to the like of it ever again if you are living a life of Genuine Faith.

18.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh makes (His) Signs apparent to you: for Allâh is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

19.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed, those who would like to see indecency spreading among those who adhere to Faith will be subjected to a painful chastisement in this worldly life, as well as in the Hereafter. And Allâh has full knowledge of what you cannot encompass.

20.MunirMezyed2023: Had it not been for the Bounty of Allâh and His Mercy toward you, (you would have fallen away from the Faith). Indeed, Allâh is full of compassion, the Most Merciful.

21.MunirMezyed2023: O’ you who live by Faith, don’t follow the footsteps of the devil. And whoever follows the footsteps of the devil (need to know that) the devil commands indecency and whatever is bad. Had it not been for the Bounty of Allâh and His Mercy towards you, none of you would ever have been purified. But Allâh purifies whom He wills. And Allâh is All-Hearer, All-Knowing.

22.MunirMezyed2023: Don’t let those of you who possess bounty and abundance swear against giving to their kinsmen and the poor, as well as to those who emigrated for the cause of Allâh. So let them pardon and forgive. Do you not love that Allâh should forgive you? And Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

23.MunirMezyed2023: Surely, those who (falsely) accuse the chaste, unsuspecting, monotheistic women (of adultery) are cursed in this worldly life and in the Hereafter. Theirs will be an extremely severe punishment:

24.MunirMezyed2023: On the day when their tongues, hands and feet will testify against them concerning that which they used to do.

25.MunirMezyed2023: On that day Allâh will pay them their due in full, and they will come to know that Allâh is the Perceptible Truth.

26.MunirMezyed2023: Sinful women are for sinful men, and sinful men are for sinful women.  Good women are for good men, and  good men are for good women. Those (good people) are innocent of what people allege. For them there will be forgiveness and an abundant sustenance.

27.MunirMezyed2023: O’ you who live by Faith, don’t enter houses other than yours, until you have asked permission and saluted their inhabitants. This is better for you so that you may take this into consideration.

28.MunirMezyed2023: But if you don't find anyone therein, still don't enter until permission has been given. If you were told to go back, then you must do so. That is purer for you. And Allâh is All-Knowing of whatever they do.

29.MunirMezyed2023: You would not be at fault if you entered uninhabited houses wherein is comfort for you. And Allâh has full knowledge of whatever you disclose and whatever you conceal.

30.MunirMezyed2023: Tell those men who live a life of Genuine Faith to lower their gaze and guard their chastity that is purer for them. Indeed, Allâh has full knowledge of whatever they do.

31.MunirMezyed2023: And say to those women who live a life of Genuine Faith: that they should lower their gaze and guard their chastity: that they should not unleash their adornment except what appears thereof: that should draw their veils over their bosoms and not to reveal their adornment save to their own husbands, or their fathers, or the fathers of their husbands, or their sons, or the sons of their husbands, or their brothers, or the sons of their brothers, or the sons of their sisters, or their women, or their women slaves, or old male servants who lack vigor, or children who are not yet aware of the private aspects of women. Let them not stamp their feet so as to reveal what they hide of their adornment. Turn to Allâh in repentance, all of you,  O’ monotheistic believers, so that you may attain salvation.

32.MunirMezyed2023: Motivate those of you who are single to get married, as well as those who are righteous among your male and female slaves. If they were poor, Allâh would enrich them of His Bounty. And Allâh is All-Encompassing, All-Knowing.

33.MunirMezyed2023: But let those who don’t  find  the financial means for marriage guard their chastity, until Allâh makes them wealthier of His Bounty. Those of your slaves who seek emancipation, contract with them accordingly if you know any good in them, and give them of the wealth of Allâh which He has given you. Don’t oblige your slave-girls to prostitution when they seek chastity, so that you may obtain some temporary benefits of this worldly life. If someone obliges them (to prostitution), then Allâh is to them, after their compulsion, Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

34.MunirMezyed2023: And verily We have sent down for you irrefutable Signs, stories of those who passed away before you and an admonition for the Pious.

35.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The parable of His light is as a niche wherein a lamp, the lamp is in a glass, the glass is as it were a dazzling star. (It is) kindled from a blessed tree, an olive that is neither of the East nor of the West, whose oil would almost glitter even if no fire has touched it. Light upon light. And Allâh guides to His Light whom He wills. Allâh strikes parables for the people. And Allâh has full knowledge of all things.

36.MunirMezyed2023: (The light of Allâh shines through) in houses- (mosques)-, which Allâh has allowed to be raised and that His Name to be commemorated therein. In them, His Name is glorified there mornings and evenings.

37.MunirMezyed2023: (Those who glorify Allâh are) men whom neither trade nor sale can divert from celebrating the praise of Allâh, establishing the regular Prayer and paying Zakāt. They are in awe of a day when all hearts and eyes be turned about,

38.MunirMezyed2023: (Hoping) that Allâh will reward them with the best of what they did and give them more out of His grace. And Allâh provides without measure for whom He wills.

39.MunirMezyed2023: As for those who persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth, all their deeds are like a mirage in a lowland. The thirsty one supposes to be water until he comes up to it, he finds it to be nothing, instead, he finds Allâh before Him. So He pays him in full his due. And Allâh is Swift in taking account.

40.MunirMezyed2023: Or (their deeds are) like the darkness in a vast deep sea which is engulfed with waves topped by waves, topped by dark clouds, darkness upon darkness. If it happens that a man stretches out his hand, he will hardly see it! To the one whom Allâh has not given light, for him there is no light.

41.MunirMezyed2023: Do you not see that whatsoever is in the heavens and on the earth, and the birds in flight with wings spread, celebrates the praise of Allâh and declares His glory? Each one knows its way of prayer and glorification. And Allâh has full knowledge of whatsoever they do.

42.MunirMezyed2023: Unto Allâh belongs the (absolute) sovereignty of the heavens and of the earth. And to Allâh is the final return.

43.MunirMezyed2023: Do you not see that Allâh drives the clouds, then gathers them together, then makes them layers, and then you see the rain coming out of them?  He sends down out of the sky mountains (of clouds), wherein is hail, and He strikes with it whom He wills and averts it from whom He wills. The flash of its Lightning almost snatches away the sight.

44.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh makes the night and the day to revolve. And most certainly in that there is a lesson for those who have insight.

45.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh has created every (living) creature from water.  So of them is that which crawls upon its belly, of them is that which walks on two legs, of them is that which walks on four legs. Indeed, Allâh is Most Capable of doing whatsoever He desires.

46.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, We have sent down to you irrefutable Signs. And Allâh guides whom He wills to a straight path.

47.MunirMezyed2023: And they- (Hypocrites)- say: "We believe in Allâh and the Messenger, and we obey." Then a party of them turns away soon after this. These don’t live a life of Genuine Faith.

48.MunirMezyed2023: And when they are called to Allâh and His Messenger to judge between them, behold, a party among them are reluctant to go.

49.MunirMezyed2023: However, when right is theirs, they come to him promptly obedient.

50.MunirMezyed2023: Is there a disease in their hearts? Or do they suspect or fear that Allâh or His Messenger would act unjustly with them?  Nay, but it is they who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned Faith in favour of their own whims.

51.MunirMezyed2023: The only saying of those who live a life of Genuine Faith is that they say: "We have heard and we do obey,” these are ones who will ultimately achieve a blissful life.

52.MunirMezyed2023: And whoever obeys Allâh and His Messenger, worships Him with reverence and awe, and act piously towards Him, these are the ones who will ultimately gain salvation.

53.MunirMezyed2023: And they -(the Hypocrites)- solemnly swear by Allâh with their strongest oaths that if it happens that you command them (to fight in the cause of Allâh), they will definitely go forth. Say: "Stop swearing (falsely in the name of Allâh). (Such) obedience (of yours) is known by all! Indeed, Allâh has full knowledge of whatever you do.”

54.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "(Comply with what) Allâh (has commanded), and (yield to what has revealed to) the Messenger.” But if you turn away, upon him only rests what he has been charged with, and upon you only rests what you have been charged with. However, if you yield to him, you will be on the right path. The sole duty of the Messenger is to convey (the Message) clearly.

55.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh has promised those who live by Faith and strive to do righteous acts that He will definitely make them successors in the land as He did with those before them, entrench for them their faith which He has chosen for them, and replace their present state of fear with security. They worship Me (in the way I want them to worship Me), not associating anything (in worship) with Me. So, whoever is tempted to live in spiritual darkness after this (promise), such indeed are the ones who indulge in personal disobedience extensively without repentance.

56.MunirMezyed2023: Establish the regular Prayer, pay Zakāt and obey the Messenger so that you may be delivered from the consequences of your sins.

57.MunirMezyed2023: Don’t ever think that those who live in spiritual darkness can frustrate (Our Power) on the earth. Their final refuge is the Fire- what a dreadful refuge!

58.MunirMezyed2023: O’ you who live by the Faith, let those whom your right hands possess and those of you who have not yet reached puberty ask for your permission (before coming into your private room) on three occasions: Before the Morning Prayer, when you put aside your clothing for rest at noon and after the Night Prayer. These are three times of privacy for you. There is no blame on you or on them (if they come in without permission), apart from these occasions that you go about one to the other. This is how Allâh makes for you the Messages easy to perceive. And  Allâh is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

59.MunirMezyed2023: When the children among you reach puberty, then let them (also) seek permission as those before them did. This is how Allâh makes for you His Messages easy to be perceived. And  Allâh is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

60.MunirMezyed2023: And as for menopausal women, who don't expect to marry, they will not be in fault if they discard their (outer) garments without unleashing their  ornaments. But if they refrain from this, it will be better for them. And Allâh is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

61.MunirMezyed2023: There is no blame on the blind, nor any blame on the lame, nor any blame on the sick, that you eat at your own houses, or the houses of your fathers, or the houses of your mothers, or the houses of your brothers, or the houses of your sisters, or the houses of your paternal uncles, or the houses of your paternal aunts,  or the houses of your maternal uncles, or the houses of your maternal aunts, or (houses) whereof you possess the keys, or the houses of your friends. It is no sin on you that you eat together or separately. So, when you enter any of these houses, greet one another with a blessed, pure and good salutation appointed by Allâh. This is how Allâh makes for you the Messages perceivable so that you may achieve a higher level of consciousness.

62.MunirMezyed2023: The true monotheistic believers are only those who believe in Allâh and His Messenger, and when they are with him on a collective cause, they don’t leave until they have obtained his permission. And most certainly those who ask for your permission are the ones who truly believe in Allâh and His Messenger. So, if they ask you for permission for some of their, give permission to whomever of them you desire, and ask Allâh for their forgiveness. Indeed, Allâh is Oft- Forgiving, Most Merciful.

63.MunirMezyed2023: Don’t consider the summons of the Messenger among yourselves as the summons of one of you to another.  Allâh has full knowledge of those of you who surreptitiously sneak away, taking cover behind one another. So let those who go against his order be aware lest a bitter trial befall them or a painful chastisement afflict them.

64.MunirMezyed2023: And most certainly, unto Allâh belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and on the earth. He has full knowledge of where you do stand. (He knows well) the day when they will be brought back to Him. So He will inform them of whatever they used to do.  And Allâh is All-Knowing of all things.

1.MunirMezyed2023: Blessed is the He Who has revealed the Criterion to His servant so that he may warn all the peoples.

2.MunirMezyed2023: He unto Whom belongs the (absolute) sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. He has not taken to Himself (any) child, nor has He any partner in the sovereignty. He has created everything, and then ordained for it a measure.

3.MunirMezyed2023: Yet some worship, apart from Him, gods that who cannot create anything but are themselves created. They have no power to hurt or profit themselves. And they have no authority over death, life, or resurrection.

4.MunirMezyed2023: Those who persistently refuse to Yield to the Truth say: ‘ This Qur’ān is nothing but a calumny which he has invented with the help of others’. Verily, they have brought inequity and falsehood.

5.MunirMezyed2023: They say: ‘Legends of the ancients, which he has written, and they are dictated to him in the early mornings and evenings’.

6.MunirMezyed2023: Say: ‘It has been revealed by the One Who has the full knowledge of the secrets of the heavens and earth. Indeed, He is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful ‘.

7.MunirMezyed2023: They say: ‘What kind of Messenger is this who eats food and goes about in marketplaces?. Why has not an Angel sent down to him to be a herald with him?

8.MunirMezyed2023: Or (why) has not a treasure been sent down upon him from the heaven?  Or why has he not a garden whereof he may eat?" Those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned Faith in favour of their own whims say: ’You follow none other than a man bewitched’.

9.MunirMezyed2023: See how they set forth parables for you, so they have deviated from the path of truth and are unable to find a way.

10.MunirMezyed2023: Most Blessed is the One Who, if He willed, He could easily give better than all that - gardens under which rivers flow- and will assign to you mansions.

11.MunirMezyed2023: In fact, they persistently refuse to acknowledge ( the existence of  the Hour (of Reckoning). We have prepared a blazing inferno for those who deny it.

12.MunirMezyed2023: When it sees them from a distant place, they will hear its fury and its sighing.

13.MunirMezyed2023: And when they are cast into a narrow place thereof, chained together, they will plead there for destruction.

14.MunirMezyed2023: Don’t plead today for one destruction, but plead for many.

15.MunirMezyed2023: Say: ‘Is that (punishment) better or the Eternal Paradise, which has been promised to those who act piously? It will be a reward and a final destination for them.

16.MunirMezyed2023: Living therein forever, they will have whatever they desire. This is a promise which your Lord has bound Himself to fulfill.

17.MunirMezyed2023: And on the day when He will gather them together along with those whom they used to worship, other than Allâh, he will ask: ‘Was it you who led my servants astray, or did they themselves deviate from the path of truth?’

18.MunirMezyed2023: They will say: ‘All Glory Be To You! It would not be appropriate for us to take any guardian besides You. But You make them and their fathers live a life of luxury until they forgot to honor and celebrate Your name. So, now they are doomed to eternal perdition’.

19.MunirMezyed2023: Thus, those whom you used to worship will give you the lie regarding what you allege. Now you can neither avert (the chastisement), nor find help. And whoever among you willfully persists in yielding to his own whims, We shall make him taste the severe punishment.

20.MunirMezyed2023: And We didn't send before you any Messengers but that they ate food and went about in the marketplaces. We have made some of you a trial for others. Will you then endure patiently? Verily, Your Lord is Ever All-Seer.

21.MunirMezyed2023: Those who don’t have hope in meeting Us (in the Hereafter) say: ‘Why are no Angels sent down on us? Or why do we not see our Lord?’ Verily, they are arrogantly proud of themselves, exhibiting lack of respect; rude and discourteous.

22.MunirMezyed2023: On the day when they see the Angels, there will be no glad tidings for the Ungodly Sinners. And (the Angels) will say: ‘(Al-Jannah has been) prohibited and unreachable (for you)’.

23.MunirMezyed2023: We will look upon whatever deeds they have done; and We will turn them into scattered dust.

24.MunirMezyed2023: The companions of Al-Jannah on that day will be in a better lodging and better resting place.

25.MunirMezyed2023: And (mention) the day when the sky is split open with glittering white clouds, and the Angels are sent down in a spectacular descending.

26.MunirMezyed2023: The Absolute Sovereignty on that day will be tothe True Merciful (God), and it will be a tough day for those who are spiritually dead and blind.

27.MunirMezyed2023: On that day the one who has voluntarily and consciously abandoned Faith in favour of his own whims will bite his hands and say: “Oh, would that I had taken a way in the company of the Messenger!

28.MunirMezyed2023: Ah! Woe betide me! Would that I had not taken such a one for a friend!

29.MunirMezyed2023: He verily deceived me into going away from the Qur’ān), after it had been revealed to me. There Satan proved himself to be a traitor to man!’

30.MunirMezyed2023: The Messenger will say: ‘O’ my Lord, most certainly my people have regarded this Qur’ān as something to be ignored’.

31.MunirMezyed2023: This is how We  have made enemies for every Prophet from among the Ungodly Sinners. But Your Lord is sufficient as a Revealer of Truth and a helper (against your enemy).

32.MunirMezyed2023: Those who are living in spiritual darkness say: ‘Why has not the Qur’ān been revealed to him all at once?’ We send it down in parts so that We may (entrench it in your mind) and strengthen your heart with it. We are revealing it (to you) clearly and progressively.

33.MunirMezyed2023: And whenever they come to you with a pretext, We provide you with the truth (to refute their pretext), and the best explanation (to raise their awareness).

34.MunirMezyed2023: Those who will be dragged into Gehenna on their faces will be in the worst condition, and are now the furthest astray (from the path of truth).

35.MunirMezyed2023: And verily, We gave Moses the Scripture and appointed with him his brother Aaron as a minster.

36.MunirMezyed2023: Then We said: ‘Go both of you to the people who voluntarily and consciously refuse to acknowledge the Revelation Knowledge which We have revealed’. (After warning them not to continue in their perversion), We destroyed them with complete destruction.

37.MunirMezyed2023: The people of Noah, when they had denied the Messengers, We drowned them and made them a lesson for the people. We have prepared a painful punishment for those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned Faith in favour of their own whims.

38.MunirMezyed2023: (We also destroyed the tribes of) ‘Ād, Thamūd and the dwellers of Ar-Rass, as well as many generations between them.

39.MunirMezyed2023: To each of these We clearly showed Our Signs (of power & glory), and each of them We destroyed completely.

40.MunirMezyed2023: And verily they have passed by the town on which was showered with the rain of evil. Can it be that they have not seen it? Nay! But they have no expectation of being resurrected.

41.MunirMezyed2023: And whenever they see you, they poke fun at you (and say): "Is this the one whom Allâh has sent as a Messenger?

42.MunirMezyed2023: He would almost have caused us to do astray from our gods if we had not been faithful to them’. They will come to know who has been deceived into going away from the path of truth when they face the chastisement (of their Lord).

43.MunirMezyed2023: Have you seen the one who takes his own whims as his god?  Would you then be a disposer of affairs for him?

44.MunirMezyed2023: Or do you think that most of them hear and understand? They are but like cattle. The fact is that they are further astray from the path of truth.

45.MunirMezyed2023: Have you not seen how your Lord extend the shadow? If He willed, He would definitely make it still. Then We have made the sun a sign of it.

46.MunirMezyed2023: Then We slowly draw it back up towards Us.

47.MunirMezyed2023: He is the One Who makes the night a garment for you, and sleeping a rest, and He makes the day for rising.

48.MunirMezyed2023: He is the One Who sends forth the winds as glad tidings before His Mercy, and We send down pure water from the sky

49.MunirMezyed2023: In order to revive with it a dead land, and give it for drink to many living beings among Our creation, beasts and people.

50.MunirMezyed2023: And Verily We distribute it among them so that they may celebrate the praise of Allâh and declare His glory. Yet most of the people don't yield to aught except ingratitude.

51.MunirMezyed2023: Had We willed, We could have sent a Messenger to every town to deliver a warning.

52.MunirMezyed2023: Now, therefore, don’t yield to the whims of those who are spiritually dead and blind. Strive hard against them with this (Qur’ān) in a mighty struggle.

53.MunirMezyed2023: He is the One who merges the two seas: one is palatable and sweet, and the other is salty and sour. Yet has He set a barrier between them as an insuperable partition.

54.MunirMezyed2023: He is the One who created man from water and made him kindred of blood and marriage. Lo! Your Lord is Ever All- Powerful.

55.MunirMezyed2023: Yet they worship, other than Allâh, that which can neither benefit nor harm them. So the one who is spiritually dead and blind is a strong supporter (of Satan) against his own Lord.

56.MunirMezyed2023: And We have sent you for no other reason but to give glad tidings and warnings.

57.MunirMezyed2023: Say: ‘I do not ask of you in return (for my preaching) any reward, except that whoever wishes to follow a way to his Lord (and to be saved)’.

58.MunirMezyed2023: And depend on the Ever-Living One with full trust, who doesn’t die. And celebrate His praise and declare His absolute majesty and glory. He has full knowledge of the iniquitous deeds of His servants.

59.MunirMezyed2023: He is the One who created the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them in six Days, and then established Himself on the Glorious Throne. (He is indeed) the True Merciful (God). And ask (only) Him about (His Divine & Majestic Qualities) since He has the full knowledge of all things.

60.MunirMezyed2023: And when they are asked to prostrate before the True Merciful (God), they say: ‘What is the True Merciful (God)? Shall we prostrate before whatever you order us?" And your preaching adds to their aversion.

61.MunirMezyed2023: Most Blessed is the One who has placed Mansions of the stars in the sky and placed therein a tremendous lamp -(sun)- and a shinning moon.

62.MunirMezyed2023: He is the One who has appointed the night and the day to succeed one another for whoever seeks to ruminate (on the nature of existence) or to express his gratitude (to Him).

63.MunirMezyed2023: The (devoted) servants of the True Merciful (God) are those who walk modestly on the earth, and when the ignorant ones address them, they reply: ‘Peace’.

64.MunirMezyed2023: They are the ones who spend the night prostrating themselves before their Lord and standing.

65.MunirMezyed2023: (They are) the ones who say: ‘Our Lord! avert from us the Fury of Gehenna! Its Fury is definitely an everlasting agony.

66.MunirMezyed2023: Dreadful indeed is it as a lodging-place and an abode!’

67.MunirMezyed2023: Those who, when they spend, are not recklessly extravagant and not niggardly, but maintain moderation.

68.MunirMezyed2023: They don’t invoke with Allâh another god, or take the life which Allâh has forbidden except in the cause of justice, and do don’t commit adultery. For Whoever commits that will have to incur a severe penalty:

69.MunirMezyed2023: The punishment will be doubled for him on the Day of Resurrection; and he will abide therein in ignominy,

70.MunirMezyed2023: Except him who repents, adheres to Faith and strives to do righteous acts. For such, Allâh will replace their  iniquitous deeds with good ones. Lo! Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

71.MunirMezyed2023: And whoever repents and strives to do righteous acts has surely turned unto Allâh with sincere repentance.

72.MunirMezyed2023: (They are) those who never testify in the favor of falsehood, and whenever they pass near an evil vain talk, they pass by with sublimity.

73.MunirMezyed2023: Those who, when they are reminded of the Messages of their Lord, they don’t fall down deaf or blind.

74.MunirMezyed2023: And who say: ‘Our Lord, vouchsafe us the feeling of great pleasure of our wives and of our offspring. And make us an example for the Pious’.

75.MunirMezyed2023: Those will be awarded with the loftiest chamber for what they patiently endured (in their struggle in the cause of Allâh). And they will be received therein with a salutation of welcome and peace,

76.MunirMezyed2023: Living therein forever. What a marvelous lodging-place and abode!

77.MunirMezyed2023: Say: ‘My Lord would not concern Himself with you if it were not for your supplication. Now that you have voluntarily and consciously denied (the Prophet and the Qur’ān), then the punishment is inevitable.

1.MunirMezyed2023: Ta. Si’in. Mim!

2.MunirMezyed2023: These are the Verses of the irrefutable Book- (the Qur’ān).

3.MunirMezyed2023: Perhaps you will torment yourself to death with grief because they voluntarily and consciously refuse to adhere to the Faith.

4.MunirMezyed2023: If such were Our Wisdom and the Will, We could send down on them from the sky a (Prodigious) Sign so that they would bend their necks in humility to it.

5.MunirMezyed2023: And whenever New Revelation Knowledge comes to them from the All-Merciful (God) to admonish them, they turn away from it.

6.MunirMezyed2023: Most certainly they voluntarily and consciously refuse to acknowledge (the divine origin of the Qur’ān). So the news of what they mock will soon come to them.

7.MunirMezyed2023: Have they not seen the earth in which We caused different types of gracious plants to grow in pairs?

8.MunirMezyed2023: Surely in this there is a Sign (of Allâh's power & glory), yet most of them don’t live a life of Genuine Faith.

9.MunirMezyed2023: And most assuredly Your Lord is the One Who is the Almighty and the Most Merciful.

10.MunirMezyed2023: And (mention) when your Lord called Moses: ‘Go to the people who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned Faith in favour of their own whims,

11.MunirMezyed2023: The clan of Pharaoh. Will they not act piously?’

12.MunirMezyed2023: Moses said: ‘O’ my Lord! Verily, I fear that they will deny me,

13.MunirMezyed2023: And my breast will be straitened. And my tongue is not eloquent enough (to be able to persuade them to Yield to the Truth). So send Aaron (to accompany me in this mission).

14.MunirMezyed2023: Beside that, they have a charge (of murder) against me, and I am afraid that they will sentence me to death’.

15.MunirMezyed2023: (Allâh) said: ‘By no means! Now, therefore, go you both with Our Signs (of power & glory which I have provided you). We will definitely be with you all, listening closely to you.

16.MunirMezyed2023: So go now, both of you, to the Pharaoh and say: ’We are the Messengers of the Lord of all the beings,

17.MunirMezyed2023: So let the Children of Israel go with us’.

18.MunirMezyed2023: Pharaoh said: ‘Did we not bring you up among us when you were a child? You spent so many years of your life among us!

19.MunirMezyed2023: Then you committed that (nefarious) deed of yours which you did. And you were one of the ungrateful’.

20.MunirMezyed2023: (Moses) said: ‘I did it when I was of those who fall away from the Faith’.

21.MunirMezyed2023: So I fled from you when I became afraid that you (would sentence me to death), then my Lord vouchsafed me the authority (of moral judgments) and appointed me as one of (His) Messengers.

22.MunirMezyed2023: As for that past favor that you castigate me with (is owed to the fact) that you have (unjustly) enslaved the Children of Israel’.

23.MunirMezyed2023: Pharaoh said: ’What do you mean by the Lord of all the beings?’

24.MunirMezyed2023: Moses said: ‘Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, if you have Absolute Faith’.

25.MunirMezyed2023: Pharaoh said to those around: ‘Do you not hear (what he is saying)?’

26.MunirMezyed2023: Moses said: ‘Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers’.

27.MunirMezyed2023: Pharaoh said: ‘Indeed! Your Messenger, who has been sent to you, is certainly a lunatic’.

28.MunirMezyed2023: Moses said: ‘Lord of the east and the west, as well as all that is between them, if you only have a higher level of consciousness.

29.MunirMezyed2023: Pharaoh said: ‘If it happens that you choose a god other than me, I will definitely put you in jail’.

30.MunirMezyed2023: Moses said: ‘Even if I brought to you something manifest?’

31.MunirMezyed2023: Pharaoh said: ‘Do bring it forth then, if you are of the truthful!’

32.MunirMezyed2023: So he cast his staff and suddenly it became a veritable serpent.

33.MunirMezyed2023: Then he drew forth his hand (from his armpit after placing it therein), it was glittering white in the eyes of the beholders.

34.MunirMezyed2023: Pharaoh said to the chiefs around him: ‘Indeed! This (man) is certainly an expert magician.

35.MunirMezyed2023: He seeks to drive you out of your land by his sorcery. So what do you suggest?’

36.MunirMezyed2023: They said: "Now, therefore, give him and his brother a respite, and (in the meantime) send forth heralds to all cities

37.MunirMezyed2023: To bring to your presence every expert magician’.

38.MunirMezyed2023: So the magicians were assembled for an appointed of a fixed day.

39.MunirMezyed2023: It was said to the people: "Are you going to come?”

40.MunirMezyed2023: They say: “We may follow (the faith of the magicians) if they become victorious’.

41.MunirMezyed2023: When the magicians came, they said to Pharaoh: ‘We shall certainly obtain a (big) reward if we attain victory, shall we?’

42.MunirMezyed2023: He said: ‘Yes, indeed. You will then be among the closest senior advisors to me’.

43.MunirMezyed2023: Moses said to the magicians: ‘Do throw whatever you desire to throw!’

44.MunirMezyed2023: So they threw their ropes and their sticks, (saying): ‘By the great power of Pharaoh, it is we who will definitely be victorious’.

45.MunirMezyed2023: Then Moses threw his staff and suddenly it swallowed up what they simulated.

46.MunirMezyed2023: So the magicians were impelled to fall down prostrate,

47.MunirMezyed2023: Saying: ‘We affirm our faith in the Lord of all the beings:

48.MunirMezyed2023: The Lord of Moses and Aaron’.

49.MunirMezyed2023: (Pharaoh) said: ‘You have adhered to his Faith before I gave you the permission. Most certainly he is your Master who taught you sorcery. But you will surely reap what you sow. I will surely cut off your hands and feet alternately and crucify you all’.

50.MunirMezyed2023: They said: ‘No harm! Verily, we are bound to return to our Lord.

51.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed! We ardently hope that our Lord will deliver us from all the consequences of our iniquitous deeds, for we are the first of those adhere to the Faith’.

52.MunirMezyed2023: And We inspired Moses: ‘Set forth with My servants by night!  Most Certainly, you are going to be chased’.

53.MunirMezyed2023: Pharaoh sent heralds into the cities

54.MunirMezyed2023: (Announcing publicly): "Indeed, those are but a small troop,

55.MunirMezyed2023: Who are raging furiously against us.

56.MunirMezyed2023: And we are truly very cautious multitude’.

57.MunirMezyed2023: Thus, We deprived them of gardens, springs,

58.MunirMezyed2023: Treasures and honorable status.

59.MunirMezyed2023: This is how We caused the Children of Israel to inherit these luxuries.

60.MunirMezyed2023: Thus, they -(Pharaoh & his host) - pursued them at sunrise.

61.MunirMezyed2023: And when the two hosts came in view of each other, the companions of Moses said: ‘We will be definitely overtaken’.

62.MunirMezyed2023: Moses said: "No way! Most certainly my Lord is with me. He will direct me’.

63.MunirMezyed2023: So We inspired Moses: ‘Strike the sea with your staff’. It parted and each part became like a great towering mountain.

64.MunirMezyed2023: Then We brought the others (Pharaoh & his host) closer to them .

65.MunirMezyed2023: (Eventually), We saved Moses and all those with him,

66.MunirMezyed2023: And drowned the others.

67.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed, in this there was a Sign (of Allâh’s power & glory). Yet most of them live without Faith.

68.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed! Your Lord is the One who is absolutely the Almighty, the Most Merciful.

69.MunirMezyed2023: And recite to them the story of Abraham:

70.MunirMezyed2023: When he said to his father and his people: ‘What is it that which you devotedly worship?’

71.MunirMezyed2023: They said: ‘We worship idols but we shall always be faithfully devoted to them’.

72.MunirMezyed2023: He asked: 'Do they hear you when you call upon them?

73.MunirMezyed2023: Can they benefit or harm you?’

74.MunirMezyed2023: They said: “But we found forefathers doing the same."

75.MunirMezyed2023: He said: ‘So, have you thought carefully about what you have been worshiping,

76.MunirMezyed2023: You and all your forefathers before you?

77.MunirMezyed2023: Surely, they are enemies of me except the Lord of all the beings,

78.MunirMezyed2023: Who created me. Thus, He will guide me (into all the truth).

79.MunirMezyed2023: He is the One who feeds me and gives me to drink.

80.MunirMezyed2023: And when I am sick, He is the One Who heals me,

81.MunirMezyed2023: Who will cause me to die, and then will give me life.

82.MunirMezyed2023: He is the One Whom I do look forward to forgiving my iniquitous deeds on the Day of Judgment.

83.MunirMezyed2023: My Lord, vouchsafe me the authority (of moral judgments), join me with the righteous.

84.MunirMezyed2023: Let my name be mentioned in reverential tones among later generations.

85.MunirMezyed2023: Make me one of those who will inherit the garden and live in perfect happiness.

86.MunirMezyed2023: And forgive my father. Indeed, he is among those who have been deceived into going away (from the path of truth).

87.MunirMezyed2023: (O’ My Lord), don’t disgrace me on the day when they will be raised up,

88.MunirMezyed2023: The day when neither wealth nor sons will avail,

89.MunirMezyed2023: Except the one who comes to Allâh with pure heart’.

90.MunirMezyed2023: Al-Jannah will be brought near (that day) to the Pious- (who show honor and reverence for Allâh / or who guard themselves against falling into temptation and iniquity/ or who live before the face of Allâh).

91.MunirMezyed2023: And Gehenna will appear plainly visible to the beguilers.

92.MunirMezyed2023: It will be said to them: ‘Where is that you used to worship,

93.MunirMezyed2023: Other than Allâh? Can they help you now or help themselves?’

94.MunirMezyed2023: Then they will be overturned into the (Hell),  they, the beguilers,

95.MunirMezyed2023: And the soldiers of Iblīs all together.

96.MunirMezyed2023: They will say while blaming one another therein:

97.MunirMezyed2023: ‘By Allâh! We were truly living in greatest deception

98.MunirMezyed2023: When we considered you as equals with the Lord of the beings.

99.MunirMezyed2023: No one had the ability to lead us to error except the Ungodly Sinners.

102.MunirMezyed2023: (What a pity!) If we could only have a chance to return (to the worldly life), then we would surely become among those who live by Faith.

103.MunirMezyed2023: Surely, in this there is a Sign. Yet most of them don’t have Faith.

104.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed! Your Lord is the One who is absolutely the Almighty, the Most Merciful.

105.MunirMezyed2023: The people of Noah persistently denied the Messengers (of Allâh).

106.MunirMezyed2023: When their brother Noah said unto them: “ Will you not act piously?

107.MunirMezyed2023: Verily I am a Faithful Messenger (of your Lord) to you,

108.MunirMezyed2023: So act piously towards Allâh and obey me.

109.MunirMezyed2023: I ask of you no reward for (my preaching). My reward comes from the Lord of all the worlds.

110.MunirMezyed2023: Now, therefore, act piously towards Allâh and yield to what has been revealed to me.

111.MunirMezyed2023: They said: “How do you expect us to trust you when you are followed by a group that has the lowest status?’

112.MunirMezyed2023: He said: ‘And what knowledge have I of what they used to do?

113.MunirMezyed2023: Their reckoning rests with none but my Lord- if only you have the ability to perceive.

114.MunirMezyed2023: I am not willing to drive away those who adhere to Faith.

115.MunirMezyed2023: I am  no more  than one who gives you sufficient warning (about how to avoid Hellfire)’

116.MunirMezyed2023: They said: ‘If it happens that you don’t stop (this nonsense), O’ Noah, you will surely be of those who are stoned (to death)’.

117.MunirMezyed2023: He said: "O’ My Lord, indeed, my people accused me of lying,

118.MunirMezyed2023: So do judge between them and me with definitive judgment. And save me along with those who are with me of the monotheistic believers’.

119.MunirMezyed2023: So We saved him and those with him in the laden Ark.

120.MunirMezyed2023: Then, afterward We drowned the others.

121.MunirMezyed2023: Surely, in this there is a Sign. Yet most of them don’t live by Faith.

122.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed! Your Lord is the One who is absolutely the Almighty, the Most Merciful.

123.MunirMezyed2023: (The people of) ‘Ād persistently denied the Messengers (of Allâh).

124.MunirMezyed2023: When Hūd, their brother, said to them: ‘Will you not act piously towards Allâh?

125.MunirMezyed2023: Lo! I am a faithful Messenger of your Lord to you,

126.MunirMezyed2023: Now, therefore, act piously towards Allâh and yield to what has been revealed to me.

127.MunirMezyed2023: I ask of you no reward for (my preaching). My reward comes from the Lord of all the beings.

128.MunirMezyed2023: Do you build on every hill a lofty fortress for vain pleasure?

129.MunirMezyed2023: You take for yourselves strongholds in hope of being eternalized.

130.MunirMezyed2023: Yet when you take an aggressive action, you do it in the same way   tyrants do.

131.MunirMezyed2023: Now, therefore, act piously towards Allâh and yield to what has been revealed to me.

132.MunirMezyed2023: Act piously toward the One who amply provides you with (many great) perceptible gifts.

133.MunirMezyed2023: He provides you with cattle and children,

135.MunirMezyed2023: Lo! Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a hazardous day."

136.MunirMezyed2023: They said: "It is all the same to us whether you preach or whether you are not one of the preachers.

137.MunirMezyed2023: This is no other than the custom and tradition of the ancients,

138.MunirMezyed2023: And we are not going to be chastised’.

139.MunirMezyed2023: So they accused him of lying, then We destroyed them. Surely, in this a there is Sign. Yet most of them don’t live by Faith.

140.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed! Your Lord is the One who is absolutely the Almighty, the Most Merciful.

141.MunirMezyed2023: (The people of) ‘Thamūd persistently denied the Messengers (of Allâh).

142.MunirMezyed2023: When Sālih, their brother, said to them: “Will you act piously towards Allâh?

143.MunirMezyed2023: Lo! I am a faithful Messenger of your Lord to you.

144.MunirMezyed2023: Now, therefore, act piously towards Allâh and yield to what has been revealed to me..

145.MunirMezyed2023: I ask of you no reward for (my preaching). My reward comes from the Lord of all the beings.

146.MunirMezyed2023: ‘(Do you presume that) you will be left secure forever in what is here before us?

148.MunirMezyed2023: Tilled fields and date-palms with slender spathes?

149.MunirMezyed2023: And that you will keep on skillfully craving houses out of mountains?

150.MunirMezyed2023: Now, therefore, act piously towards Allâh and yield to what has been revealed to me.

151.MunirMezyed2023: Don’t yield to the authority of the prodigals

152.MunirMezyed2023: Who excessively indulge in corruption on the earth instead of seeking to make amends’.

153.MunirMezyed2023: They said: ‘You are of those who are bewitched!

154.MunirMezyed2023: You are no more than a human being like us. So bring to us a Sign if you are of the truthful’.

155.MunirMezyed2023: He said: ‘This is a she- camel (that you requested). So she has the right to have a portion of the water to drink as you have yours on an appointed day.

156.MunirMezyed2023: So don’t touch her with evil lest the divine retribution of a great day would seize you’.

157.MunirMezyed2023: However, they hamstrung her, and then they became regretful.

158.MunirMezyed2023: So the divine retribution overtook them. Surely, in this there is a Sign. Yet most of them don’t live by Faith.

159.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed! Your Lord is the One who is absolutely the Almighty, the Most Merciful.

160.MunirMezyed2023: (The people of) ‘Lot  persistently denied  the Messengers (of Allâh).

161.MunirMezyed2023: When ‘Lot, their brother, said to them: “Will you act piously towards Allâh?

162.MunirMezyed2023: Lo! I am a Faithful Messenger of your Lord to you.

163.MunirMezyed2023: So act piously towards Allâh and yield to what has been revealed to me.

164.MunirMezyed2023: I ask of you no rearward for (my preaching). My reward comes from the Lord of all the beings.

165.MunirMezyed2023: What! Of all people you lust after males,

166.MunirMezyed2023: Leaving your wives that your Lord created for you? Nay! You are a transgressing people!’

167.MunirMezyed2023: They said: ‘If it happens that you don’t stop (this nonsense), O’ Lot, you will surely be of those who are outcast’.

168.MunirMezyed2023: He said: ‘I definitely loathe what you do.

169.MunirMezyed2023: O’ my Lord! save me and my family from (the evil of) what they do’.

170.MunirMezyed2023: So We saved him and his family, all,

171.MunirMezyed2023: Except for an old woman-(his wife)- among those who remained behind.

172.MunirMezyed2023: Then afterward We utterly destroyed the others.

173.MunirMezyed2023: And We let (an evil) rain fall upon them. How dreadful was the rain for those who had been warned.

174.MunirMezyed2023: Surely, in this there is a Sign. Yet most of them don’t live by Faith.

175.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed! Your Lord is the One who is absolutely the Almighty, the Most Merciful.

176.MunirMezyed2023: The companions of the Thicket persistently denied  the Messengers (of Allâh),

177.MunirMezyed2023: When Shuʿayb said to them: “Will you act piously?

178.MunirMezyed2023: Lo! I am a Faithful Messenger of your Lord to you.

179.MunirMezyed2023: Now, therefore, act piously towards Allâh and yield to what has been revealed to me.

180.MunirMezyed2023: I ask of you no reward for (preaching). My reward comes from the Lord of all the beings.

181.MunirMezyed2023: Give full measure. Don’t be of those who minify.

182.MunirMezyed2023: And weigh (things) with the true balance!

183.MunirMezyed2023: Don’t underestimate (the value of) the property of the people, or be involved in spreading corruption on the earth.

184.MunirMezyed2023: Now, therefore, act piously towards the One who created you and the former generation’.

185.MunirMezyed2023: They said: ‘You are indeed of those who are bewitched!

186.MunirMezyed2023: You are no more than a human being like us. And we think that you are one of those who invent lying!

187.MunirMezyed2023: Now let a piece of the sky fall upon us if you are of the truthful!"

188.MunirMezyed2023: He said: ‘My Lord has full knowledge of whatever you do’.

189.MunirMezyed2023: They persistently denied him, so the divine retribution of the day of overshadowing overtook them. Surely it was the divine retribution of a serious day.

190.MunirMezyed2023: Surely, in this there is a Sign. Yet most of them don’t live by Faith.

191.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed! Your Lord is the Almighty, the Most Merciful.

192.MunirMezyed2023: Most assuredly, this (Qur’ān) is the Revelation Knowledge from the Lord of all the beings.

193.MunirMezyed2023: The faithful Spirit -(Gabriel)- has brought it down

194.MunirMezyed2023: Upon your heart so that you may give warning

196.MunirMezyed2023: It has been prophesied in the Scriptures of the ancients.

197.MunirMezyed2023: Is it not a Sign for them that those who have spiritual knowledge  among the Children of Israel know it?

198.MunirMezyed2023: If We had revealed the Qur’ān to any other nation than the Arabs,

199.MunirMezyed2023: And he had recited it to them, they would not have believed in It.

200.MunirMezyed2023: This is how We let It pass unheeded though the hearts of Ungodly Sinners.

201.MunirMezyed2023: They will never believe in It until they see the painful torment.

202.MunirMezyed2023: The torment will fall upon them unexpectedly, when they lack the ability to perceive it.

203.MunirMezyed2023: Then they will say: ‘Are we going to obtain a respite?’

204.MunirMezyed2023: Do they still hope for Our retribution to be hastened?

205.MunirMezyed2023: What do you see even if We give them respite for years

206.MunirMezyed2023: And then there comes to them that with which they are threatened,

207.MunirMezyed2023: All that which they used to enjoy won’t  benefit them?

208.MunirMezyed2023: We never destroyed a town without prior warning.

209.MunirMezyed2023: We have never been unjust to anyone.

210.MunirMezyed2023: It is not the devils who have brought down this (Qur’ān)

211.MunirMezyed2023: It will neither be convenient for them, nor they will be able (to produce It).

212.MunirMezyed2023: Surely they are completely debarred even from hearing It.

213.MunirMezyed2023: So don’t invoke another god along with Allâh lest you become of those who will be chastised.

214.MunirMezyed2023: Now, therefore, warn your tribe of near kindred (of the consequences of their iniquitous deeds)!

215.MunirMezyed2023: And lower your wing to those Monotheistic Believers who follow you!

216.MunirMezyed2023: And If it happens that they fail to yield to your command, then say: "Indeed, I am free (of responsibility) for whatever you are doing’.

217.MunirMezyed2023: And depend on the Almighty, the Most Merciful with full trust,

218.MunirMezyed2023: Who sees you when you arise (in the midnight to pray)

219.MunirMezyed2023: And your arduous effort in prostration among those who prostrate.

220.MunirMezyed2023: Most assuredly He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.

221.MunirMezyed2023: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?

222.MunirMezyed2023: They descend upon every sinful impostor.

223.MunirMezyed2023: They give ear, but most of them are liars.

224.MunirMezyed2023: And the Poets are followed by those who keep on falling into temptation.

225.MunirMezyed2023: Do you not see that they wander in every valley,

226.MunirMezyed2023: And that they say what they don’t strive diligently to achieve?

227.MunirMezyed2023: Except for those (poets) who live by the Faith, strive to do righteous acts, celebrate the praise of Allâh frequently, and vindicate themselves whenever they have tendency to yield to their own whim. Those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned Faith in favour of their own whims  will come to know by what overturning they will be overturned.

1.MunirMezyed2023: Ta. Si’in! These are the Verses of the Qur’ān and the irrefutable Book.

2.MunirMezyed2023: (This Qur’ān) is the True Source of Enlightenment and Glad Tidings to those who live a life of Genuine Faith,

3.MunirMezyed2023: Who duly perform the prescribed prayers, who pay the prescribed Zakāt and who have Absolute Faith in Hereafter.

4.MunirMezyed2023: Regarding those who persistently refuse to acknowledge the existence of the Hereafter, We have made their (iniquitous) deeds appealing to them so that they may continue to wander blindly.

5.MunirMezyed2023: It is they who will be subjected to the severest punishment. And in the Hereafter, they will be the ones who are doomed to face perdition.

6.MunirMezyed2023: And truly you are receiving this Qur’ān from the presence of One who is All-Wise, All-Knowing.

7.MunirMezyed2023: And (mention) when Moses said to his family: "Surely I see in the distance a fire, I will go and bring you news from there, or I will bring you a burning torch so that you may warm yourselves.

8.MunirMezyed2023: As soon as he reached it, he was called: “Blessed is whosoever is in the fire, and whosoever is round it! All Glory Be To Allâh, the Lord of all the beings!

9.MunirMezyed2023: O’ Moses! Most assuredly, it is I, Allâh, the Almighty, the All-Wise.

10.MunirMezyed2023: And now cast down your stick!” When he saw it slithering like a  serpent, he turned his back in flight and didn’t come back. (Then he was called again): "O’ Moses, don’t be afraid. Lo! The Messengers (of Allâh) don’t (have a reason) to be afraid in My Presence,

11.MunirMezyed2023: Except for the one who has abandoned My Command in favour of his own whims and afterwards changes evil for good. And Lo! I am Oft- Forgiving, Most Merciful.

12.MunirMezyed2023: And now put your (right) hand into your bosom, it will come forth glittering white without patches (on the skin). (These are) among the Nine  Signs (to show them) to Pharaoh and his clan. Indeed, they are a people who indulge in personal disobedience extensively without repentance”.

13.MunirMezyed2023: But when Our Signs (of power & glory) were preformed before them, they said: “This is an apparent sorcery (and devilry)”.

14.MunirMezyed2023: They became impious (and hostile) to them unjustly and arrogantly, although their own selves were convinced thereof. So look and see how (dreadful) was the end of those who spread corruption!

15.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed, We endowed David and Solomon with knowledge of truth. And they said: "All the praise unto Allâh who has preferred us above so many of His Pious servants!”

16.MunirMezyed2023: And Solomon was David's heir. He said: “O’ people, we have been taught the language of birds, and been given of all things. This is indeed an apparent act of kindness beyond what is due.”

17.MunirMezyed2023: Solomon’s forces of jinn, men, and birds were assembled before him and lined in orderly ranks.

18.MunirMezyed2023: Until, when they came upon the valley of the ants, one of the ants said: “O’ ants, go quickly into your dwellings, lest Solomon and his soldiers unconsciously crush you."

19.MunirMezyed2023: So Solomon smiled exuberantly at its words and prayed: “O’ My Lord, grant me the power to be grateful to You for Your generous favor which You have bestowed upon me and my parents so as to behave righteously in a manner that will be well-pleasing to You. And admit me by Your Mercy among Your righteous servants.”

20.MunirMezyed2023: He inspected the birds and said: "How is it that I don’t see the hoopoe here? Or is it among the absentees?

21.MunirMezyed2023: I will definitely punish it with a stern punishment, or slaughter it, unless it brings me good reason.”

22.MunirMezyed2023: However, the hoopoe has not tarried too long. (After returning), it said: “I have compassed which you have not compassed. And I have come to you from Saba with true news.”

23.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed, I found (there) a woman ruling over them, who is blessed with everything, possessing a majestic throne.

24.MunirMezyed2023: And I found her and her people venerating and idolizing the sun instead of Allâh. The devil has made their (iniquitous deed) appealing to them. Thus, he was able to keep them away from the (right) path so that they may continue living in spiritual darkness.

25.MunirMezyed2023: Do they not prostrate themselves to Allâh Who brings forth whatever is hidden in the heavens and the earth, and who has full knowledge of whatever you hide and whatever you disclose?

26.MunirMezyed2023: (It is) Allâh, there is no other god beside Him, the Lord of the Supreme Throne.”

27.MunirMezyed2023: Then Solomon said: "We shall (investigate) and see whether you are telling (us) the truth, or you are of the liars.

28.MunirMezyed2023: Now go with this letter of mine and throw it down to them. Then turn back from them and see what they will return."

29.MunirMezyed2023: She - (the queen of Sheba)- said: "O’ noble chiefs, an honorable letter has been thrown to me.

30.MunirMezyed2023: It is indeed from (king) Solomon. And it says: 'In the name of Allâh, the True Merciful (God), the Most Merciful.

31.MunirMezyed2023: Don’t act arrogantly toward me, but come to me in submission.’”

32.MunirMezyed2023: She added: "O’ noble chiefs, advise me what I should do regarding this matter of mine. I‘d never decide anything unless you were present with me."

33.MunirMezyed2023: They said: "We do possess the quality of being strong and the quality of being brave in battle, but the command is yours. So think carefully about what you will command."

34.MunirMezyed2023: She said: “Surely the kings, when they enter a township, they sabotage it and degrade its noblemen. This is what they do.

35.MunirMezyed2023: Surely I am going to send a gift to them and see what (response) the messengers will bring.”

36.MunirMezyed2023: So when (the envoy) came to (king) Solomon, he said: “Do you think we seek financial support? What Allâh has given me is far better than that which He has given you. Nay, but it is you who are rejoicing in your gift!

37.MunirMezyed2023: Return to them! We shall definitely come to them with an army which they have no power to confront. And we shall definitely drive them out from there, dishonored and completely debased."

38.MunirMezyed2023: He said: "O’ noble chiefs, which of you can bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?"

39.MunirMezyed2023: One extremely strong among the jinn said: "I will bring it to you before you rise from your place. Indeed, I am strong and trustworthy for such work."

40.MunirMezyed2023: But one who had knowledge of the book said: "I will bring it to you within the twinkling of an eye!" Then, when he saw it settled before him, he said: ‘This is a grace of my Lord so as to test me whether I will show gratitude or become impious. So whoever shows gratitude does so to the benefit of his own self. And whoever becomes impious (needs to know that) my Lord is most assuredly Self-sufficient, Most Generous’.

41.MunirMezyed2023: He said: "Now disguise her throne for her! And let us see whether she will yield to the truth or be of those who are living spiritual darkness."

42.MunirMezyed2023: So, when she came, it was said (unto her): "Is your throne like this?" She said: "It is similar in every detail”. (king Solomon said): “We were given the knowledge before her. And we had submitted ourselves (entirely to Allâh)".

43.MunirMezyed2023: What she used to worship, other than Allâh, prevented her (from submitting to Allâh), for she belonged to a people who were spiritually dead and blind.

44.MunirMezyed2023: It was said to her: "Enter the lofty Palace". But when she saw it, she thought it was a pool, so bared her legs. (Solomon) said: "Indeed, it is a palace paved with crystal". She said: "My Lord, indeed I have unfair to  myself (when I have abandoned Faith in favour of my own whims). Now I submit (myself entirely) along with Solomon to Allâh, the Lord of all the beings."

45.MunirMezyed2023: And verily We sent to (the people of) Thamūd their brother Sālih, saying: "Worship Allâh (in the way He wants you to worship him). But (When he started preaching to them), they split into two parties quarreling with each other”.

46.MunirMezyed2023: He said: "O’ my people, why do you seek to hasten on the evil before than good? Why do you not ask forgiveness of Allâh so that you may be delivered from the consequences of your iniquitous deeds.”

47.MunirMezyed2023: They said: "We augur bad omen from your part and from those who chose to follow you”. He said: "Allâh has made Your evil augury await you. You are a people who keep falling into temptation”.

48.MunirMezyed2023: In the city (of Thamūd), there was a company of nine persons (among their chiefs), who were indulging in corruption in the land, and were not willing to make amends.

49.MunirMezyed2023: They said: "Let us swear one to another by Allâh that we shall make a sudden attack on him and his family by night. Then we will surely say to his near relatives: “We were not present when they were slain. We are indeed telling the truth”.

50.MunirMezyed2023: So they devised an evil plan on the very spot, and We likewise planned a plan on the very spot. But they didn’t perceive (what the dire consequences of their evil plan would be).

51.MunirMezyed2023: Thus, look and see how (dreadful) was the outcome of their evil plan. And lo! We destroyed them completely, together with all their people.

52.MunirMezyed2023: So those then are their houses empty and left deserted because they have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims. Surely, in this, there is a Sign (of Allâh’s power & glory) for a people who have spiritual gift of knowledge.

53.MunirMezyed2023: And We saved those who lived by Faith and used to act piously.

54.MunirMezyed2023: And (mention) Lot when he said to his people: “What! Do you commit such an indecency, overtly, while you see?

55.MunirMezyed2023: What! Do you indeed approach men lustfully instead of women? Nay, but you are truly a people living in utter ignorance.”

56.MunirMezyed2023: Yet the only response of his people was that they said: "Drive out the family of Lot from your city. Indeed, they are a people who would like to keep themselves pure and immaculate”.

57.MunirMezyed2023: So We saved him and his family, except for his (sinful) wife. We destined for her to be one of those who lagged behind.

58.MunirMezyed2023: And We poured down upon them a shower (of stones of hard clay). How dreadful was the shower for those who had been warned.

59.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "All praise is due to Allâh! And peace be upon His (Pious) servants whom He has chosen. Is Allâh better or (the fabled gods) they associate with Him?"

60.MunirMezyed2023: Is not He (better than the fabled gods)? For He is the One Who created the heavens and the earth, sending down for you water from the sky, causing to grow thereby gardens of delightful beauty, which you could not have grown the trees thereof. What! Is there any god other than Allâh? Nay! But they are (ignorant) people who ascribe equals to Him.

61.MunirMezyed2023: Is not He (better than the fabled gods)? For He is the One Who has made the earth a stable place where He placed rivers in its midst, appointed for it firm hills and set up a barrier between the two seas. What! Is there any god other than Allâh? Nay! But most of them don't  have sufficient knowledge (of Allâh's power & glory).

62.MunirMezyed2023: Is not He (better than the fabled gods)? For He is the One Who answers the desperate one when he calls upon Him, and Who removes the evil (that touches you) and makes you inheritors of the earth. What! Is there any god other than Allâh? How little you celebrate His praise and declare His glory.

63.MunirMezyed2023: Is not He (better than the fabled gods)? For He is the One Who leads you out of the veils of darkness of the land and the sea, and Who sends the winds as a herald of glad tidings before His Mercy. What! Is there any god other than Allâh? Highly Exalted is Allâh above all that which they associate with Him as partners.

64.MunirMezyed2023: Is not He (better than the fabled gods)? For He is the One Who originates the creation, then repeats it, and Who supplies you with provision from the heaven and earth. What! Is there any god other than Allâh? Say: "Bring forth your decisive evidence if you are truthful".

65.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "No one in the heavens or on the earth does (really) know the (secrets of) unseen except Allâh, neither do they perceive when they will be resurrected."

66.MunirMezyed2023: Nay, their knowledge fails them as to grasp the Hereafter. But the fact is that they are skeptical about it. The truth is that they are kept blind to it.

67.MunirMezyed2023: Those who voluntarily and consciously refuse to Yield to the Truth  say: "What! When we and our forefathers become dust, shall we really be brought forth (again)?

68.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, we and our forefathers have been promised this  before. This is no more than legends of the ancients."

69.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "Travel in the land and see how (dreadful) was the end of the Ungodly Sinners.”

70.MunirMezyed2023: Don’t  grieve for them, nor be distressed by their evil schemes.

71.MunirMezyed2023: They say: “When will this promise be fulfilled if you are truthful?”

72.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "It may well be that something of that which you seek to hasten has drawn quite near behind you.

73.MunirMezyed2023: Indeed, your Lord is extremely bountiful for mankind. Yet most of them don’t show gratitude.”

74.MunirMezyed2023: Most certainly, Allâh has full knowledge of whatever their hearts conceal and whatever they disclose.

75.MunirMezyed2023: There is nothing in the heavens or on the earth, but it is recorded in an explicit book.

76.MunirMezyed2023: Most certainly, this Qur’ān narrates to the Children of Israel most of that about which they differ.

77.MunirMezyed2023: It is certainly a True Source of Enlightenment and Mercy  for a people who live a life of Genuine Faith-(seeking salvation).

78.MunirMezyed2023: Most certainly, your Lord will decide between them by His Judgment. He is the Almighty, the All-Knowing.

79.MunirMezyed2023: So depend on Allâh with full trust! You are absolutely on the apparent truth.

80.MunirMezyed2023: Surely you cannot make the one who is (spiritually) dead hear the truth. Nor can you make those who are deaf hear the call, (mostly) when they go back retreating.

81.MunirMezyed2023: Nor can you make the ones who are (spiritually) blind come out of their deception. You can make none hear the truth except the ones who have absolute faith in Our Revelations, wholly submitting (themselves to Allâh).

82.MunirMezyed2023: And When the time for the fulfillment of the Word against them is about to come, We will bring forth for them out of the earth a living creature saying to them that people had no faith in Our Revelations.

83.MunirMezyed2023: And (mention) the day when We shall gather from every nation a group of those who persistently denied Our Signs, and they will be set in rows.

84.MunirMezyed2023: Till, when they arrive (at the place of reckoning), He will say: Did you deny My revelations when you couldn’t encompass them in knowledge, or what was it that you used to do?"

85.MunirMezyed2023: And the Word ( of punishment) will be fulfilled against them because they have voluntarily and consciously abandoned Faith in favour of their own whims.Thus, they will be incapable of speaking .

86.MunirMezyed2023: Have they not seen how We made the night for them to rest therein, and the day for them to see? Most certainly, there are Signs (of Allâh's power and glory) for a people who live a life of Genuine Faith.

87.MunirMezyed2023: And (mention) the day when the Trumpet is blown. So all those who are in the heavens and on the earth will be paralyzed with fear except those whom Allâh intends to exempt. All will come to him, completely humbled.

88.MunirMezyed2023: And you will see the mountains which you think to be solid passing by like clouds. This is the artistic work of Allâh, who perfected everything.  Most certainly,He has full knowledge of whatever you do.

89.MunirMezyed2023: And whoever brings a single righteous deed will have better than it, and such will be saved from the horror of that day.

90.MunirMezyed2023: And whoever brings a single evil deed, such will be thrown down on their faces into the Fire. (They will be told): "Are you requited except for that which you used to do?"

91.MunirMezyed2023: (Say): "I have been commanded only to worship the Lord of this city, (Mecca), who has sanctified it. And unto Him belong all things. I am commanded to be one of those who wholly submit (to Allâh),

92.MunirMezyed2023: And to recite the Qur'an." Therefore whoever chooses to walks on the path of truth, it is only for his own self-interest. And say to whoever falls away from the Faith: “I am only a Messenger giving warning.”

93.MunirMezyed2023: Say: "All praise is due to Allâh! He will show you His Signs (of power & glory), and you will be able to recognize them. Your Lord has full knowledge of whatever you do.

1.MunirMezyed2023: Ta. Si’in. Mim!

2.MunirMezyed2023: These are the Verses of the irrefutable Book,

3.MunirMezyed2023: We narrate to you the story of Moses and Pharaoh with truth for a people who live a life of Genuine Faith.

4.MunirMezyed2023: Most certainly, Pharaoh had exalted himself in the land and divided its people into sects: persecuting one (ethnic) group, slaughtering their sons and sparing their women. Surely, he was one of those who spread corruption.

5.MunirMezyed2023: However, We intended to bestow Our favor upon those who are persecuted in the land to make them (spiritual) leaders and inheritors,

6.MunirMezyed2023: And to establish them in the land with authority, but in the meantime, we intended to let Pharaoh, Hāmān and their hosts experience that of which they were apprehensive.

7.MunirMezyed2023: And We inspired the mother of Moses: "Suckle him! But when you fear for his life, cast him into the river. And do not let your heart be troubled. We shall definitely bring him back to you and make him one of (Our) Messengers.”

8.MunirMezyed2023: Then the family of Pharaoh picked him up so that he might become an enemy of them, and (a source of) grief. Surely, Pharaoh, Hāmān and their hosts were sinful people.

9.MunirMezyed2023: The wife of Pharaoh said: “(This is a) source of comfort for me, as well as for you. So don’t kill him! Perhaps he may be useful to us or we may adopt him as a son.” They were not aware of (what fate had in store for them).

10.MunirMezyed2023: And the heart of Moses’ mother became hollow. She would have almost disclosed (the truth about) him if We had not strengthened her heart (with Faith) so that she would be of those who place their Faith (in Allâh).

11.MunirMezyed2023: And she said to his sister: "Go and follow him!” Thus, she secretly watched him from a distance while they were not aware (of her observation).

12.MunirMezyed2023: And We had already forbidden wet nurses for him. So (his sister) said: "Shall I direct you to a household that will nurse him for you, and sincerely they will take good care of him?"

13.MunirMezyed2023: So We restored him to his mother so that her eyes might delight, and that she might no grieve, and that she might know that the promise of Allâh is true. But most of them don’t know.

14.MunirMezyed2023: And when he attained his full strength and became mature, We bestowed upon him the authority (of moral judgments) and spiritual  knowledge. This is how We do reward those who pursue righteousness and perfection in Faith.

15.MunirMezyed2023: (One day) he surreptitiously entered the city without being noticed by its people. He found therein two men fighting: one of his own ethnicity, and the other of his enemies. The one from his own ethnicity called on him for help against his foe. So Moses struck him upon the face with his fist and (unintentionally) killed him. He said: ”This (fighting) is an act of devil. Indeed, he is a genuine deceiver and veritable enemy.”

16.MunirMezyed2023: He said: “My Lord, surely I have wronged myself, so forgive me." Then He forgave him. Indeed, He is the One who is the Oft-Forgiving, the Most Merciful.

17.MunirMezyed2023: He said: "My Lord, for the favor You have bestowed upon me, I’ll never support the Ungodly Sinners."

18.MunirMezyed2023: In the morning he was in the city, fearful, vigilant, when unexpectedly the man who had sought his help the day before called him again for his help. Moses said to him: "You are obviously a petulant person."

19.MunirMezyed2023: So when he intended to attack the man who was an enemy to both of them, the man said: “O’ Moses, do you want to kill me as you killed a man yesterday? You seek nothing but to be a tyrant in the land. And you don’t want to be one of those who make amends.”

20.MunirMezyed2023: Then a man came running from the farthest end of the city and said: “Moses, the noble chiefs are consulting together to slay you. So I advise you to leave (the city as soon as possible). Indeed, I am giving you a good advice.”

21.MunirMezyed2023: He fled the city, fearful, vigilant, saying: "My Lord, save me from the iniquitous people."

22.MunirMezyed2023: And when he directed himself towards Midian, he said: “I do hope that my Lord will lead me to the right way."

23.MunirMezyed2023: And when he arrived at the well of Midian, he found a group of people there watering their flocks, and besides them he saw two women holding back their flock from the water. He asked (the two women): "What is the matter with you?" They replied: "We cannot water (our flocks) until the shepherds move away. (As you see, we are hopeless two women) and our father is an old man.”

24.MunirMezyed2023: So he watered their flocks for them. Then he turned aside into the shade, and said: “My Lord! Indeed, I am in need of whatever good You send down upon me.”

25.MunirMezyed2023: Then one of the two women came to him walking bashfully, and said: “Indeed, my father would like to invite you so as to pay you for watering our flocks.” So when Moses came to him and told him his whole story, he said: “Don’t be afraid! You have escaped from the iniquitous people."

26.MunirMezyed2023: One of the two daughters said: "O’ my father, employ him! The best one you can employ is the strong and the trustworthy."

27.MunirMezyed2023: He said: "I intend to let you wed one of these, my two daughters, on the condition that you serve me for eight years. But if you complete ten years, then it will be (a favor) from your part. I have no intention of letting you work extremely hard. You will find me, if Allâh wills, one of the righteous."

28.MunirMezyed2023: He said: “This will be between you and me. Whichever of the two terms I fulfill, there will be no injustice done to me, and Allâh is Surety over what we say.

29.MunirMezyed2023: Then, when Moses had fulfilled the term, and was travelling with his family, he spotted a fire on the side of the Mount (Sinai). He said to his family: “Stay where you are! I have seen a fire far off. I may bring you from there some information or a burning brand from the fire so that you may warm yourselves."

30.MunirMezyed2023: And when he reached it, he was called from the bush in the sacred ground to the right side of the valley: "O’ Moses, surely I am Allâh, the Lord of all the beings.

31.MunirMezyed2023: Now, cast down your stick!” When he saw it slithering like a serpent, he turned in flight and did not turn back. (Then he was called again): "O’ Moses, come forward and don’t be afraid! You are indeed of those who are secure.

32.MunirMezyed2023: (Now), put your (right) hand into your bosom, it will come forth glittering white without patches (on the skin). Hold your arms close to you as protection from fear. So these will be two irrefutable Signs from your Lord to Pharaoh and his personal advisors: for truly they are a people indulging in personal disobedience extensively without repentance.

33.MunirMezyed2023: He said: "My Lord! Indeed, I killed a man and I fear that they will kill me.

34.MunirMezyed2023: My brother Aaron is more eloquent than me in speech. So let him accompany me as a minster to support what I say. I (also) fear that they will accuse me of lying.”

35.MunirMezyed2023: Allâh said: "We will strengthen your arm through your brother and give you both supremacy so they will not be able to harm you. With Our Signs, you and those who follow you will be the victorious.”

36.MunirMezyed2023: But when Moses came to them with Our irrefutable Signs, they said: "This is nothing but a fabricated sorcery (and devilry). We never heard of such a thing among our forefathers."

37.MunirMezyed2023: And Moses said: "My Lord knows the one who brings the Knowledge of Truth from Him, and the one who shall have the ultimate abode of ecstasy (in the Hereafter). Indeed, those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims will never achieve their aims.

38.MunirMezyed2023: And Pharaoh said: O’ noble chiefs, I don’t know that you have another god besides me. So kindle for me, O’ Hāmān, a fire upon the clay and construct  for me a lofty tower so that I can have a look at the God of Moses. For I am inclined to believe that he is a liar.”

39.MunirMezyed2023: He and his hosts acted arrogantly in the land without right, and they thought that they would not be brought back to Us.

40.MunirMezyed2023: So We seized him and his hosts. And We threw them all into the sea. So look and see how (dreadful) was the end of those who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims.

41.MunirMezyed2023: And We made them leaders inviting (people) to the Fire, and on the Day of Resurrection, they won’t be helped.

42.MunirMezyed2023: And We have caused a curse to chase them in this worldly life, and on the Day of Resurrection, they will be among the despicable.

43.MunirMezyed2023: Verily, We gave Moses, after We had utterly destroyed the former generations, the Scripture as spiritual insight for the people, as well as a True Source of Enlightenment and Mercy so that they may be mindful (of their obligations towards Allâh, toward themselves and others).

44.MunirMezyed2023: You were not there on the western side (of the Mount) when We revealed to Moses the commandment, neither were you among the witnesses.

45.MunirMezyed2023: And We raised up many generations (after Moses), then life became prolonged to them. You were not one of the inhabitants of Midian, reciting to them Our Verses. But it is We who persist in sending Messengers (in order to invite people to worship Allâh in the way He wants them to worship Him.).

46.MunirMezyed2023: You were not present at the side of the Mount Sinai when We called out (to Moses), but (We have revealed this to you) as a Mercy from your Lord so that you may give warning to a people who had not been warned  before you, and that they may be  admonished.

47.MunirMezyed2023: Otherwise, if a catastrophe should strike them for (their evil deeds) which their hands have sent forth, , they might say: "Our Lord, why did You not send to us a Messenger so that we might have yielded to what you have revealed of the knowledge of the truth, and been of those who live a life of Genuine Faith?"

48.MunirMezyed2023: But when the Truth has come to them from Us, they say: " Why is he not given the like of what was given to Moses? Did they not reject the truth of what was given to Moses before? They say: "Two kinds of sorcery- (the Torah & the Qur’ān) - supporting each other!" They say: “Indeed, to both of them, we pledge not to give credence."

49.MunirMezyed2023: Say: ‘Then bring a Scripture from Allâh that is better in enlightenment than these two, that I may follow it, if you are truthful’.

50.MunirMezyed2023: But if they don’t answer you, then be sure that they yield to their own whims. And who is going further away (from the path of truth) than the one who yields to his own whims (and walks) without being directed by the Light of Allâh? Surely Allâh holds back the light of His inspiration  from a people who have voluntarily and consciously abandoned the Full Knowledge of the Truth in favour of their own whims.

51.MunirMezyed2023: Surely, We have conveyed to them the Word so that they may take heed.

52.MunirMezyed2023: (Many of) those to whom We gave the Scripture before the Qur’ān, they believe in It.

53.MunirMezyed2023: And when it is recited to them, they say: "We believe in It. Indeed, it is the (absolute) truth from our Lord. Surely we submitted ourselves (completely to Allâh) before It (was revealed).

54.MunirMezyed2023: Those will be given their reward twice over for having endured    patiently, having repelled evil with good and having expended of what we have provided them.

55.MunirMezyed2023: And when they use to hear evil vain talk, they turn away therefrom and  say: "We will be held accountable for our deeds and you will be held accountable for yours. Peace be upon you! We don’t desire (to associate ourselves with) the ignorant.”

56.MunirMezyed2023: Surely you cannot lead whom you desire to attain spiritual expansion, but Allâh leads whom He wills to attain spiritual expansion, and He has full knowledge of  those who are walking on the path of truth.
